Zaliko is from the village of Ptena. He is 22 years old and lives with his parents and his 21-year-old brother. Agriculture is the only source of income for the family, and all family members are involved in it. They have 2 milk cows and sell home-made cheese at the local market. The family owns 6.5 hectares of land, where they grow potatoes, wheat and barley. Zaliko sells the harvested products to local retailers. The family's total average monthly income is 700 GEL. 

Zaliko has requested a loan to purchase a mini tractor, which will provide an additional source of family income in several ways. Firstly, Zaliko will use it for seasonal work on the farm and thus save the usual tractor rental costs; secondly Zaliko and his brother will use it to provide tilling services to neighboring farmers, thereby earning additional income. The family will use the increased income to purchase additional household goods in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-tractor

loans.name: Alimatu

texts.en: Alimatu has been cooking banku for sale in Ampenyi, near Elmina, for some time. She serves the banku (a local dish made from corn dough) with fried fish, pepper and tomato sauce. Alimatu is married to a farmer and has 10 dependents. She uses her income to assist her husband in paying their accommodation bills. Alimatu will use her loan to purchase bags of maize and fish to prepare banku for sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her expanded business to mount a better stall to sell her cooked banku and fish.

loans.use: to purchase bags of maize and fish to prepare banku

loans.name: Julio Ernesto

texts.es:
Julio, es taxista, vive con su esposa y dos hijos de 18 y 15 años de edad, viven en casa propia, su familia depende de él, trabaja todos los días recorriendo las calles de la ciudad en busca de clientes.
Él solicita un préstamo para reparar el vehículo, ya que le está dando problemas y quiere enviarlo al mecánico, para mantenerlo en buen estado y ofrecer seguridad en los viajes a los clientes.
La aspiración de Julio es obtener a futuro un taxi más nuevo, cubrir de sus ingresos las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en: Julio is a taxi driver, he lives with his wife and 2 children who are 18 and 15 years old; they live in their own home.  His family depends on him; he works everyday scouring the streets looking for clients.  He solicits a loan in order to repair the vehicle which is giving him problems and he would like to send it to the mechanic for repairs and so it stays in working order; this way he can assure safety to his passengers.  His aspirations are to acquire a newer model for a taxi and with his earnings, be able to cover the family expenses.

loans.use: to pay the mechanic and buy replacement parts.

loans.name: Matthew

texts.en:
Matt lives in Homewood, Alabama with his seven-year-old daughter and owns Roly Poly Sandwich Shop. Originally started in Atlanta, Roly Poly Sandwich Shop offers a nutritious lunch option with healthy sandwiches, soups, and salads. Matt has 10 years of managerial experience in twp different Roly Poly locations and in 2006 looked to move to the next level by purchasing a franchise in order to offer his daughter a better quality of life. He purchased a location in Hoover, Alabama with his coworker turned business partner, and has run the location successfully since 2006. In addition to the restaurant, they also offer various catering options. 

In the future Matt hopes to expand his involvement in Roly Poly by franchising additional locations across Alabama. This current loan will be used to purchase new equipment (such as a frozen yogurt machine) and expand their marketing.

loans.use: to purchase new equipment and expand marketing.

loans.name: Soeung

texts.en: Mrs. Soeung, age 37, is the mother of 2 school-aged children. She has been living in the Baray district of Kompong Tom province. Soeung operates a business selling fresh fish, which she buys in bulk from her suppliers and from her husband, who fishes in the Tonle Sap River. She is able to generate an income of $2.40 per day with this business. Soeung is taking out a loan from HKL and Kiva to purchase a motorcycle, which will provide good transportation for her fish-selling business. She plans to sell fish in more distant areas in order to earn additional income for her family. In the future, Soeung hopes that she will be able to expand and decorate her house.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Harmoni Indah 2 Group

texts.en: Tri is 45 years old and married with two children who are still attending school. She started selling merchandise on credit six years ago and has gained a fair number of customers so far. She sells merchandise door to door around her neighborhood. She help her husband pay expenses for their family and for their two young children's education. With the help of this loan, Tri will add more variety of merchandise and hopes to have her own store in the future. Other group members will use their loans to improve their business such as selling snacks and general store.

loans.use: to pay for bed linen, mattresses, and clothes to sell on credit.

loans.name: Daniil

texts.ru:
Даниил живет и занимается сельским хозяйством в селе Малая Кардашинка. Он содержит теплицы и выращивает в них ранние сельхоз культуры. На участке земли в 45 соток он выращивает ранние овощи: 3 тонны редиса, 4 500 кустов помидор, 2 000 кустов огурцов, а также 20 000 кустов капусты и 10 000 перца. Фермерством Даниил занимается уже 20 лет. В хозяйство вложено около 70 000 гривен. 

Даниилу необходим кредит в размере 20 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить удобрения и химикаты на 5 000 гривен, пленку на 8 000 гривен, семена на 3 000 гривен и закончить строительство дополнительной теплицы на 4 000 гривен. Увеличение дохода за счет хороших урожаев и дополнительных продаж позволит Даниилу получить дополнительную прибыль и возможность содержать свою семью. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Daniil lives and farms in the village of Malaya Kardashinka.  He has greenhouses and grows early crops.  On a piece of land 0.45ha in size, he grows early vegetables:  3 tons of radishes, 4,500 tomato plants, 2,000 cucumber plants, as well as 20,000 head of cabbage and 10,000 pepper plants.  Daniil has been a farmer for 20 years and he has invested about 70,000 UAH in his farm. 

Daniil is in need of a loan of 20,000 UAH, with which he will buy fertilizer and pesticide for 5,000 UAH, greenhouse film for 8,000 UAH, seed for 3,000 UAH, and finish building an additional greenhouse for 4,000 UAH.  The increase in his income from good harvests and additional sales will enable Daniil 
to earn additional income and give him the means to support his family.  
Note:  story in Russian

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide in the amount of 5,000 UAH, greenhouse film for 8,000 UAH, seed for 3,000 UAH, and finish building an additional greenhouse for 4,000 UAH

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry lives in Miami, Florida and owns Diamond Boutique. Diamond Boutique is an online distributor of women’s clothing, handbags, shoes, and accessories. Jerry originally began this venture as a small handbag distributor and had it quickly gain popularity and grow into a successful women's boutique. Even with growth, Jerry stuck to the dynamics of a small boutique and continues to buy locally and provide his products at competitive rates. He has acquired many local clients as well as expanded into California, Missouri, North Carolina, and South Carolina. 

The purpose of this loan is to expand his inventory for the up-and-coming spring collection. He would also like to use it to expand his professional network and better suit his business with top-of-the-line customer service.

loans.use: to purchase bulk inventory and reform customer service.

loans.name: Akosua

texts.en: Akosua  cooks   rice and fish stew  for sale at Ampayin near Elmina.  Akosua  is married to a fisherman  and has four children.  She has been in this business for three years.  She uses her income to help her husband to feed and clothe her children and pay their school fees.  She will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and fish to cook for sale. With the new profit,  Akosua plans to build a better stall for the sale of her food.

loans.use: purchase bags of rice and fish to cook for sale.

loans.name: Adjoa

texts.en: Adjoa  is a widow and has five children. She sells 'gari' - cassava grits - at Ampanyi  near Elmina.  As a single parent, Adjoa uses her income to feed and clothe her children and pay their school fees. Adjoa needs this loan to purchase bags of 'gari' for sale. With new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase bags of 'gari' for sale.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a resident and a farmer in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya. He lives with his family of 3 within the town of Nkubu. He has been actively farming for 17 years, producing and selling maize, beans and milk locally. He gets additional income from his retail shop business.

David has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to help him build a zero grazing unit and buy an ox plow. He says this will reduce his plowing costs and earn him additional income since other farmers will hire him to plow for them. He adds that the zero grazing unit will improve feeding for his animals. David points at unpredictable weather conditions as the major challenge in the farming business.

loans.use: To build a zero grazing unit and to buy an ox plow

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: Candelaria de 31 años vive con su bebé de 18 meses de nacidos, en el municipio de Soledad, a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla. Allí tiene un negocio con el que genera los ingresos principales para el sostenimiento de su hogar y con el sueña hacerlo crecer,  para lograr aumentar el bienestar de su familia y potenciar el desarrollo exitosos de su hijo. Cuando en el año 2000 inició su negocio, lo hizo con un pequeño capital, una vitrina y un poco de surtido; con sus ganancias y su disciplina de trabajo, logró un crecimiento gradual  compró una vitrina de segunda para ordenar sus mercancías y exhibirlas apropiadamente. En la actualidad su proveedor la surte de mercancía a consignación, pero ella desea crecer por eso busca la forma de comprar en efectivo y en mayor cantidad y de diversificar sus proveedores. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  mediante el cual comprará útiles escolares, interiores, chancletas entre otros productos, aprovechando la época de ingresos de los estudiantes a clase, el cual es un momento de gran despliegue de ventas y sus ingresos se incrementan. Mientras tanto su meta, de obtener mas adelante su propia casa,  sigue en pie y Candelaria trabaja mucho para lograrla algún día y poco a poco, porque su mayor desafío es el tener el capital de trabajo suficiente para lograr invertir y salir rápidamente adelante. En su negocio sus cuentas por cobrar rotan cada 7 días, sus inventarios rotan cada 14 y mantienen una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 38%, indicadores financieros desde los cuales se proyecta su negocio.
texts.en:
Candelaria is 31 years old, lives with her 18 month old son, in the municipality of Soledad, 15 minutes away from the city of Barranquilla.  She has a business with which she generates the main income to support her home and she dreams with growing it to increase the well being of her family and enable a successful development for her son.
When she started her business in the year 2000, she had little capital, a display cabinet and some merchandise; with her income and work ethic, she was able to grow gradually and bought a second display cabinet to organize and display merchandise appropriately.  Currently her vendor provides merchandise on consignment, but she wants to grow and is looking for the way to buy with cash and in larger quantities as well as to work with different vendors.  For this reason she came to credikiva, her first loan through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will buy school supplies, clothing, sandals and other products, taking advantage of the season in which the students have spending money, which is a great season for sales and her income will increase. In the meantime, her goal to buy her own house is still standing and Candelaria works hard to achieve that one day, her biggest challenge is to have working capital to invest and get ahead faster.  Her collecting cycle is 7 days and her inventory cycle is 14 days, she has a profit margin on sales of no less than 38%, these are the financial indicators she uses to project her business.

loans.use: to buy school supplies, clothing, sandals and other products.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel, 62 years old, is from Olkalao. He is married and has three children who are all in school. Samuel is a farmer who also rears cattle. He has applied for his second loan from KADET LTD  to enable him to expand his shed, to pay for labor and to buy materials. Samuel hopes to buy another cow to add to his stock.

loans.use: To repair his shed and to pay for labor

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo, se dedica a atender una tienda de productos domésticos, vive con su familia, ella tiene aproximadamente 5 años de estar en el negocio, vende productos no perecederos y comida, los vecinos y personas que transitan por el lugar, son quienes consumen sus productos.
Ella está solicitando un préstamo para complementar la compra de un vehículo usado que ella comprara para transportar la mercadería, con este préstamo estará con los medios necesarios para poder mejorar el negocio y surtirlo sin mayores contratiempos. 
La aspiración de Consuelo es mejorar con la ayuda de los préstamos para mantenerse en el negocio y poderse sostener.
texts.en:
Consuelo lives with her family and has had a general store for about 5 years where she sells non-perishable products and food to neighbors and people who pass through the area.
She is requesting a loan to complete the purchase of a used car that she will use to transport the merchandise. With this loan she will have the means necessary to improve her business and the variety of products without problems.
Consuelo’s dream is to better the business with the help of the loans and to be able to support herself.

loans.use: to complete the purchase of a vehicle

loans.name: Samuel King'ori

texts.en:
Samuel is 36 years old. He is married to Sarah, 33 years old, who is a farmer. Together they have four children aged 12, 10, six and one year old. He is a dairy farmer and has been in the business for the past eleven years. He gets a monthly income of KES 6,700 from his business.

This is his third loan with KADET LTD. He will use the loan amount to purchase a dairy cow and animal feed. From his previous loan he managed to purchase a dairy cow that has helped him increase milk production for sale. He also managed to purchase a piece of land from the sale of milk.

He hopes to purchase more land to practice dairy farming on a large scale.

loans.use: To buy another  dairy cow and animal feed.

loans.name: Bendetor

texts.en:
Bendetor has been in farming 10 years and sells her farm produce within her local markets in the Nkubu area of Central Kenya where she also lives with her family of four children who are all schooling. She produces maize, beans and peas.

She has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says this will help her with milk, both for family consumption as well as for resale to meet other family needs, with the major one being education of the children. She adds she will also be able to use the cow's manure to improve her farm productivity. She plans to install an irrigation system in her farm in future to ensure income at every season.

She reckons the high cost of inputs and loss of production to pests as major challenges.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 40 years old, comes from Ndunyu-Njeru, and is married with six children who are all in school.

Daniel is a farmer and has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD, to enable him to buy some farm supplies to help him in cultivating his farm.

He hopes to see his business expand to venture into cattle rearing in the near future.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Roselyne

texts.en:
Roselyne has been in active farming for close to three years and currently sells her maize, vegetables, sugarcane and eggs to the local market in her hometown of Kitale  in Western Kenya where she also runs a retail shop for additional income.

Roselyne has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds to give a boost to her poultry farming business. She says she wants to fully exploit the skills she has acquired in the business to grow and earn enough income to meet her family needs with the most important being education of the children.

She however mentions occasional drought and  diseases as the major challenges in the farming business.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds.

loans.name: Abrewa

texts.en: Abrewa is a fishmonger and also  sells doughnuts  at Ampanyi near Elmina.  She fries fish  for sale.  She has been in this business for some years now.  Abrewa  is married to a mason  and has 8 dependents.  Abrewa   assists her husband to feed and clothe their children. Abrewa will use her loan to purchase more fish which she will fry for sale. With the new profit, she will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish which she will fry for sale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.en: Ama  is married to a fisherman and has two children.  Ama sells soap and rice at Ampayin which she has done for some time now. Ama uses her income to assist her husband to pay utility bills. Ama will use her loan to purchase boxes of soap and bags of rice for sale. With the  new profit, Ama will expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase boxes of soap and bags of rice for sale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy personal products such as lotions, creams, deodorants, and other items, in order to fill a large order made by a customer.

loans.name: Vann

texts.en: Mr. Vann is 37 years old and a lovely father of five children, living in Prey Chor district. He is a local farmer who cultivates rice crops together with his wife for their livelihood.  As usual, the income from rice husbandry is not really enough to satisfy the family’s needs, so Vann also spends some time going through the village to sell his shaken coconut juice to generate additional revenue. Presently, Vann’s house is under construction and Vann needs more funds from HKL and Kiva in order to complete the remaining parts. He hopes to have a nice house, which will provide his family a comfortable living soon.

loans.use: to pay for laborers constructing his house.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.en:
Arturo is married with four children. He is 36 years old and lives in Unidos, Plaridel.

Arturo sells "moron" rice cake flavored with chocolate, a specialty of their place, to earn a living and has had this business for four years. He has requested a loan of 5000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed to make the rice cake flavored with chocolate to sell.

Arturo has been a member of PMPC for  three years.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make a rice cake flavored with chocolate to sell.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
This is Julieta, 54, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Robert, an engineer, and mother to her  two children. She, together with her husband and children, manage their household while operating the business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Julieta operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a Php5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.     

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php 13,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Julieta hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work on her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Eneria

texts.en:
Eneria is 45 years old and lives in Mauswagon. She is married with four children. 

Eneria has a motorcycle transport business and earns approximately PHP 3000 each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 7000 PHP to purchase motorcycle spare parts. 

Eneria has been a member of PMPC for seven years.

loans.use: To purchase motorcycle spare parts.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.es: La señora Marcelina se dedica al comercio de papa ella es casada tiene 5 hijos 2 de ellos le ayudan en los gastos familiares de la casa su esposo es cerrajero y recientemente abrió su cerrajería en su mismo domicilio para ayudar con las necesidades que tiene la familia, como esta empezando todavía no le va bien pero tiene la esperanza que las cosas mejoren,  la señora Marcelina trae la papa por mayor de la localidad de Colomi y lo vende en el mercado de la localidad donde vive,  esta actividad le genera buenos ingresos porque ya se hiso conocer con la mayor parte de clientes, el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de papa por cantidad por carga, la Sra. Marcelina es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Marcelina sells potatoes, she is married and has 5 kids, 2 of which help her with the household expenses.  Her husband is a locksmith and just recently he opened up his own business based out of their home in order to help out with whatever needs the family may have.  Since he is just starting out, business is not going well but he remains hopeful that things will improve.  Marcelina purchases potatoes in bulk from Colomi and she sells at her local market.  This activity generates good revenue for her since she has made her self well-known within her group of clients.  Money from the loan will be utilized to purchase potatoes in bulk.  Marcelina is a hard-worker and feels happy and thankful for the opportunity and support offered to her.

loans.use: COMPRA DE PAPA POR CARGA

loans.name: Hay

texts.en:
Mrs. Hay, 45, lives in the Reussey Keo commune, Phnom Penh. She has a common-law relationship with her husband but has no children. Each day, Hay sells nuts of palm trees in an attractive place, where many people come to visit on their holiday. She typically earns around $3 per day.

Hay is applying for this loan because she would like to run a pig-fattening business at home for more household income. She will use the loan to buy some piglets and pig feed. In the future, Hay anticipates having a medium farm for her pig-raising business.

loans.use: to buy some piglets and pig feed

loans.name: Musee

texts.en: Musee is a 48-year-old businessman. He is married to Mary, who is a farmer. They are blessed with three children, ages 16, 14 and 12 years old. Musee has been operating a retail shop for the past two years with a monthly income of 7,000 Kenyan shillings which he uses to support his family. He is applying for his second loan with KADET Ltd. after repaying the previous loan successfully. Musee will use the loan to buy more stock like washing detergents, salt, match boxes and soft drinks to sell. With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to open a retail shop for his wife.

loans.use: to add more stock like washing detergents, salt, match boxes and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
This is Emma, 49, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Paulo, a driver, and she has five children. Emma works hard to continually provide income for the family's everyday expenses.

Emma operates a variety store which, in the Philippines, is basically a small convenience store, which retails groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, PHP 5 worth of cooking oil, or an egg. Emma earns an income by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. She also sells personal products for additional income. Emma's store is located adjacent to her house and her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.     

To help her continue operations of her business, Emma is requesting a PHP 9,000 loan, which she will use to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

Emma hopes her business grows in the coming years and dreams of being able to give her children a good and high quality education through all her hard work in her business. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members weekly to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items and products needed in her business.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Luz Dary ha sido una persona que ha atravesado muchas adversidades en su vida. Se casó desde muy temprana edad y con su esposo tiene 3 hijos a los cuales siempre les ha querido brindar una buena calidad de vida. Desde hace 10 años, debido a que los ingresos que generaba su esposo no eran suficientes para sostener los gastos del hogar, Luz Dary decidió comenzar a vender productos de uso personal a través de catálogos. Hace aproximadamente 2 años se separó de su esposo, y hasta el momento no contribuye con ningún aporte económico para el sostenimiento de sus 3 hijos, es por esto que Luz Dary, a pesar de que ya vendía productos por catálogo, tuvo que conseguirse un segundo trabajo debido a que la venta por catálogo no le generaba ingresos suficientes para sostener los gastos que se generan en su hogar. Luz Dary actualmente trabaja en un almacén de venta de mercancía y allí tiene un salario fijo, además, vende productos por catálogo en su tiempo libre a sus familiares, amigos y vecinos, y así genera los ingresos suficientes para poderles brindar a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida. Luz Dary ha tenido muy buenos pedidos últimamente de la venta por catálogos por parte de sus clientes, por lo que requiere comprar los productos a su proveedor; debido a que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para hacer estas compras, acude a un préstamo con la esperanza de que le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de uso personal como son lociones, cremas, accesorios, entre otros, para satisfacer los pedidos de sus clientes.

Luz Dary espera poder seguir aportando los ingresos suficientes para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar, y brindarles a sus hijos una buena calidad de vida. Sueña con que sus hijos puedan acceder a una educación de calidad, y en un futuro que tengan acceso a una educación universitaria. Además, quiere poder encontrar un empleo con un mejor salario y poder montar un almacén propio que le genere unos mayores ingresos para su hogar.
texts.en:
Luz Dary has gone through many adversities in her life.  She got married at an early age and has three children with her husband, she has always wanted to give them a good quality of life. 10 years ago, due to the fact that the income her husband generated was not sufficient to cover the home expenses, Luz Dary decided to sell personal products through catalog sales. Approximately two years ago, she separated from her husband who to this day hasn't financially contributed to support his three children, this is why Luz Dary in addition to selling catalog products, had to get a second job because the catalog sales didn't generate enough income to cover the home expenses.
Luz Dary currently works in a warehouse where she gets a fixed salary, in addition, she continues to sell products through catalog during her free time to family, friends and neighbours, this is how she makes enough money to provide for her children.  Luz Dary has made good sales lately from catalog orders from her clients, for this she needs to buy the products from the vendor and because she doesn't have enough money to buy them, she requests the a loan hoping to have access to these products such as perfumes, lotions, accessories and other to fill her client's needs. 
 
Luz Dary hopes to continue to provide sufficient income to support her home and give her children a good quality of life.  She dreams that her children will be able to access good quality education and in the future a university education.  Also, she wants to find a job with better salary and have a store of her own to generate more income for her home.

loans.use: to buy personal use products such as perfumes, lotion, accessories, and other products to fulfil her client's needs.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is 52 years old and lives in D'Ban, Calamba. She is married and has 3 children. For the past 2 years, Cecilia has operated a shop that sells grocery items. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000  to purchase additional stock for her store. Cecilia has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock

loans.name: Violita Group

texts.en:
Violita is 33 years old and lives in Poblacion, Sibutad. She is married and has 3 children. Violita has a cosmetics business, earning approximately PHP 3,200 monthly from it. She has requested a loan of PHP 5,000 to purchase cosmetic items to sell. Violita has been a member of PMPC for 1 1/2 years.

Violita is the leader of a 4-person group. Although they borrow as a group, each individual member has her own business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetic items to sell

loans.name: Winfridah

texts.en:
Winfridah has been farming for one year in her home area of Kitale, Western Kenya, where she also operates a grocery business. She lives with her family of 4 children and husband within the town. Winfridah's farm currently produces vegetables, milk, onions and tomatoes, which she sells locally.

Winfridah has requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. She says she will earn income to enable her to educate her children and to improve her family's living standards. Winfridah plans to increase her dairy cows to five and make dairy farming her core business in the future. She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo’s intervention and says it is timely and will help smallholder farmers improve their livelihood.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en: Erlinda is 62 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 4 children. Erlinda is a farmer and she has been raising pigs to earn a living for 4 years. She has requested a loan of PHP 30,000 to purchase feed and other supplies for her pigs. Erlinda has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: To purchase feed and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Prak

texts.en:
A resident of the Prey Chor district, Mrs. Prak is a rice farmer as well as an incense stick maker (shown in the photo). She is 55 years old and a responsible mother of 8 children, 5 of whom are already married and live independently. She is able to earn in the neighborhood of $2.50 per day from her businesses.
At the present, Prak would like to borrow some funds from HKL and Kiva to pay for the rented land on which she will grow potatoes to sustain her living condition. In the future, she wishes to own a few hectares of farmland for farming purpose.

loans.use: to pay for rented farmland

loans.name: Rosegine

texts.en:
Rosegine is 43 years old and lives in D'ban, Calamba. She is married with 2 children. 
Rosegine has a shop that sells grocery items and dry goods. She has had this business for 15 years. She requested a loan of 30,000 to purchase additional stock for her grocery store.
Rosegine has been a member of PMPC for 5 years.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock for her grocery store

loans.name: Alyona

texts.ru:
Алена с супругом и двумя маленькими детьми живет в селе Гладковка. Основным видом деятельности в этом преимущественно сельскохозяйственном регионе страны является выращивание овощей на продажу. Алена тоже занимается фермерством,  имея тепличный бизнес и выращивая 2 000 кустов помидор, 3 000 кустов огурцов, 5 000 капусты, 2 000 перца, а также более 1 тонны моркови ежегодно. В этой сфере она работает уже около 8 лет. На данный момент ее оборотный капитал составляет около 50 000 гривен. В хозяйство вложено 80 000 гривен. Средняя чистая прибыль составляет около 3 200 гривен. 

Алена планирует полученный от КИВА кредит в размере 8 000 гривен вложить в закупку семян на 3 000 гривен, пленки на 4 000 гривен, удобрений и химикатов на 1 000 гривен для содержания теплиц и выращивания в них ранних сельхозкультур.
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Alyona lives in the village of Gladkovka together with her husband and two  young children. In this agricultural region, the main business activity is growing vegetables for sale. Alyona too is engaged in farming work. She keeps greenhouses, where she grows 2000   tomato plants, 3,000 cucumbers plants, 5000 cabbages, 2,000 peppers, and also over one ton [2200 lbs] of carrots per year. She has been in this business for about eight years. At present, her working capital is about 50,000 UAH. Some 80,000 UAH are invested in the business. On the average, her net revenue is about 3,200 UAH.

Alyona plans to use her Kiva loan in the amount of 8,000 UAH to buy seeds for 3,000 UAH, greenhouse film for 4,000 UAH, and fertilizers and chemicals for 1,000 UAH in order to maintain her greenhouses and grow early-season vegetable varieties.

Note: the case description is in Russian.

loans.use: buy seeds for 3,000 UAH, greenhouse film for 4,000 UAH, and fertilizers and chemicals for 1,000 UAH

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is 31 years old from Naivasha and is married with two children who are both in school.

Gladys has a business selling shoes and has applied for a loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more shoes to add to her stock. She is a street hawker and hopes to open a shop to operate from. She hopes to open a boutique in the near future.

loans.use: To buy more shoes to add to her stock.

loans.name: Chelangat

texts.en:
Chelangat is aged 24 and works as a teacher in the local primary school in her home area Litein South Rift Kenya. She has also been in farming for five years and sells her produce of cabbages and milk to the local market. She is married with one child aged two years.

Chelangat has requested a loan of 70,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. She says that this will improve her milk production and income to meet her family needs. She adds that her focus is to improve her farming and acquire more assets in order to have financial security.

She laments the poor weather conditions in the area.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anamaricon

texts.en:
Anamaricon is married with three children. She is 46 years old and lives in Sapang Ama, Sapang Dalaga. 

Anamaricon sells snacks and other delicacies to earn a living and has had this business for six years. Each month, she earns PHP 3500 from her business. She has requested a loan of PHP 25000 to purchase raw ingredients for her business. 

Anamaricon has been a member of PMPC for 6 years.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients for her snack vending business.

location.town: Calamba-Sapang Ama Sapang Dalaga Misamis Occidenta

loans.name: Carlos Mario

texts.es:
Emprendedor y visionario son las mejores palabras con las que se pueden describir a Carlos Mario, una persona que a pesar de no proceder de una familia con abundancia económica ha tenido la fortaleza suficiente para salir adelante y poder aportarle a sus padres una mejor calidad de vida. Carlos Mario anteriormente trabajaba en un taller de confección, en el cual no quiso seguir trabajando debido a lo mal remunerado que era. Desde entonces, montó una tienda general, en la cual al principio solo vendía legumbres. Gracias a que Carlos Mario supo administrar su dinero, ahorró la mayor parte de sus ingresos y los reinvirtió en su negocio, y ahora también vende productos de la canasta familiar. Carlos Mario ahora tiene unos pequeños ahorros y espera comprar unas vitrinas para exhibir sus productos en su tienda. Sin embargo, no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder comprar las vitrinas y comprar la mercancía para surtir su negocio, por lo que espera que un préstamo le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una vitrina para exhibir sus productos y a la compra de productos de la canasta familiar para surtir esta vitrina.

Carlos Mario espera que de esta manera sus ventas aumenten considerablemente, pues su negocio estará mejor presentado para sus clientes, quienes podrán encontrar mayor variedad de productos en su tienda. Carlos Mario sueña con que sus padres puedan disfrutar de una mejor calidad de vida, y espera que con unos buenos ingresos de su tienda el se los pueda ofrecer. Además, Carlos Mario tiene el sueño de montar un gran supermercado en el cual pueda generar mucho empleo para las personas más necesitadas.
texts.en:
Entrepreneurial and visionary are the words that best describe Carlos Mario, a person that in spite of that fact that he doesn't come from a wealthy family has had the strength to get ahead and gibe his parents a better quality of life.
Carlos Mario used to work at a dressmaking shop, but he didn't want to continue to work there because he didn't get paid well. Since then he started a general store, in which he only sold vegetables at the beginning.  Because Carlos Mario knew how to manage his money, he saved most of the income and re-invested it in the business and now he also sells basic groceries.  Carlos Mario now has small savings and hopes to buy display cabinets to show his products at the store.  However, he doesn't have enough money to buy them and also buy merchandise to stock the store, so he hopes a loan gives him the access to a display cabinet and to buy basic groceries to stock it.  Carlos Mario hopes that this way his sales will increase considerably, because the store will be more presentable to his clients, who will be able to find a larger variety of products.  Carlos Mario dreams to see his parents enjoy a better quality of life and hopes that with the good income form the store he can offer this to them.  He also hopes one day to be able to own a supermarket and employ people with needs.

loans.use: To buy a display cabinet to showcase products and buy basic groceries to stock the cabinet.

loans.name: Ekua

texts.en: Ekua makes fried plantains and bean stew to sell at Ampanyi near Elmina. Ekua is married to a driver and has eight dependents.  Ekua uses her income to help her husband in the general upkeep of their children.  Ekua needs this loan to purchase plantains and beans for the preparation of her food for sale. With the new profit from her expanded business, Ekua will make a better stall for the sale of her fried plantain and beans.

loans.use: to purchase plantain and beans.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a 28-year-old single mother of three children, aged eight to fifteen. She owns a grocery store in Mwiki, Nairobi. She has been in this business for the last seven years and earns a monthly income of KES 8,000 from it.

Judith is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET LTD which she plans to use to buy more fruits and vegetables to sell in her store.

Judith hopes to venture into farming.

loans.use: to buy more fruits and vegetable to sell.

loans.name: Margeret

texts.en:
Margeret is 58 years old. She is a mixed crop farmer. She and her husband Joseph are blessed with two children. She has been in the farming business for the past 20 years with a monthly income of KES 10,000, which she uses to support her family.

Margeret is applying for her second loan term from KADET LTD after repaying the previous loan successfully. Margeret will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business she will educate her children. Her hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and venture into tea farming.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer for her farm.

loans.name: Juan Irene

texts.es:
El señor Juan tiene 56 años de edad, es casado y tiene cinco hijos de los cuales solo uno vive con él.

Juan se dedica desde hace 30 años a trabajar como albañil, fue su papá quien le enseño ese oficio ya que él trabajaba de agricultor y de albañil. Actualmente esta remodelando una vivienda que es un contrato por obra.

Él esta solicitando un préstamo para instalar la energía eléctrica en su vivienda, ya que en el lugar donde vive hay un proyecto de electrificación y él quiere tener la energía eléctrica en su casa, para estar enterado de las noticias nacionales e internacionales por medio de la televisión o la radio. Así comprara aparatos electrónicos y cambiara su estilo de vida y él espera seguir trabajando en la construcción de viviendas.
texts.en:
Señor Juan, aged 56, is married and the father of five children. Only one of them lives with him.

Juan has been a bricklayer for 30 years. He learned the craft from his father who was a farmer and bricklayer. Currently, Juan is remodeling a house within the framework of a commissioned contract.

He applies for a loan to have electricity installed in his home, because his neighborhood is being connected to the electricity network and he now wants electricity in his home. He would be able to follow national and international news on radio and television. He will buy domestic appliances and change his lifestyle. He hopes to continue working in the housing sector.

loans.use: to install electricity in his home.

loans.name: Maria Nury

texts.es:
Maria Nury es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 3 hijos a los cuales su padre los abandonó por completo sin aportar una ayuda económica para su sustento. Maria Nury debido a esto, tuvo que conseguirse un empleo que le permitiera generar los ingresos para su hogar, pero que al mismo tiempo le permitiera estar pendiente de sus hijos. Gracias a un curso que tomó de confección, Maria Nury empezó a trabajar en esta actividad desde su casa ofreciendo el servicio de la confección a terceros, y gracias a esto ha podido estar pendiente del cuidado de sus 3 hijos y de la generación de ingresos para su hogar. Maria Nury confecciona lencería para el hogar, y ha conseguido muy buenos clientes gracias a la calidad de su trabajo. Actualmente tiene un gran pedido por parte de un cliente, por lo que requiere comprar materia prima para confeccionarlo, es por esto que acude a un préstamo con la esperanza de que le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de insumos como cierres, botones, hilos y espumas, para confeccionar el pedido de uno de sus clientes.

Maria Nury espera seguir tendiendo un buen nivel de ventas, y poder seguir generando los ingresos que requiere para su hogar. Espera poder brindarles a sus 3 hijos una mejor calidad de vida y mejores oportunidades de acceso a una buena educación. Maria Nury sueña con su trabajo poder ampliar su taller y poder generar empleo para madres cabezas de familia iguales que ella.
texts.en:
Maria Nury is a sinlge mom and the head of a family with three children, who were completely abandoned by their father without any financial help.  Maria Nury had to get a job that would allow her to generate enough income for her home but that also would allow her to be able to take care of her children.  Thanks to a course she took on dressmaking, she started to work on this activity from home providing dressmaking and tailoring services to others, thanks to this activity she has been able to take care of her three children and generate income for her home, she has made good clients thanks to the quality of her work.  She currently has a large order for a client, for this she wants to buy materials and requests a loan hoping to get the items she needs such as zippers, buttons, thread and foam, to complete an order from a client.

Maria Nury hopes to continue to have a good level of sales and continue to generate income for her home.  She hopes to provide her three children with a good quality of life and better opportunities for a good education, Maria Nury dreams to expand her shop and provide employment to other mothers that are head of their families like she is.

loans.use: to buy materials such as  zippers, buttons, thread and foam to fill an order from a client.

loans.name: Hector Dario

texts.es:
Hector es una persona luchadora y con ganas de salir adelante, que esforzándose en su trabajo ha podido sacar adelante su esposa y sus 2 hijos. Hector se dedica a la distribución de carnes frías como salchicha, chorizo, chuzos, longaniza, mortadela, entre otros y gracias a esto genera los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Hector tiene una gran cantidad de clientes gracias al buen servicio que ofrece, y estos le han hecho grandes pedidos que a veces por falta de capital no puede atender completamente. Hector tiene en su local el almacenamiento de estos productos, y debido a que el refrigerador en el que almacena estos productos se ha averiado, acude a un préstamo que le permita acceder a la compra de un refrigerador para almacenar las carnes frías que ofrece a sus clientes.

Hector espera que de esta manera pueda seguir operando su negocio, y pueda atender mejor sus clientes para seguir generando los ingresos para su hogar. Hector sueña con que su negocio crezca y pueda tener un gran capital con el que atender todo el mercado, pues no puede atender más clientes de los actuales por la misma falta de capital. Con su familia, Hector espera poder mejorarles la calidad de vida a su esposa y sus 2 hijos, a los cuales también les quiere brindar una mejor educación y en un futuro poder acceder a una educación universitaria.
texts.en:
Hector is a fighting person with hopes to get ahead, through hard work he has been able to get his wife and two children ahead.  Hector works distributing cold cuts such as sausage, winners, chorizo sausage, bologna and other products and thanks to this he generates the necessary income to support his home.  Hector has a good number of clients because of the good service he provides and they have made large orders that sometimes because of the need of capital he can't supply in full.  Hector stores his products at the store and because the refrigerator is broken he needs a loan to be able to buy a new refrigerator to store his products.

Herctor hopes to continue to operate his business with this loan and service his clients to continue to generate income for his home.  Hector's dream is to grow the business and have capital to supply the demand because he can't take any more clients due to the lack of working capital.  With his family Hector hopes to give them a better quality of life and better education so that in the future they can access a university education.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to store cold cuts for sale.

loans.name: Darisuren

texts.en: Darisuren is 49 years old and lives with her husband in western Mongolia. Her husband works as an inspector at the power station. Their son studies at the university in the capital city. She has been running a meat and livestock retailing business for 12 years. During this time, she was able to improve her family income and pay for the college expenses of her daughter. Based on her experience, she would like to extend her business by purchasing a large amount of meat and livestock in this winter. She will be able to sell more because the biggest festival in Mongolia is about to happen. Darisuren is a hardworking and clever woman who says that "I would like to extend my business activities to improve my household income and buy an apartment for the family". The total amount she is requesting is 2,500,000 MNT to buy meat at wholesale prices.

loans.use: to buy meat at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Ung

texts.en:
Mrs. Ung, 30, is living in Kompong Cham. She sells crush-ice with syrup from her bike from place to place to generate income. However, in the rainy season, she also manages the farm as well. She typically earns an average of $3.00 per day to cover her daily needs. Most of her clients are children who live around the commune. 

With the loan she has requested form HKL, she will use buy a trailer, which will be used to support her selling business. Ung hopes that she will be able to provide her two children a good education in the future.

loans.use: to buy a trailer, which will be used to support her selling business.

loans.name: Erick Alberto

texts.es: Erick de 27 años de edad vive con su cónyuge y su hijo de 2 años de edad; hogar que sostiene con los ingresos producidos por su actividad de comerciante, la que aprendió de su padre desde muy pequeño y después cuando conformó su familia, también lo apoyó regalándole un pequeño capital para su primera inversión y la recomendación de este con todos los proveedores, lo cual le abrió muchas puertas. Erick le agregó todo lo que le dejó su padre, el sacrificio constante y su gran responsabilidad, logrando que su negocio a través del cual vende mercancía variada, se   posicione en la mente de sus clientes y lo reconozcan; él a ellos los trata de manera muy especial,  le vende de todo un poco como, sillas, ollas, cubiertos, bajillas, poncheras, planchas, licuadoras, en fin lo le solicitan. Su deseo de tener una empresa de diseño gráfico, carrera técnica que estudió, lo hacen trabajar persistentemente, para dejarle el legado empresarial fortalecido a su familia. Su gran desafío es tener el capital de trabajo suficiente para crecer permanentemente, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará electrodomésticos menores artículos de cocina y otras mercancías, fundamentada en pedidos de sus clientes, lo cual hacen de su inversión todo un éxito. Mientras Erick trabaja para lograr sus sueños, sostiene en su negocio una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 3 días, una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 38% , indicadores financieros desde los cuales se planea su crecimiento microempresarial.
texts.en: Erick is 27 and lives with his spouse and two year old son, he supports his home with the income generated from his commerce activities, the one he learned from his father since he was little and later when he had his own family his father supported him by giving him some working capital for his first investment and recommended him to vendors which open lots of doors for him.  Erick added everything his father thought him, constant sacrifice, responsibility, being able to offer varied merchandise and placing his business in the mind of his clients and be recognized by them, he treats his clients in a very special way, he sells chairs, pots, cutlery, china, jugs, irons, blenders and whatever is requested by his clients.  His wish is to have a graphic design company, which is the technical degree he took in school, this wish makes him work hard and be persistent, so he can provide a patrimony to his family.  His challenge is to have enough working capital to grow and this is why he comes to credikiva, first loan through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, with the loan he will buy small appliances, kitchen items and other merchandise based on requests from his clients, which will make the investment a success.  Erick works hard to achieve his dreams and has a collecting cycle of 3 days and a gross profit of no less than 38% of sales, these are the financial indicators he uses to plan growth.

loans.use: to buy small appliances, kitchen items and other merchandise requested by clients.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en: Jackson is 39 years old and married to Ann. They are blessed with two children. He operates a kiosk that is a retail shop. He has been in this business for the last nine years and brings in an income of 32,200 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month. Jackson has a good credit history with KADET. He is applying for his fifth loan of 80,000 KES from KADET Ltd. which he plans to use to buy stock of sugar, flour, rice, groceries and soft drinks to sell. He will plough back the anticipated profit into his business. He hopes to open a wholesale. He is very hardworking.

loans.use: to buy sugar, flour, rice, groceries and soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia siempre ha querido aportar ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar, donde convive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos. Debido a que el salario de su esposo era muy bajo, y no alcanzaba para cubrir todos los gastos que se generaban, Patricia decidió emplearse y comenzar a trabajar.  Desde hace aproximadamente 10 años, comenzó trabajando en una peluquería, ya que aprendió la actividad desde muy temprana edad; al ver que su trabajo no era muy bien remunerado, decidió independizarse y montar su propia sala de belleza, donde atiende principalmente a familiares, vecinos y amigos. Patricia de esta manera ha aportado ingresos para que su familia pueda gozar de una mejor calidad de vida, y gracias a estos sus hijos también han podido acceder a una mejor educación. Patricia actualmente atiende gran cantidad de clientes, y sus herramientas de trabajo ya se han visto desgastadas por su uso. Es por esto que Patricia busca comprar implementos de trabajo que le permitan ofrecer un mejor servicio, sin embargo, no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar estas compras. Por esto, tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de herramientas de trabajo para su salón de belleza como son secadores, planchas, peinillas, entre otros.

Patricia espera poder seguir prestando el mejor servicio a sus clientes, para que así sus ventas aumenten con el paso del tiempo. Además, sueña con tener un gran salón de belleza reconocido en su sector y en el cual pueda generar empleo para las personas que más lo necesitan.
texts.en:
Patricia has always wanted to bring income to support her home, where she lives with her husband and two children.  Due to her husband's salary was very low and was not able to cover all the expenses they had, Patricia decided to start working. 10 years ago she started working at a beauty salon, activity that she learned at a young age, seeing that her work was well remunerated, she decided to get independent and open her own beauty salon, where she provides services to family, neighbors and friends.  Patricia brings income to her family so they can have a better quality of life and thanks to this her children also have access to a better education.   Patricia now has a large number of clients and her tools have worn out.  Patricia wants to buy new tools so she can offer a better service, however she doesn't have enough capital to invest in them and hopes to be able to do this with a loan and buy dryers, hair irons, combs and other products.

Patricia hopes to continue to provide good service to her clients, so that her sales continue to grow.  Also, she dreams to have a large beauty salon recognized in her industry and provide employment to people that need it.

loans.use: to buy tools for the beauty salon such as hair dryers, hair irons, combs and other products.

loans.name: Pablo Humberto

texts.es:
Pablo, es taxista, vive con su madre, se dedica a realizar viajes en diferentes lugares de la ciudad, tiene una experiencia de 4 años, trabaja en lo propio, con su taxi, no tiene un horario establecido.
Actualmente está solicitando un préstamo para la reparación del taxi, su sistema eléctrico y tapizarlo todo, este préstamo le dará los recursos necesarios para mantener el vehículo en buenas condiciones y brindar un mejor servicio. 
La aspiración de Pablo es que con este préstamo pueda tener una mejor apariencia el vehículo, ya que de él recibe lo necesario para apoyar a su madre con los gastos de la casa.
texts.en:
Pablo is a taxi operator, and lives with his mother. He does trips in various areas of the city. He has four years experience working on his own with his taxi. He has no fixed hours. 

Currently, he is applying for a loan in order to repair his taxi's electrical system and reupholster it. This loan will give him the necessary resources to maintain the vehicle in good condition, and provide better service. 

Pablo's hope is that with this loan, his vehicle can have a better appearance, since it is from it that he gets what he needs to support his mother with the household expenses.

loans.use: To repair the electrical system and upholstery.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a forty-year-old lady from Mumias town. She is married to Haji and they have three children aged 9 to 15.

Eunice runs a molasses production business in Mumias. She has been doing this for the last three years and makes a monthly income of 14,000 KES. She is taking out her first loan which she will use to buy more containers for the molasses.

She will plow the generated profits back into the business. Her dream is to fully provide for her family’s basic needs.

loans.use: to buy containers for manufactured molasses.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.en:
Candelaria is 57 years old and lives in Tugas, Baliangao. She is married with 5 children.

To earn a living, Candelaria runs a business selling dried fish. She earns about 6200 PHP each month doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase 10 boxes of dried fish to sell.

Candelaria has been a member of PMPC for 2 years.

loans.use: to purchase 10 boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en: Angela is a widow who lives in Ampanyi with her 4 children. She has been selling rice and oil for some years now.  As a single parent, she uses her income to feed, clothe, and pay school fees for her children.  Angela will use her loan to purchase bags of rice and boxes of oil to sell.  She will use the new profit to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase bags of rice and boxes of oil to sell

loans.name: Roxana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” CUSI COYLLOR DE CHINCHERO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Chinchero, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Roxana; ella tiene 25 años de edad; casada y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias trabajando de transfer en una agencia de viajes ella les explica todo sus tours que tienen durante los días que permanecerán en la ciudad, la socia lleva buen tiempo trabajando en este rubro siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para aumentar a un capital que ella tiene para comprar un auto para que trabaje en turismo.

La socia se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The borrower belongs to the "Usi Coyllor de Chinchero" communal bank, located in Chinchero district, which is part of Urubamba province, in Cusco department. 

The borrower is Roxana. She is 25, married, and has one child. She alternates her daily activities with doing transfers at a travel agency. She explains everything on the tours that they have during the days they remain stay in the city. She has been working in this sector for some time, as in this way, she is raising her family.

The borrower is applying for the loan in order to add to some savings she has, in order to buy a car so that she can work in tourism. She promises to make her installment payments.

loans.use: To buy a car, so that she can work in tourism.

loans.name: Um

texts.en: Mrs. Um is 33 years old. She is the mother of two children and is a happily married woman. She and her family live in a rural area in the Baray district of Kompong Tom Province. For the past 5 years, Um has sold fresh fish around the houses of her community, but now she sells her fresh fish in a market far away from her house. She must spend some of her revenue every day for a motor-taxi, so she has decided with her family to apply for a loan through HKL, Kiva's partner, to purchase a motorcycle. She says that help from generous lenders will make her business earn enough profit. She is very thankful to all lenders that are helping her family. Um is an enterprising businesswoman and a long-time client of this field partner. She comes with good references, both personally and in terms of her credit-worthiness.

loans.use: to purchase a motorcycle.

loans.name: Gideon

texts.en:
Gideon is 51 years old, married and a father of four children aged 20, 17, 15 and 13 years old.  His spouse is Viola, a business lady selling milk.  Gideon does dairy farming in Kebulonik and has been in operation for a period of 16 years, earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

He is servicing his fifth loan of KES 55,000 from KADET LTD after he successfully paid the previous loans well. He wishes to use this amount to purchase two dairy cows and the profits will be used to expand the dairy farm and to repay back the loan.

He hopes to prosper in his dairy farming and have a happy family.

loans.use: To purchase two dairy cows

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: To earn a living, Mrs. Hong, age 46, works hard to ensure that her family lives in suitable conditions. She now has six children. Two of her children are married and live in separate houses and the other four are living under her income. Presently, she is a fish seller in one market far away from her community. From this business, she is able to earn about $2 per day. Currently, she would like to have a new motorbike for supporting her business, so she has decided to request some funds through HKL partner Kiva in order to purchase a new motorbike. She hopes that this fund will make her business earn more profit. She said that she is very grateful to all lenders who support funds for her family. She commits that she will pay back on schedule.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorbike

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 47 years old. She is married to Edward and together they are blessed with three children. Florence runs a clothing sales business in Babadogo, Nairobi. She has been in this business for the past 17 years and she gets an income of KES 6,300 per month.

Florence is applying for her first loan of 20,000 KES from KADET LTD, which she plans to use to purchase clothes for sale. She will use the anticipated profit to pay her children's fees and boost her business.

Florence plans to open a boutique.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 46 years old and lives in the town of Mbale in the Mbale region of Uganda. She is married and has three children with two of them currently in school. For the past 12 years, Rose has been working hard to manage her small shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand her business, Rose has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more textile clothes for resale, and will help Rose generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children. Rose hopes that in the future she will be able to expand her business. 

Rose is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP).  The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Rose who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more textile clothes for resale

loans.name: Maurine

texts.en:
Maurine is a 24-year-old wife to Nicodemus and mother to two children who are four and two years old. Maurine come from the western part of Kenya.

Maurine operates a business selling clothes and shoes in Migori, a business she has done for the last year. She makes a monthly income of KES. 25,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy a new stock of adult shoes and clothes to sell. She will use her profits to start another business outlet.

Her dream is to have a good business and thus contribute to the economic growth of the Kenyan economy.

loans.use: To buy bales of shoes to sell

loans.name: Juan Esteban

texts.es:
Juan Esteban es reconocido en su sector y entre su familia, por ser una persona muy trabajadora y dedicada a su familia. 
Juan Esteban, con 45 años de edad se encuentra a cargo de sus 2 hijos desde que la madre de sus hijos los abandonó. Siempre les ha querido brindar lo mejor, por eso trabaja todos los días fuertemente en su negocio para poder generar ingresos suficientes que le permitan brindarles una mejor calidad de vida.
Juan Esteban actualmente se dedica a la venta de carnes, además de que cría cerdos para la venta y también algunos ganados. Gracias a esto, Juan Esteban genera los ingresos suficientes para soportar los gastos del hogar, y ofrecerles una vida digna a sus hijos.
Juan Esteban ha visto como su negocio ha crecido, y sus ventas se han incrementado considerablemente, todo esto gracias a que la atención que presta siempre es la mejor. Actualmente, Juan Esteban tiene mas demanda de su producto que el que puede ofrecer, por lo que requiere de producir más carne para la venta. Es por esto que Juan Esteban necesita comprar insumos para su negocio como ganchos y canastillas en donde poner su carne, además de la compra de algunos ganados, sin embargo, Juan Esteban no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar estas compras, por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le permitirá acceder a la compra de insumos para su carnicería como ganchos y canastillas, además de la compra de algunos ganados para su crianza y posterior venta de carne.
Juan Esteban tiene el sueño de que su negocio siga creciendo en ventas y pueda generar mucho empleo en un futuro para personas que más lo necesiten.
Además, sueña con que sus hijos tengan la posibilidad de acceder a una educación superior, donde cursen una carrera universitaria que les permita obtener en un futuro un empleo bien remunerado.
texts.en:
Juan Esteban is recognized in his neighborhood and in his family for being a very hardworking person dedicated to his family.  At 45 years old, Juan Esteban finds himself in charge of his two children since the mother of his children abandoned them.  He always has wanted to give them the best, so he work tremendously hard every day in his business to be able to generate sufficient income to allow him to give them a better quality of life.

Currently Juan Esteban works selling meat.  He also raises pigs to sell, as well as some cattle.  Thanks to this Juan Esteban generates the necessary income to pay for the household expenses and offer his children a life of dignity.

Juan Esteban has seen how his business has grown, and his sales have increased considerably, all thanks to the fact that the attention he gives is always the best.  Currently Juan Esteban has more demand for his product than he can offer, so he needs to produce more meat for sale.  This is why Juan Esteban needs to buy supplies for his business, such as hooks and baskets for his meat, as well as some cattle.  However, Juan Esteban does not have the necessary capital to make these purchases.

He hopes that a loan will allow his to make the purchase of supplies for his butcher shop, such as hooks and baskets, as well as some cattle to raise and later sell the meat.

Juan Esteban's dream is for his business to continue growing in sales and to generate more work in the future for people who need it the most.  He also dreams of his children having the possibility of getting a college education, where they study a profession that allows them to get a well-paying job in the future.

loans.use: to buy supplies for his butcher shop such as hooks and baskets, as well as some cattle to raise and later sell the meat.

loans.name: Ruby Amparo

texts.es:
Ruby ha sido una persona muy trabajadora durante toda su vida. Ser una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 1 hijo, lo ha demostrado, pues su esposo ha muerto y ella ha quedado viuda a cargo del sostenimiento de su hogar.
Con sus hermanas, trabajó durante mucho tiempo en diferentes talleres de confección hasta que un día decidieron independizarse y cada una montar su propio taller de confección.
Desde entonces Ruby no tiene que cumplir un horario con un jefe abusando laboralmente, sino que ha visto como puede generar sus propios ingresos y con un trabajo más confortable.
Ruby actualmente tiene en su taller muy buenos clientes, que le otorgan muy buenos contratos para confeccionar, gran parte de esto debido a la gran calidad que tienen sus productos. 
Debido a que sus clientes no le pagan si no una vez entregada la producción, Ruby tiene que comprar por adelantado todos los insumos para producirla. Esta vez no esta la excepción, y Ruby debe comprar los insumos para confeccionar un gran pedido que le hizo un cliente. Sin embargo, Ruby no tiene en la actualidad un buen capital para poder comprar todos los insumos, por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de insumos como hilos, telas, agujas, entre otros, para poder confeccionar el pedido de su cliente y entregarlo a tiempo.
Ruby tiene el sueño de que su negocio siga creciendo como lo ha venido haciendo para generar mucho empleo para personas que más lo necesitan. Además, sueña con que su hijo pueda acceder a una educación universitaria que le permita estar preparado para obtener un empleo bien remunerado.
texts.en:
Ruby has worked hard her whole life. She has demonstrated this as a single mother of one son. Her husband died and left her a widow in charge of maintaining her household. 

With her sisters, she worked for a long time in different garment factories until one day they decided to become independent and each open their own workshop. Since then, Ruby doesn't have to work a set schedule with an abusive boss, and she has seen that she can generate her own income and work more comfortably.

Ruby currently has a lot of good customers who bring her a lot of sewing orders, which is largely due to the good quality of her products. Her customers don't pay her until she delivers the orders, so she has to buy all of the inputs herself to produce them. This time is no exception, and Ruby needs to buy materials to complete a large order from a customer. Ruby doesn't currently have the capital that she needs to buy everything, so she hopes that a loan will give her the possibility to buy the materials like threads, fabrics and other things to complete the order and deliver it on time. 

Ruby dreams that her business will continue to grow as it has been so that she can generate more jobs for people who need them. She also dreams that her son will be able to get a good college education that will prepare him for a job that pays well.

loans.use: to buy inputs like thread, fabric, needles and other things to fill a large customer order.

loans.name: Ly

texts.en: Mrs. Ly is a 45-year-old married woman who lives with her humble husband and her three lovely kids in the Prey Chor district of Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia. It's a zone where agribusiness is common; the majority of the region's inhabitants are rice, cattle, fishing and potato business people. Nowadays, she is a lovely mother who generates a kind of job as a potato business. She is a responsible person who always takes care of their livelihood and provides a good education for her children. Mrs. Ly has been involved with this business sector for a long time, so she has long periods in her related this field. Due to the long time, it is easy way for her to get more experience and better outcome every year. To upgrade their living conditions, she and her family would like to rent some employees to help operate her business. So she and her humble husband are seeking kind lenders to support their family. They are expecting that this loan will make their family meet happiness and prosperity.

loans.use: to pay for employees to work in her potato field.

loans.name: Juana Lucia

texts.es: Doña Juana Lucia, es una persona muy trabajadora y nos cuenta que kiva a sido de mucha ayuda y bendicion en su vida,ya que gracias a su credito anterior pudo lograr parte de sus objetivos ella se dedica a la venta de refacciones los dias juevez y domingos, en la plaza municipal de su comunidad,tambien en su casa tiene una granja de crianza de pollos y en la tardes noches se dedica a la elavoracion de delantales con tela de cortes tipicos,el sueño de ella es que un dia pueda tener un negocio mas grande para poder obtener un poco mas de ganancias,ya que ella es una mujer que vive sola y tiene y tiene bajo su responzabilidad s sus hijos,ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia para la elavoracion de refacciones.
texts.en:
Juana Lucia is a hardworking woman, and she tells us that Kiva has been a great help and blessing in her life. Thanks to her previous loan she was able to achieve part of her goals.

She sells snacks on Thursdays and Sundays in the town plaza; she also raises chickens at home and at night she makes aprons from traditional fabrics. Her dream is to one day have a larger business so she can make a little bit more income, because she lives alone and takes care of her children. 

She is asking for this loan to buy ingredients to make snacks.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make snacks.

loans.name: Isidro Yobani

texts.es:
Isidro, es soltero, vive con sus padres y demás familia, tiene 10 años de estar trabajando con su padre en la agricultura, sembrando maíz, frijol y crianza de ganado, hasta la fecha ha estado siempre apoyado de su padre y juntos trabajan todos los días.
Él está solicitando un préstamo para la compra de cuatro terneros, para la crianza, así estará aumentando el número de reces en su terreno que le ayuden en un futuro a tener buenas ventas.
El objetivo de Isidro es hacer crecer el negocio con su padre, apoyándolos siempre de las mejoras en el ganado y la agricultura.
texts.en:
Isidro is a single man who lives with her parents and other family. He has been working with his father on the farm for 10 years, planting corn and beans and raising cattle. He has always supported his father and they work together every day.

He is asking for a loan to buy four calves to raise, so that he can increase the number of animals on his land which will help him to have better sales in the future. 

Isidro's goal is to grow his business with his father, supporting them to make improvements to their cattle and farming.

loans.use: to buy 4 calves.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna has been an active farmer in Litein, South Rift Kenya for the last eight straight years, producing and selling milk, tea and eggs to the local market. She is age 35 and married with three children who are all schooling.

Anna has requested a loan of 20,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to boost her poultry business. She says she will buy more poultry birds to improve her income from her poultry business and provide her family's basic needs. She remains optimistic with business growth saying her life has improved since she started active farming and emphasizes poultry business is more lucrative with a ready market.

She is grateful to Juhudi Kilimo for the loan facility.

loans.use: To buy poultry birds

loans.name: Thoem

texts.en:
Mrs. Thoem is 25 years old and married with two single children attending a local school. Her husband helps share his income for the family by working as a construction worker from place to place around the country. She presently works in a garment factory and gets her payment monthly. 

With the loan she has requested from HKL, Thoem will buy construction supplies to support her husband’s business. She hopes that her living conditions will improve through using Kiva’s funds. She is very thankful to our lenders.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to support her husband’s business.

loans.name: Elguja

texts.en:
Elguja is 48 years old. He is married and lives in the village of Skhvilisi, South Georgia with his wife Manana. The only source of income for the family is agriculture. They own 1.3 hectare of land where they grow potatoes and cabbage. Elguja sells harvested products on the local open market. Also, the family has a milk cow. Manana produces and sells on average 15 kg of cheese per month. The total average monthly income of the family is 400 Laris. 

Elguja requested a loan for purchasing potatoes for sowing. Once he purchases quality seeds, he can count on a good harvest for the summer, which can be sold for a good price. The family will save the income from the sales and use it during the year for financing their daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes for sowing

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is 28 years old and married to Pacifica. They are blessed with one child who is three years old and support two other members of his family.  He is a farmer in Irimis practicing passion fruit farming and has been in operation for a period of two years, earning a monthly income of KES 8,000.

He has joined KADET LTD and now is taking his first loan of KES 20,000 and wishes to use this amount to purchase seedlings, a knapsack sprayer, fertilizers and herbicides. 

The profits will be used to start a computer lab business offering internet services as well as photocopying. His dream is to become self sustainable and improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is 38 years old and lives in the town of Bunghoko in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has six children with five of them currently in school. For the past five years, Joseph has been working hard to manage his small shop, which sells clothes. 

To help expand his business, Joseph has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more clothes for resale and will help Joseph to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children. Joseph hopes that in the future, he will be able to expand his business.
