Joseph is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Joseph who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more clothes for resale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 27 years old. She is married to Julius, and they are blessed with three children. She is hawker of clothes in the area of Pangani, Nairobi. She has been in this business for the last four years and gets an income of 7,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) per month.

Florence has a good credit history in KADET, whereby she is applying for her third loan of KES 80,000. She plans to purchase clothes and weaves used in salons. She will use the anticipated profit to increase the stock in her business and improve her standard of living.

She hopes to open a salon college to teach many people so that they may help themselves. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase stock of clothes for sale.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is from the village of Minadze, South Georgia. He is 59 years old, married and lives with his wife Mariam. Production of dairy products is the main source of the income for the family. George has milk cows. In addition, he purchases milk from neighbor farmers and uses it for cheese production. George sells harvested products on the local open market. The total average monthly income of the family is 640 Laris. 

George requested a loan to start a new business initiative. He will purchase calves and feed them during the winter months. In late spring, George will sell grown calves and get additional income. The family will be able to purchase needed household goods and spend more on their daily needs in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 45-year-old from the Kapune area of Kilgoris town. She is married to Samson, and they have four children aged 11 to 18 years. 

Esther operates a milk-selling business, which she has done for the last seven years, making a monthly income of 8,500 Kenyan shillings (KES). She is taking a second loan from KADET LTD with which she will buy a dairy cow. Her profits will be channeled back into the business. 

Her dream is to manage both cereal and milk businesses.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Emmah

texts.en:
Emmah is a 25-year-old single mother of one child from Homabay town. She also supports her four siblings.

Emmah operates a retail shop, a business she has been doing for the last five years and makes a monthly income of KES 10,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more retail stock like sugar and cooking fat. 

She intends to open more outlets using the anticipated profits. Her dream is to offer good service to her clientele.

loans.use: To buy retail stock like sugar.

loans.name: Wilian Alexander

texts.es:
El señor Wilian tiene 38 años de edad, vive con su compañera de vida y dos hijos.

Él se dedica a trabajar en la crianza de pollos desde hace 10 años, empezó ayudándole a un vecino que realizaba esta actividad, luego el vecino le dio al crédito 50 pollos para que los engordara y los vendiera en libras. Después él junto con su mamá compraron más de 100 pollos, los destazaron y los comercializaron.

Actualmente Wilian esta criando pollos cada seis semanas, que son los días de producción, él vende ya libreado 500 libras, él tiene su clientela entre ellos abastece a un hotel y tiendas en varias comunidades. Él compra 110 pollos en una ciudad que esta a 56 kilómetros de donde él vive y logra sacar 100 pollos de 5 libras cada uno. Para comprar los pollos debe salir de su casa a las 6:00 a.m. camina tres kilómetros y medio, luego aborda un vehiculo que lo conduce a la ciudad que es donde compra los pollos. Estos los compra una vez a la semana y también el concentrado para alimentar a sus pollos.

Cuando es temporada agrícola Wilian se dedica a sembrar granos básicos para la venta y también trabaja como ayudante de un albañil.

El señor Wilian solicita el préstamo a Fundación Campo para comprar 125  pollos más, concentrado para alimentar a los que ya tiene y a los que comprara, ya que la demanda esta creciendo, una vez alcanzan su peso los destaza, los limpia y los vende en libras. También ampliara la granja por lo menos para unos 50 pollos más. De esta manera recibirá mayores ingresos, por que abastecerá a todos sus clientes y cubrirá la demanda, con esos ingresos proporcionara a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

Él piensa trabajar muy duro en la crianza de pollos y solo dedicarse a eso, ya que es la actividad que más ingresos recibe, también desea construir su propia casa ya que vive en casa de su mamá, el terreno ya lo tiene solo falta construir.
texts.en:
Wilian is 38 years old and lives with his life partner and two children.  He has worked raising chickens for ten years.  He began helping a neighbor who was doing this work.  Then his neighbor gave him 50 chickens on credit so he could fatten them and sell them by the pound.  Later he got together with his mother and they bought more than 100 chickens, quartered them, and sold them.

Currently Wilian is raising chickens every six weeks, which are the days of production.  He sells 500 pounds already delivered.  He has his customers, among whom he supplies a hotel and stores in various communities.  He buys 110 chickens in a city that is 56 miles from where he lives, and manages to get 100 five-pound chickens.  To buy the chickens he has to leave the house at 6:00 a.m., walk three-and-a-half kilometers, and board a vehicle that drives him to the city where he buys the chickens.  He buys them once a week along with the feed to feed them.  During farming season Wilian works growing basic grains to sell and also works as the assistant of a bricklayer.

Wilian is requesting the loan from Fundación Campo to buy 125 more chickens and feed to feed those he already has and those he will buy, because the demand is growing.  Once they reach their weight he quarters them, cleans them, and sells them by the pound.  He also will expand the farm for at least 50 more chickens.  In this way he will receive greater income, because he will supply all his customers and meet the demand.  With this income he will give his family a better quality of life.

He plans to work very hard raising the chickens and work only on this, since this is the work from which he gets the most income.  He also wants to construct his own house because he lives in his mother's house.  He already has the plot of land; he only needs to build.

loans.use: to buy 125 more chickens and feed to feed them, and to expand the farm.

loans.name: Martin

texts.en:
Martin is 32 years old and lives in the town of Tororo in the Mbale region of Uganda. He is married and has two children; one of them is currently in school. For the past five years, Martin has been working hard to manage his small business, which sells firewood. 

To help expand his business, Martin has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more firewood for resale, and will help Martin to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his child. Martin hopes that in the future, he will be able to educate his children. 

Martin is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small-scale entrepreneurs like Martin who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to buy more firewood for resale.

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Eric is 34 years old and married to Schola. They have not yet been blessed with a child.

Eric operates a barber shop. He has been in this business for the last 12 years and gets an income of KES 29,000 per month.

He has a good credit history with KADET LTD and he is applying for his fourth loan of KES 70,000 from KADET LTD, which he plans to use to buy shaving machines. He will use the anticipated profits to add more stock. He hopes to open a big barber shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy shaving machines

loans.name: Gikera

texts.en:
Gikera is 63 years old and a mixed crop farmer. He is married to Wambui. They are blessed with two children. He has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 9,000, which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. Gikera will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
El señor Juan tiene 32 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos, uno de 10 años de edad que esta por comenzar a estudiar quinto grado, una hija de 7 años de edad que comenzara a estudiar primer grado y el más pequeño de sus hijos que tiene 7 meses. Viven en la casa que su suegra les dejo, la esposa de Juan elabora pequeñas ventas de productos en su casa, como: enchiladas y enrredos. El señor Juan es agricultor, pero por el momento esta trabajando como albañil.

El comenta que es agricultor, por que siempre le ha gustado, pero se dio cuenta que le generaba mejores ingresos y más rápido la albañilería. Por lo que comenzó a aprender desde la edad de 12 años de edad, su papá fue quien le enseño este oficio. Ahora con 32 años de edad, dice que le gusta más el oficio de albañil y así puede trabajar con sus hermanos y su papá.

Al principio todo trabajo lo realizaba con la ayuda de su padre, pues era él quien andaba las herramientas, con el paso del tiempo Juan ahorro dinero y fue comprando sus materiales, herramientas y equipo de trabajo, por eso ya no depende tanto de su padre y realiza trabajos de manera independiente, pero comento que siempre es mejor trabajar en familia.

El préstamo que solicita a Fundación Campo, es para cancelar una deuda que tiene y para que sus dos hijos mayores puedan iniciar sus clases sin ningún problema. Él piensa continuar trabajando con ánimos, por su familia, comento que todo padre responsable esta obligado a trabajar por sus hijos, además quiere que en un futuro su hijo mayor aprenda el oficio de su padre así como él aprendió el suyo.
texts.en:
Juan is 32, lives with his partner, and has three children. One is 10 years old and about to start fifth grade; a 7-year-old daughter will start first grade. The smallest of his children is 7 months old. They live in the house his mother-in-law left them. Juan's wife has a small business in their home selling enchiladas and enredos (snack food made from fried yuca).

Juan is a farmer, but at the present time he is working in construction. He says that he farms because he has always liked it. But he realized that he earned more income, more quickly, doing construction. 

So he started to learn from the age of 12. His father taught him this trade. Now 32, he says he likes the construction trade better, and in this way he can work with his siblings and his father. In the beginning, he did every job with his father's help, as he was the one who had the tools. 

As time went on, Juan saved money and started buying his materials, tools, and work equipment. That's why he no longer depends so much on his father, and does jobs independently. But he says it is always better to work as a family. 

He is applying to Fundación Campo for a loan, in order to pay off a debt that he has, and so that his elder children can start classes without any problem. He plans to continue working energetically for his family. He says that every responsible father is obliged to work for his children. In addition, someday he wants his eldest son to learn his father's trade, just as he learned it from his.

loans.use: To pay off a debt he has, and so that his two older children can start their classes without any problem.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 45 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has two children. One of her children is currently in school. For the past nine years, Mary has been working hard to manage her health clinic, which sells medicine. 

To help expand her business, Mary has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more drugs for resale and will help Mary to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her child. Mary hopes that in the future she will be able to open a pharmacy. 

Mary is a member of BRAC's Small Enterprise Program (SEP). The program primarily serves small entrepreneurs like Mary who do not have enough collateral for commercial loans, but have businesses that have grown too large for microloans.

loans.use: to purchase more drugs (medicine) for resale,

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is from a small village in South Georgia. She is 49 years old, married and lives with her family: her husband, Amiran, two adult sons (24 and 22 years old) and a daughter-in-law. Mariam’s sons work as sawyers in a local sawmill. Mariam and Amiran lead the agricultural business of the family. They have two milk cows and six calves. Mariam produces cheese and sells it on the local open market. In addition, the family owns one hectare of land, where potato and haricot (beans) are grown. Harvested products are also sold on the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 800 Laris. 

Mariam requested a loan to purchase calves. She will raise the calves for a couple of months and in late spring, she will sell them for a higher price. The family will get additional income. Mariam plans to make some savings in the future, in order to renovate the family house, as it is already old and needs some repair.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Eldjan

texts.ru: Eldjan 33 goda. On yavlyayetsya IDP personom (Внутренне перемещённое лицо (ВПЛ) - человек, который был вынужден внезапно бежать из своего дома в результате вооружённого конфликта, насилия, нарушений прав человека, стихийных бедствий или других катастроф, но, в отличие от беженца, не перешел международную границу и находящийся на территории собственной страны (источник: Управления ООН по Координации Гуманитарных Вопросов))pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy. On  jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Uje 4 qoda kak Eldjan zanimayetsya pochinkoy mashin. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit nujniye instrumenti i zapchasti dlya pochinki mashin i razvitiya svoyego biznessa v dalneyshom. Etomu biznessu on nauchilsya u svoyego dyadi kotoriy toje zanimayetsya pochinkoy mashin.
texts.en:
Eldjan is 33 years old.  He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the town of Fuzuli and currently lives in the Fuzuli region with his loving family.  He is married and has two children.  He has been involved in automobile repair for 4 years.  He currently needs 2,000 AZN in order to buy necessary tools and spare parts for car repair, to further develop his business.  He learned this business from his uncle who is also involved in car repair.

An internally displaced person (IDP) is a person, who was forced to suddenly flee his home as a result of a military conflict, violence, violation of human rights, natural disasters or other catastrophes, but what differentiates him from a refugee is the fact that did not cross an international border and is located on the territory of his own country (source: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs).

loans.use: to buy new tools and spare parts.

loans.name: Aura Sofia

texts.es: Aura está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva y es justamente el tercero que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con esta nueva inversión comprará ropa, accesorios, calzado colegial y articulos de carnaval que son los principales pedidos que han hecho sus clientes en esta temporada donde se incrementan las ventas usualmente., con su otros credikiva pudo ampliar su cobetura de clientes en Bosconia, Cienaga, Monteria y Cartagena, ciudades y poblaciones de Colombia hacia donde viaja para llevar a cabo sus mejores ventas. Ella envia el siguiente mensaje a sus finaciadores : "Muchos agradecimientos a Kiva y a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, espero seguir prosperando con su apoyo financiero. "
texts.en: Aura is applying for a new Kiva loan, and it is the third which she has received from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo [Mario Santo Domingo Foundation]. With this new investment she will purchase clothes, accessories, school shoes, and carnival items, which are the main requests her customers have made of her during this season when her sales usually increase. With her other Kiva loans, she was able to increase her number of customers in Bosconia, Cienaga, Monteria, and Cartagena, Colombian cities and towns she travels to so as to make her best sales. She has the following message for her financiers: “I am very grateful to Kiva and the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. I hope to continue prospering with your financial support.”

loans.use: to purchase clothing, accessories, school shoes, and carnival items.

loans.name: 33 - Arocagua Group

texts.es:
El grupo 33 AROCAGUA esta compuesto por 8  personas seis mujeres y 2 varones,  todas las socia viven en la zona de Arocagua de ahí el nombre del banco  la mesa directiva se encuentra compuesta de la siguiente manera: 
La presidenta es la Sra. Cintya vive en casa familiar de la madre en la zona de Arocagua, no tiene hijos, la mencionada señora es buena líder por eso fue elegida por sus compañeras por su solidaridad y responsabilidad, ella se dedica a la fabricación de letreros para distintas instituciones, pensiones, taxis, micros, se dedica a esta actividad hace ya 4 años, con el dinero del crédito comprar materiales para la realización de letreros como pinturas, con esta actividad se mantiene y mantiene a su familia que esta compuesta por sus padres y hermanos, es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por el apoyo que le brindan ya que de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida de toda su familia; en el grupo hay dos varones  uno es chofer con taxi propio y el otro cuenta con negocio propio de vajillas. Los socios solicitan el crédito para invertir en el aumento de su mercadería para su negocio.
texts.en:
The '33 AROCAGUA' communal bank consists of 8 members, six women and two men. They all live in the area of Arocagua, hence their group name. 

The President of the Board is Cintya, who lives in the family house with her mother in the Arocagua area. She does not have any children. Cintya is a good leader and was elected by her colleagues due to her solidarity and responsible nature. She manufactures signs for various institutions, restaurants, taxis, buses, etc. She has been doing this for 4 years. 

With the money from this loan, Cintya will purchase materials for the production of signs, such as paints. Through her work she is able to support herself and her family, including her parents and siblings. She is a hardworking person and she is very happy to be receiving this support which will help her improve the quality of life for her family. 

There are two men in the group, one is a taxi driver and the other has his own tableware business. The members are seeking a loan to invest in supplementing their businesses with more merchandise.

loans.use: to purchase paint materials for producing signs

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
El señor Julio Cesar es un hombre de 27 años que decidió desde hace 2 años iniciar una empresa, en la cual se dedicaría a la construcción metálica, es decir a la soldadura debido a que gracias a su empeño y dedicación logró estudiar sobre este tema y conoce mucho del mismo. Es bueno saber que el señor Julio Cesar no sólo sabe sobre la soldadura si no que también ama su trabajo y es algo que le apasiona, sentimientos que lo ayudan constantemente a seguir adelante.

Julio Cesar tiene una pequeña familia, conformada por su esposa y su pequeña hija, ellas dos son la motivación principal y siempre está deseoso de brindarles lo mejor y sacarlas adelante, el quiere que tengan una buena calidad de vida y disfruten el día a día.

Con la ayuda de los prestatarios Kiva, Julio Cesar podrá comprar una máquina de soldar que tanto necesita, también desea poder remodelar su local para que sus clientes se sientan cómodos cuando ingresen al mismo. Su esperanza y meta es continuar en este negocio y con mucho esfuerzo salir adelante, sacar adelante a este pequeño negocio y convertirlo en uno de los mejores de la zona de San Clemente, lugar en donde vive. Julio Cesar desde ya está muy agradecido y está seguro que logrará grandes cosas con este apoyo que se le empieza a brindar, es consciente que es la mejor manera de generar los ingresos necesarios para convertir a su hija en una gran profesional y desde luego que también se enamore de su carrera, ya que él piensa que es la mejor manera de hacer muy bien las cosas y sobre todo vivir feliz.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar is a twenty-seven year old man who decided to begin his own business two years ago. His business is metal construction, or spot welding. Thanks to his determination and dedication, he succeeded in studying this art and knows a lot about it. It is good to know that Julio Cesar not only knows about spot welding, but he also loves his work and is passionate about it. These sentiments constantly help him to get ahead.

Julio Cesar has a small family, made up of his wife and little daughter. These two are his primary motivation, and he is always looking to offer them the best in life and to help them get ahead. He wants them to have a good quality of life, and also to enjoy every day.

With the help of the Kiva loan funders, Julio Cesar will be able to purchase a spot welding machine, which he needs. He would also like to remodel his shop so that his customers will feel comfortable when they enter it. His hope and goal is to continue in this business, and with hard work, to get ahead, improving his small business and converting it into one of the best in the San Clemente neighborhood, where he lives. Julio Cesar is very grateful, and is sure that with this help, which he is beginning to receive, he will achieve great things. He is aware that this is the best way to create the revenue necessary to help his daughter become a great professional. Of course, he is also enamored of his profession, since he believes that it is the best way to accomplish what he wants and to live happily.

loans.use: to purchase a spot welding machine and to remodel his shop.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen de 58 años vive al sur occidente de la ciudad, donde tiene un negocio, que identifica una tienda y miscelánea a la vez, pues en él  sus clientes encuentran desde panes, pudines,  refrescos y en general pocas cantidades de artículos de la canasta familiar, así como también perfumes, ropa informal, chancletas etc. En su negocio Carmen vende a crédito y principalmente de contado a una clientela ubicada alrededor de su barrio, porque  se encuentra en una avenida muy reconocida, por ser un gran corredor comercial y esto potencializa su mercado. Con este negocio ella  ha logrado su crecimiento personal, el fortalecimiento de su autonomía y también la generación  de sus ingresos para el sostenimiento familiar, formada por sus dos hijas mayores, que la apoyan y siempre han sido su fuente de inspiración para trabajar persistentemente y salir adelante.  Su meta mas adelante es tener un local separado de la vivienda, para disfrutar de su sosiego familiar. Su mayor desafío es tener el suficiente capital de trabajo para responder a su creciente clientela que permanentemente hace pedidos. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará dulces, bebidas y refrescos, aprovechando que se acera una temporada de festividades y son los productos que mas se venden, lo cual garantiza el éxito de la inversión. Carmen en su negocio tiene una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menores del 22%, una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 8 días y de inventarios también cada 8 días, índices financieros desde los cuales se planea su crecimiento.
texts.en: Carmen is 58 years old and lives in the southwest part of the city, where she has her business. She identifies her business as both a grocery and a miscellaneous goods store, since her customers find everything from breads, puddings, soda pop, and, generally, small quantities of items necessary for everyday living, as well as perfume, casual clothing, and sandals, etc. In her business, Carmen sells on credit and principally in cash to customers located nearby in her neighborhood, since she is located on a well-recognized avenue, a large commercial corridor, which provides her with a good market. With this business she has achieved personal growth, strengthened her autonomy, and also generated revenue to sustain her family, which is made up of two grown daughters who support her and have always been her source of inspiration to work persistently and to get ahead. Her future goal is to have a shop separate from her home so she may enjoy a calm home. Her greatest challenge is to have sufficient working capital to respond to her growing customer base which always makes orders. This is the reason for which she has turned to her first Kiva loan, the first loan she has requested from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo [Mario Santo Domingo Foundation]. She will purchase sweets, drinks, and soda pop with the loan, taking advantage of the coming festival season by stocking the items she sells the most, which will guarantee a successful investment. Carmen has a 22% retail sales profit in her business, her account charge cycle is eight days, and her restocking cycle is also eight days. From these financial indicators she has planned her business growth.

loans.use: to purchase sweets, drinks, and soda pop.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda vive en el municipio de Soledad,  a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Barranquilla, con su esposo y tiene 4 hijos en las edades de 11 a 28 años. Allí se dedica a la confección de prendas de vestir y a la venta de mercancías variada, mediante 3 guías especializadas de productos. Su principal negocio es la confección,  actividad en la que se ha desempeñado desde hace 20 años;  aprendió este arte y lo practicó fabricando artesanalmente vestidos a las medidas de sus amigas y vecinas, con ello recibió ingresos y gradualmente aumentó su oferta y su clientela; a ella   fue promocionándole productos de belleza y mercancías que poco a poco le encargaban encargando. En la actualidad su sueño de crecimiento aun persiste y quiere ampliar su clientela, pero su capital de trabajo se torna insuficiente,  para responderle como ella quisiera, con mayor oportunidad; esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el cual comprará telas e insumos,  ropa, cosméticos entre otras mercancías, que vienen con muy buenos descuentos en los catálogos y que han sido solicitadas por sus clientes, porque consiguen un mejor precio. Su meta es lograr el crecimiento de sus ingresos y de sus ganancias para aumentar su bienestar  y el de su familia cada vez más.
texts.en: Yolanda lives in the town of Soledad, 15 from the city of Barranquilla, with her husband and 4 children, aged between 11 and 28. She divides her time between making items of clothing, and selling 3 different types of goods. Her main business is the dressmaking, an activity she has been doing in the 20 years since she learned this art. She started out making bespoke dresses to the measurements of her friends and neighbours, and with the income from that she gradually expanded her range and her client base. She began offering beauty products and other goods that slowly took precedence. Her dream of growth is still with her, and she wants to increase her client base once more, but her working capital is not enough to respond to her customers' demands. This is her reason for seeking a Kiva loan, her first finance from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. With it she will buy fabric and notions, clothes, and cosmetics, along with such other merchandise as she can get at a good discount through the catalogues and that her customers have requested her to get at the best price. Her goal is to succeed in growing her income, to improve her wellbeing and that of her family each day.

loans.use: To buy fabric and notions, clothes, and cosmetics, among other merchandise.

loans.name: Chantha

texts.en:
Chantha is a weaver, while her husband, Rayot, is a construction worker. They have been married since 2002 and live on an island in the Mekong River, about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Chantha has asked for Kiva loans in the past. She is now requesting another loan of $300 to add to her own money to buy a motorcycle for commuting. Before, Chantha’s family already had a motorbike for commuting. But her husband got in an accident and the motorbike was damaged. That’s why she decided to sell the motorbike.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Sokla

texts.en:
Sokla, age 30, is a lotus farmer. She lives in a village about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. She has one young daughter.

Sokla is asking for a loan of $800 to assist in her lotus farm by buying seeds, fertilizer and pesticide.

Photo: Sokla and her daughter left; her mother is on the right.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticide

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
Sok (pictured here) is 29 years old and her husband Chheng is 27 years old. They live in a suburb of Phnom Penh about 25 kilometers outside of the city.They have been married for one year and have one young daughter. 

Sok is a garment worker, while her husband is a motorcycle repairman. She is asking for a loan of $800 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for commuting.

loans.name: Pao

texts.en:
Pao (pictured in front of her pigpen) raises pig at home, while her husband, Oun is a construction worker. They have been married since 1990 and have one son and two daughters. One is married and lives outside the family home, and others attend school. The family is living in a village about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 

Pao is applying for her firs loan of $1,000 to assist in her pig-farming by buying pig feed.

loans.use: to buy pig feed.

loans.name: Sambo

texts.en:
Sambo (in the photo), age 34, is a construction worker, while his wife, Senghan, age 37, stays at home and does housework. They have been married since 2004 and have two children-one son and one daughter. One attends school and another one is still young. They live in a small village about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. 
Sambo wants to supplement new pig farming business, because his wife has no job and just stays at home. Hence Sambo decides to apply for a loan of $500 to buy pigs for his wife to raise and build pigpen.

loans.use: To buy pigs and build a pigpen.

loans.name: Rosa Idalia

texts.es:
Rosa, vive en casa familiar con una prima y un sobrino, ella administra una tienda de productos domésticos y una fotocopiadora, ella tiene varios años de estar en el negocio. Actualmente necesita solicitar un préstamo para la compra de harinas, pastas, embutidos, huevos, leche, azúcar, para la tienda pero tambien comprara papelería para la fotocopiadora.
Esta compra le ayudara para surtir el negocio y brindar un buen servicio a los clientes, su objetivo es mantener todo lo necesario para seguir produciendo ingresos.
texts.en:
Rosa lives in the family home with a cousin and her nephew. She manages a store selling household products and has a photocopier, and has been in this business for several years. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of flour, pasta, sausages, eggs, milk and sugar for the store, and also to buy paper supplies for the photocopier.

These investments will help Rosa to stock her business and provide good service to her customers. Her goal is to obtain everything she needs to continue to earn an income.

loans.use: to purchase flour, pasta, sausages, eggs, milk and sugar.

loans.name: Jorhans

texts.en:
Jorhans is a 33-year-old farmer who is married to Merianti, a 30-year-old lady. Jorhans is blessed with two children: Rendy, 6 years old and attending the first grade of Elementary School; and Thea, 3 years old.

In order to cover his family needs, Jorhans cultivates corn and vegetables i.e. lettuce, cabbage, water spinach and mustard greens to be sold at the market. Jorhans intends to cultivate more vegetable but he needs a plot of land to cultivate the seeds. 
 
He is requesting a loan from TLM amounting to IDR 5,000,000. He would like to use the loan to hire a plot of land for farming. Jorhans is hoping that he can get the loan as soon as possible.

loans.use: to hire a plot of land for farming.

loans.name: Sivorn

texts.en:
Sivorn (in the photo), age 45, is a widow with two daughter. One daughter is married and lives outside the family home and another one is in school. She lives in a suburb of Phnom Penh. 

Sivorn sells groceries. She is asking for a loan of $1,200 to buy additional grocery items for sale. In addition, she wants to supplement a new pig farming business, so she will use a part of the loan to buy pig to raise.

loans.use: To buy additional grocery items for sale and supplement new business by launching pig farming.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 39 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with four children.

Melinda has a shop that sells clothing like t-shirts, blouses, and underwear. She has had this business for five years. She has requested a loan of PHP 8,000 to buy stocks of clothing for sale.

Melinda has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Melinda hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of clothing for sale.

loans.name: Analiz

texts.en:
Analiz is 21 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is single. 

Analiz has a retail shop where she buys & sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for two years. She requested a loan for 8,000 PHP to buy stocks of canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Analiz has been a member of HSPFI since 2010.  In the future, Analiz hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages to sell.

loans.name: Eziel

texts.en:
Eziel is 26 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with one child. 

Eziel has a shop where she makes & sells frozen food like chicken & hotdogs. She has had this business for four years. She requested a loan of 5,000 PHP to buy stocks of frozen food for sell like hotdogs & chicken.

Eziel has been a member of HSPFI since 2011.  In the future, Eziel hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy stocks of frozen food for sell like hotdogs & chicken

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Ny is married and resides with her husband and three children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She has been pumping water to sell to villagers for over six years and is successful in this career. Her husband is a retired soldier. Two of her children are employed; one is a garment worker and another one is a fisherman. 

Because it is difficult for her children to travel to work, Ny is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work. 

In the future, she would like to expand her business, renew her house and support her children to study at a higher level.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her children to commute to work.

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en:
Elisa is married with 3 children. She is 40 years old and lives in the Philippines.
Elisa is a farmer and grows coconuts to earn a living. She has been doing this for 12 years. She has requested a loan of 40,000 to purchase more fertilizers for her farm. 
Elisa has been a member of PMPC for almost 3 years.

loans.use: to purchase more fertilizers for her farm

loans.name: Panda 2 Group

texts.en: Eldawati is 46 years old and married with one child who is still in school. In 2006, she opened a small store that sells books and stationery at traditional market. Her business is going well and it helps supplement her husband’s income as an employee to provide for her family's needs. She is taking her first loan with VisionFund Indonesia to add more types of goods to be sold and to buy a new display window. In the future, she wants to open a new store near her house and have enough savings to send her child for a better education. Other group members will use their loans to improve their businesses such as selling fried chicken, selling bananas, selling vegetables, etc.

loans.use: to pay for more inventory to sell

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea, 31, is married and resides with her husband and two school-age children in Kampong Chhnang Province, Cambodia. 

She and her husband have been raising fish to sell for over ten years and are successful in their careers. Additionally, she runs a grocery store at home to generate more income for the family. 

In order to improve her family living conditions, Sophea is requesting a loan of USD 1,000 to purchase more groceries to sell to generate extra income. In the future, she would like to expand her business and support her children to study until they get bachelor's degrees.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell to generate extra income.

loans.name: Jembatan Buah 3 Group

texts.en: Dewi is a mother of two children. Since 2007, she has been selling fish such as goldfish and catfish at traditional market. Her business is going well and she has a lot of customers. This is her second loan with VisionFund Indonesia. She plans to use this loan to add more variety of fish. With the income from her business, she can cover her daily basic needs and she hopes she can have enough savings to send her children to school. Other group members will use their loans to improve their businesses such as selling chicken, selling porridge and selling cell phone minutes refill.

loans.use: to pay for more variety of fish

loans.name: Harmoni Indah 3 Group

texts.en:
Siti is married with four children. All of her children are already married. She opened a general store in front of her house and she has been doing this for two years. Her business is doing well but she wants to take a loan to pay for materials to repair store. In the future, she wants to expand the space of the store to place more different kinds of goods.

Other group members will use their loans to improve their businesses such as selling burgers and selling meat balls.

loans.use: to pay for materials to repair store

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: La Sra. lidia tiene como actividad a la fabricación de muebles y venta de muebles de madera actividad que realiza juntamente con su hija,   los cuales  comercializa en la populosa feria de la 16 de julio, esta actividad es su principal fuente de ingreso para ellas y sus familias, es una Sra. muy emprendedora  y con muchas ganas de salir adelante en esta actividad, ya que se dedica mucho tiempo a esta actividad, la Sra. se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado, ya que le permite crecer en su negocio, En esta ocasión solicitan financiamiento para aumentar su capital de trabajo comprando madera y materiales para fabricar muebles y así cubrir la demanda actual que tiene, esta es la única actividad con sustenta a su familia.
texts.en: Lidia makes and sells wood furniture, together with her daughter.  They sell the furniture at the crowded "16 de Julio" fair.  This is the main source of income for them and their families.  Lidia is very enterprising and determined to get ahead in her business to which she dedicates much time.  She is happy and grateful to the institution for the support received which will help her grow her business.  She is requesting a loan to increase her working capital to buy wood and materials to make furniture so she can meet the current demand.  This is the only business supporting her family.

loans.use: To buy materials to make furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy clothing and begin selling merchandise again.

loans.name: Carmela Ester

texts.es: Carmela de 55 años de edad, tiene desde hace 5 años una miscelánea donde vende ropa, ella  desea agregarle nuevos productos, para captar la atención de clientes e incrementar su mercado. Su meta es lograr que su miscelánea esté más surtida y cotizada en su barrio y que todo el sector se entere de que existen todo tipo de mercancías, en este punto comercial. Actualmente sus ventas las hace a crédito a una clientela selecta que tiene tiempo de estarle comprando y otras de sus ventas las hace de contado, cuando apenas empiezan su relación comercial con los compradores. Carmela últimamente ha agregado a su negocio productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumes y mercancías varias que sus clientes le encargan y con los que les ha ido muy bien; ella quiere invertir en esta mercancía pero no es suficiente el capital de trabajo para responder a su nueva clientela, esta es la razón por la cual acude a su credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con la cual comprará perfumes, cosméticos, accesorios femeninos e infantiles. Esta inversión planea será exitosa,  porque está basada en pedidos que hacen potenciales compradores, referidos por sus clientes rentables y que por su experiencia manejará con mucho cuidado. En su negocio Carmela maneja una rotación de cuentas por cobrar de 15 días, una rotación de inventarios de 12 días y una rentabilidad sobre las ventas no menor del 38%,, razones financieras acordes a este tipo de negocios y sobre la cual se planea su crecimiento.
texts.en:
Carmela, 55, has been selling clothing for five years but she would like to add new products to attract more customers and increase her market share.  Her goal is to have a well-stocked, reputable shop in her neighborhood that everyone would know about because of its variety of merchandise.  Currently she sells items on a credit basis to select customers who have been loyal for some time.  She also sells on a cash basis when beginning a commercial relationship with shoppers.  Lately, Carmela has added a line of beauty products, cosmetics perfumes and varied merchandise that her customers order, which is doing very well.  

She wants to buy more of this type of merchandise but does not have enough working capital to respond to new customers.  So she is requesting a Credikiva loan, her first, through the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, which she will use to buy perfumes, cosmetics, and women's and children's accessories.  She believes this investment will be successful because it is based on orders made by potential customers who have been referred to her by good customers, and which she will handle with much care.  Carmela's accounts receivable turnover is 15 days and her inventory turnover is 12 days, with a profit over sales of no less than 38%, financial data in line with this type of business and which she uses to plan her growth.

loans.use: To buy perfumes, cosmetics, and women's and children's accessories.

loans.name: Cofel Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe porte le nom de COFEL qui signifie Amour du prochain a été créé depuis le premier cycle du BV .Il regroupe actuellement 10 femmes qui habitent toutes le même village et partageant de bonnes  valeurs sociales.

Madame Joséphine Maty (debout à gauche sur la photo et levant la main) est responsable de ce groupe. Elle est une femme mariée âgée de 46 ans  et mère de 7 enfants. Elle est membre du BV depuis le premier cycle et elle développe de bonnes relations avec ses camarades de Banc Villageois.

Joséphine s'active dans le commerce de détails par la vente de sel, d'arachides et de porcs. Elle a une bonne expérience dans son domaine d'activité pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis longtemps.

Son nouveau crédit de 50.000 CFA  lui permettra de payer du sel des bouillons cubes et un porc destiné à la revente au niveau du petit marché de son village.

Avec ses bénéfices elle va payer des fournitures scolaires à ses enfants et épargner dans son compte au niveau du Banc Villageois.
texts.en: This group bears the name COFEL which means Love of the next one, and has been in existence since the creation of the BV (banc villageois). It currently comprises 10 women who all live in the same village and share positive social values. Joséphine Maty (standing on the left of the photo with her hand raised) is the group leader. She is a married woman, 46 years old and the mother of 7 children. She has been a member of the BV since the beginning and she has developed a good relationship with her friends within the Banc Villageois.  Joséphine is a retailer, active in the trading of salt, groundnuts and pigs. She has sound experience in this area, having worked in it for a long time. This latest loan of 50,000 CFA will allow her to purchase some salt, some stock cubes and also a pig for resale at the little marketplace in her village. With her profits she will buy school equipment for the children, and put some savings into her account with the Banc Villageois.

loans.use: to purchase groundnuts, salt, stock cubes and a pig which will be reared and resold at a later date.

loans.name: Felicita Yadira

texts.es:
Felicita  Yadira vive con su familia en una comunidad llamada desamparados, en la provincia de San Jose, capital de Costa Rica. En esta zona cuenta con una amplia gama de hoteles y le ofrece al turista museos, restaurantes, parques, volcanes centros de conferencias, modernos centros comerciales, cines, teatros, galerías y mucha y variada diversión nocturna. Dentro de las principales atracciones culturales se encuentra el Teatro Nacional, situado en la Plaza de la Cultura e inaugurado en 1897, el Museo del Oro, el Museo de Arte y Diseño Contemporáneo y el Museo de los Niños. Algunas de las más famosas fiestas y celebraciones de la provincia de San José son las fiestas populares de fin y principio de cada año, el Festival de La Luz, en el mes de diciembre y la exposición nacional de orquídeas, en el mes de marzo.

Felicita Yadira se dedica desde hace un año  atrás a la venta por catálogos de artículos para el hogar, perfumes, cremas, maquillaje y cuadros. Ha sentido un gran apoyo por parte de los vecinos de la comunidad. Ella desea hacer crecer su negocio, para asi tener más ingresos económicos y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.

Es por esto que Felicita Yadira está solicitando el monto de 100,000.00 (cien mil colones), para la compra de mercadería para la venta de su catalogo y continuar dando un excelente servicio en su comunidad.

Felicita Yadira es miembro de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de Rincón Grande S.A, este será su segundo préstamo razón por la cual está  muy agradecida por las oportunidades  de acceso al crédito que esta le brinda y poder llevar a cabo sus proyectos de vida.
texts.en:
Felicita Yadira lives with her family in a community called Desamparados in the province of San Jose, capital of Costa Rica.  This area has many hotels and offers tourists museums, restaurants, parks, volcanoes, conference centers, modern shopping centers, cinemas, theaters, galleries and much nightlife.  Among the main cultural attractions are the National Theater located in the Plaza de la Cultura and inaugurated in 1897, the Gold Museum, the Contemporary Art and Design Museum and the Children's Museum.  Some of the most famous festivities and celebrations in the province of San José are the popular New Year's festivals, the Light Festival in the month of December and the National Orchid Exhibit in the month of March.

For a year Felicita Yadira has been selling merchandise by catalogue, such as household products, perfumes, creams, make-up and paintings.  She has received great support from the neighbors in her community.  She wants to expand her business to make more income and give her family a better quality of life.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan in the amount of 100,000 CRC to buy catalogue merchandise so she can continue giving her community excellent service.

Felicita Yadira is a member of the communal bank "Rincón Grande S.A." and this is her second loan.  She is very grateful for this loan opportunity that will allow her to meet her goals.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Inocencia

texts.es:
La  socia Inocencia; continua con su negocio de panaderia, la socia invierte su dinero en la compra de productos para la elaboracion de panes, pasteles, tortas entre otros. La socia  desea invertir en la compra de 
harina, manteca, levadura, leña; la socia desea invertir el prestamo en la compra de leña al por mayor, manteca, levadura, para la elaboracion de los panes, panecillos, tortas, pasteles.
texts.en:
Inocencia keeps on running her bakery, investing her money in the purchase of products to prepare such as bread, confectionery and cakes among others. 
She wants to buy flour, butter, yeast and firewood. She wants to invest the money of the loan in the purchase of firewood at wholesale price, butter and yeast to prepare bread, bread rolls, cakes and confectionery.

loans.use: To buy firewood and products to prepare her bread and pastry (flour, butter, yeast).

loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe déggo composé de huit membres a été fondé depuis l'inauguration du Banc Villageois . Il regroupe des femmes habitant le même village et partageant des valeurs sociales communes.

Sa responsable Anna  est une femme mariée âgée de 52 ans elle est mère de trois enfants. Elle est debout à l'extrême gauche de la photo.

Son activité se trouve être le commerce de détails par la vente de savons en poudre de sucre des arachides mais également la vente de porcs. 

Son nouveau crédit de 50.000 CFA lui permettra de se procurer la marchandise pré citée.

Avec ses bénéfices elle achète des fournitures scolaires et des ordonnances pour ses enfants en cas de besoin.
texts.en: The déggo group of eight members was founded at the same time as the Banc Villageois. It contains women who live in the same village, and who share common social values. The leader Anna is a married women aged 52, a mother of three children. She is standing on the far left of the photo. Her business activity is small scale retail including the sale of soap powder, sugar and groundnuts, but also the sale of pigs. This latest loan of 50,000 CFA will allow her to purchase the above mentioned merchandise. With her profits she will purchase equipment for school, and prescription medication for her children as required.

loans.use: acheter de produits et deux petits porcs qu elle va élevé pour revendre plutard.

loans.name: Ferney Alberto

texts.es:
Ferney es una persona muy trabajadora que siempre ha querido brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa y su hijo de 1 año. Ferney se ha dedicado gran parte de su vida como operario en una empresa de construcción, y aprovechando que su suegro le brindó un pequeño corral, esta iniciando la actividad de la cría de cerdos. Ferney ha aprovechado esta oportunidad con el ánimo de poder generar mayores ingresos para su hogar y ofrecerles una mejor calidad de vida. Ferney trabaja durante todo el día en la empresa de construcción, y cuando termina su jornada laboral se dirige a su hogar a cuidar la cría de cerdo que tiene. Actualmente Ferney solo tiene una sola cría, sin embargo ya esta haciendo planes para aumentar su capacidad. Es por esto que Ferney esta buscando poder ampliar su corral de modo que pueda tener un mayor número de cerdos. Sin embargo, Ferney no cuenta con el capital suficiente para realizar esta adecuación, por lo que espera que un préstamo le brinde la oportunidad de acceder a realizar mejoras locativas a su corral y de este modo pueda tener más cerdos en este.

Ferney espera con esto poder generar mayores ingresos en el momento que venda los cerdos, y de esta manera pueda ofrecerles a su esposa y su hijo una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Ferney is a very hard working person who has always wanted to offer his wife and 1 year old son a better quality of life. Ferney has spent a large part of his life as a machine operator at a construction company. Since his father in law offered him a small pen, he is beginning the activity of raising pigs. Ferney has taken advantage of this opportunity wanting to generate more income for his home and  offer them a better quality of life. Ferney works all day in the construction business and when he finishes his work day, he goes home to care for the pigs he has. At present, Ferney only has one litter, but he is making plans to increase his capacity. That is why he is looking to expand his pen so he can have a bigger number of pigs. However, Ferney doesn't have enough capital to do the improvement and he hopes that a loan will give him the opportunity to make improvements on the pen and thus be able to have more pigs there.  

Ferney hopes to be able to generate more income with this when he sells the pigs, and thus be able to offer his wife and son a better quality of life.

loans.use: to do improvements on his pen and be able to keep more pigs there.

loans.name: Emperatrices Group

texts.es: El banco Comunal EMPERATRICES esta compuesto por 8 socios que viven por la zona del octavo anillo, este grupo nació con la iniciativa de todos los socios del Barrio ya que necesitan para sus negocios e incremento de capital de trabajo, este Banco comunal  esta bajo la responsabilidad de la mesa directiva que son:                                 Presidente: La Sra.  Magaly que se dedica a la venta y producción de pan tiene 5 hijos menores de edad que se encuentran en edad escolar, el crédito que solicita es para compra de insumos como manteca y harina para la elaboración de pan, ella se levanta a tempranas horas dela mañana para la elaboración de su masa una terminados de hornear los distribuye en las distintas tiendas de barrio que hay por la zona, se dedica a esta actividad hace ya varios años, ya que esta actividad es la que permite mantener a su familia y la educación de sus hijos, la Sra. Magaly es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: The EMPERATRICES communal bank is made up of 8 members who live in the area of Octavo Anillo. This group was born on the initiative of all of the members of the neighborhood since they need it for their businesses and to increase their working capital. This communal bank is under the responsibility of the board of directors. The president is Magaly, who makes and sells bread. She has 5 minor children who are in school. The loan she is asking for is to buy ingredients such as lard and flour to make bread. She gets up very early in the morning to prepare the dough. When the bread is baked, she distributes it in different stores in the area. She has been doing this activity for several years. This activity is what allows her to support her family and educate her children. Magaly is a very responsible and hardworking and grateful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour and lard.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a 59-year-old mixed crop farmer, he is married to Elizabeth, a farmer. They are blessed with two children aged 25 and 23 years respectively. 

He has been in the farming business for the past three years with a monthly income of KES 19,000, which he uses to support his family.

Samuel is applying for his first loan term from KADET LTD, after being introduced by an existing KADET customer. He will use the loan to buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to venture into pig rearing, which will help him improve the living standard of his family.

loans.use: To buy seedlings and fertilizer for his farm

loans.name: Bunawona Womens Group New

texts.en:
Poultry sales are 45-year-old Berna's business. She has been engaged in this business for seven years now. The light-hearted mother of six operates from Kayunga.

Aside from this, she also ekes out more income from farming.

She says her monthly sales returns total UGX 500,000.

Berna says she intends to use her loan to purchase more poultry to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry to resell

loans.name: Kirui

texts.en:
Kirui is the father of two children, both aged below two years and has been in farming for ten years.

His farm is currently run with the help of one farmhand and produces milk and tea, which he sells locally. He says farming has been the source of livelihood for him and his family for the ten years that he has been active in this business.

He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. He says this will improve his farming income and help him build a good foundation for his children. He adds he will also acquire more capital to improve his farming business.

However, he says lack of capital, coupled with poor local markets is a big limitation to farmers.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Ramaz

texts.en:
Ramaz is 36 years old and lives in a small village in the southern part of the country. He lives in the family house with his father. 

Ramaz works as an operator in a local petrol station. His father is a construction worker. 
Along with their regular jobs, Ramaz and his father are running a small scale family agricultural business. They own 1.5 hectares of land, where potato and barley are grown. The harvested products are sold locally to retailers. 
The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris.

Ramaz requested credit to initiate a new business. They will purchase calves and raise them for a couple of months. In the late spring, the grown calves will be sold and the family will get additional income. The family will be able to improve the family living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase calves

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 33 years old. She is a business lady and is married to Nicodemus, a business man. They are blessed with three children. 

She has been a tailor for the past two years with the monthly income of KES 7,800, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD, after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Catherine will use the loan to buy clothing materials. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she will educate her child. Her hopes and dreams are to open a boutique shop.

loans.use: to buy clothing materials for sale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary, 38 years old, is married and has three children aged 10, 14 and 17. She has operated a green grocery for 5 years. Mary describes her business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Mary has been able to improve her living standards and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of KES 50,000 to buy potatoes, onions and beans

loans.use: To buy potatoes, onions and beans

loans.name: Benard

texts.en: Benard is a businessman.  He is married and has two children.  He runs a retail shop to earn a living.  He has been in this business for 3 years and has employed one person. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, George has been able to save his income.  He hopes to be financially stable in the future.  George has applied for 30,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy sugar, maize flour and tea leaves.

loans.use: buy sugar, maize flour and tea leaves

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a businessman.  He runs a retail shop and a motorcycle transport business to earn a living.   He has been in business for two years and has employed one person. He also earns extra income from his farming activities. 

Since he joined Faulu Kenya, George has been able to improve his living standards.  He hopes to expand his business in the future. George has applied for 50,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy maize flour, sodas and cooking oil.

loans.use: buy maize flour, sodas and cooking oil

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 25-year-old business lady. She is a single lady with no children. She has been running a salon for the past three years with the monthly income of about KES 10,500 which she uses to cover her basic needs.

She is applying for her first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by a KADET staff member. Mary will use the loan to buy a blow dryer and cosmetics for her salon. With the anticipated profit from the business she will expand her business. Her hopes and dreams are to save and continue with her education.

loans.use: To buy a blow dryer and cosmetics for her salon.

loans.name: Bramwell

texts.en:
Bramwell is 33 years old. He is married to Faith, who is a business lady, and they don't have a child yet. He operates a computer games and computer accessories business. He has been in the business for the past seven years and gets a monthly income of about KES 40,000 from his business.

This is his first loan term in KADET LTD. He will use the loan term to purchase a computer to help expand his business. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member. His dream is to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase a computer.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is 38 years old, married and has three children. She sells used clothes to earn a living.  She has been in the business for 13 years and has employed one person.  Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Emily has been able to save her income.  She hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 40,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy men's and women's suits.

loans.use: to buy suits

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is age 57 and married with 14 children, all adults save for the last two who are still schooling. He has been in farming for 23 years and currently produces maize, poultry, horticultural products and milk, which are all sold locally.

Charles has requested a loan of 62,400 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says this will improve his milk production and enable him to meet the education needs of the last born children. He aspires to have a bigger number of dairy cows and supply the entire local market.

He laments of the high cost of capital and unreliable rains.

loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josphine is 49 years old and is the mother of two children. 

She runs a chemist shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for eight years and describes her business environment as favorable because there is limited competition. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 50,000 Kenya Shillings to buy human medicine.

loans.use: To buy  human medicine

loans.name: Duncan

texts.en: Duncan is 39 years old. He has operated a bookstore for 3 years and has employed one person. He also sells sugar to earn extra income. He describes his business environment as good because there is limited competition. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Duncan has been able to grow his business. He hopes to be stable financially in the future. Duncan has applied for a loan of 30,000 Kenya Shillings (KES) to buy more textbooks to sell.

loans.use: To buy more textbooks to sell

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is 42 years old. She is a mother of three children. She runs a butcher shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for six years and has employed three people. 

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a meat-weighing scale.

loans.use: To buy  a meat-weighing scale.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is 35 years old, married, and has two children. She runs a beauty salon to earn a living; she has been in the business for four years and describes her business environment as good because she has many customers. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for a loan of 30,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy a hair blow drier.

loans.use: To buy a hair blow drier

loans.name: Kelvin

texts.en: Kelvin is 29 years old, married and has one child. He sells phone batteries and chargers to earn a living.  He has been in the business for 3 years and has employed one person. He also sells used clothes to earn extra income. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, Kelvin has been able to save income.  He hopes to expand his business in the future.  He has applied for 15,000 Kenyan Shillings to buy more phone batteries and phone chargers.

loans.use: buy phone batteries and chargers

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is 26 years old and married with two children. She runs a printing shop to earn a living. She has been in the business for 3 years and has employed one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has been able to save her income and hopes to expand her business in the future. She has applied for 40,000 Kenya Shillings to buy a printer.

loans.use: To buy a printer.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is 39 years old, married and has three children.  She does dairy farming to earn a living.  She has been in the business for 20 years and has employed one person. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, Jane has been able to grow her business and hopes to be financially stable in the future. She has applied for 10,900 Kenyan Shillings to buy a dairy cow.

loans.use: buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Simion

texts.en:
Simion has been in farming for 10 years in his hometown of Litein, where he lives with his family of 5 children, with the first three school-going. He sells his milk products locally.

He has requested a loan of 40,000 KES which he intends to use in purchasing a dairy cow. He adds he wants to acquire more dairy cows with his farming income and make it his source of livelihood.

Simion laments of the poor market for farm produce, especially locally due to low prices offered, as occasioned by the poor infrastructure to access distant markets.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Wambua

texts.en:
Wambua is 71 years old and a businessman. He is married to Doreen, a farmer. They are blessed with three children. He has been in a livestock trading business for the past five years with the monthly income of approximately KES 20,000 which he uses to support his family.

He is applying for his first loan term from KADET LTD after being introduced by KADET staff. Wambua will use the loan to buy more livestock for trading. 

With the anticipated profit from the business he will educate his children. His hopes and dreams are to buy a pickup for transporting the livestock to different markets.

loans.use: to buy more livestock for trading.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 54-year-old farmer from the village of Dzlevijvari, East Georgia. He is married and lives with his big family: his wife – Zoya, his 30-year-old son, his daughter-in-law and 2 grandchildren (5 and 3 years old). The only source of income for the family is agriculture. The family has a 4-hectare plot of land, where various vegetables and fruits are grown: cabbage, tomatoes, onions, haricot (green beans), beets, garlic, strawberries, pear trees and plum trees. The family sells harvested fruits and vegetables to local greengrocery retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is around 800 Laris. 

David requested credit for renting a tractor for land cultivation and for purchasing vegetable seeds. After proper cultivation and sowing quality seeds, the family will get a good harvest in the summer season. They will sell it for a good price and get their planned income. Part of the loan will be spent on the purchase of calves. David will grow calves till spring and sell them in April and May for a higher price. The family hopes that increased income will allow them to make some savings for house renovation, in order to fix up their old house and create better living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for land cultivation and to purchase vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Mwaminifu Group

texts.en:
Christina is in her late 30s. She is married and has three children who still go to school. She has been selling women's clothes and has had a grocery for five years now. She works from 4 p.m. to midnight, and she is able to make a good monthly profit.
 
This will be Christina's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her grocery stock, clothes stock, household expenses and school fees. She has paid back all her loans successfully. She wants a loan to increase her grocery stock by buying more beers, sodas, juice, spirits and to increase on women's clothes. Her dream is to one day be able to build her own house.

Christina will share this loan with her loan group "Mwaminifu," which has a total of 14 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loans.

loans.use: to increase grocery stock and clothes stock.

loans.name: Mathew

texts.en:
Mathew has been in active mixed farming in his hometown of Litein for 14 years and currently employs one farmhand.  His milk and tea produce go to the local market.  He also runs a retail shop for additional income.  He is married with 4 children, with the last three still in school.

Mathew has requested a loan of 30,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy poultry birds for a new venture into poultry farming.  He says improved income will help him in paying for the education of the children.  He is looking forward a venture into poultry farming and hopes to grow fast enough to pay for the education of his children.

Mathew says poor markets for agricultural products remains a challenge.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 22 years old and single. He does not support anybody. He is in the poultry farming business, and he has been in this business for two years and earns a monthly income of KES. 17,000.


He is requesting a loan of Kshs 35,000 to buy more chicks and chick mash. The anticipated profit would help him venture into other businesses. 


His hope and dream is to become the best supplier of chicks and chicken products within his location.

loans.use: To buy more chicks and chick mash.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 31 years old. She is married to David and together they have a 10-year-old child. She sells cereals and has been in the business for the past six years. She gets a monthly income of about 40,000 KES from her business.

This is her first term loan in KADET LTD. She will use the loan amount to purchase a stock of beans, green grams (mung beans) and maize. She was introduced to KADET LTD, by a KADET staff member. Her dream is to expand her sales to wholesale.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of beans, green grams (mung beans) and dry maize.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Hannah is 32 years old. She is a single mother of two children, aged 10 and 8. She sells potatoes and carrots at retail prices. She gets a monthly income of about 19,500 KES and has been in the business for the past ten years.

This is her first term loan in KADET LTD. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member. She will use the loan amount as capital to expand her business to wholesale. Her dream is to open another outlet for her business to increase her income.

loans.use: to expand her business to wholesale.

loans.name: Kingugi Group

texts.en:
Subira is in her late thirties and is married with three children  She has been a food vendor for one year now. She works from 8am to 9pm and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Subira’s first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She hopes for a loan to open a clothes shop.  Her dream is to one day build her own house.

Subira will share this loan with her loan group, "Kingugi", which totals 17 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: to open a clothes shop.

loans.name: Zinunula Omunaku  Women's  Group

texts.en: Retailing is what 46-year-old Resty has been inclined to practice in Kayunga for the last decade. The happily married mother of 3 also practices farming as a side source of sustenance. She is upbeat about the future prospects of her business. What has kept her optimism high is the fact that the competition in her genre of business in Kayunga is not so stiff. Monthly she says her sales income are to the tune of about UGX 200,000. She says she will use her loan money to purchase more commodities like sugar, maize flour, rice, beans, cooking oil, bread, etc. to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more commodities like sugar, maize flour, rice, beans, cooking oil, bread, etc. to resell.

loans.name: Chapa Kazi. Group

texts.en:
Hellena is in her late thirties and is married with three children. She has been running a grocery for nine years now.  She works from 8am to 8pm and she is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Hellena’s twelfth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the stock in her grocery and has paid back her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to buy a pool table to be used in her grocery.  Hellena’s dream is to one day build her house.

Hellena will share this loan with his loan group, "Chapa kazi", which totals 16 members.  The members of the group will hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a pool table.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is 28 years old. She is married to Sammy. She buys electricity poles from the farmers and sells and delivers the poles to the company. She has been in the business for the past 14 years. She gets a monthly income of KES 35,000 from her business.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD .She was introduced to KADET LTD by a customer. She will use the loan amount to add capital to her business and manage to purchase more poles. Her dream is to purchase her own lorry for transportation.

loans.use: to purchase more electricity poles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is a thirty-three-year old gentleman from Kisumu in Western of Kenya and is married to Joyce, with whom he has 2 children.

George is a water vendor at Usenge, where he supplies drinking water in the villages. This is a business he has done for the last two years and he makes a monthly income of 20,000 KES. He is taking his third loan from KADET Ltd, which he will use to buy water jerricans for his water supply business. He will use his profits to payback his loan.

His dream is expand his business and coverage area.

loans.use: to add more jerricans for his water vending business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 32 years old. He is married with two children. He sells charcoal and has been in the business for the past seven years. He gets a monthly income of KES 16,500 from his business.

This is his first loan term in KADET LTD. He will use the loan amount as capital to start a retail shop. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET staff member.

His dream is to grow his business and improve his living standard. In future he plans to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: Diversify his business to start a retail shop.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en:
Michael re-married  and his current wife is called Seline. He is still operating the tailoring business in Usenge town and his profit increased to Kenya shillings 20,000 after the previous loan boost.

Michael is currently taking a second loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to buy more textile materials, sewing threads and another sewing machine. He intends to use his profits to pay back the loan.

His dream is still to open a tailoring school where he will be able to impart his skills to others.

loans.use: To buy textile materials, sewing threads and another sewing machine

loans.name: Rahab

texts.en:
Rahab is 50 years old and a business lady. She is married to Stephen, who is a businessman. They are blessed with four children. She has been running a hardware shop for the past three years, with a monthly income of KES 25,000, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her second loan term with KADET LTD after paying the previous loan successfully. Rehab will use the loan to buy metals to add to her stock. Her hopes and dreams are to open different branches in different areas.

loans.use: to buy metals to add to her stock.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 41 years old. He is married to Ruth and together they have four school-going children. Paul is a farmer besides owning a barber shop and hair dressing salon. He has been in the business for the past three years. He earns a monthly income of KES 15,000 from his business.

This is his first loan from KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET LTD by another customer. He will use part of the loan amount to purchase farm inputs, such as fertilizer and seedlings, and part of it to pay school fees.

His hope is to improve his barber shop and hair dressing salon to improve his living standards and also purchase another piece of land.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and pay school fees.

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata has been in the fish selling business in Naivasha town for the last six months. She is 46 years old  and a widow with three school-going children.

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our existing clients and this will be her first loan. She  plans to use the loan amount to buy more stock of fish for sell in her business.

In future, Consolata hopes to expand her business and distribute fish to traders and markets in and out of Naivasha town. This will help her support and provide good education for her children.

loans.use: To add more stock of  fish for sale.

loans.name: Rahab Wanja

texts.en:
Rahab is 48 years old. She is a single mother of three children aged 23, 20, and 2 years old. She is a farmer and has been in the business for the past 24 years. She gets a monthly income of KES 30,000 from her business.

This is her third loan from KADET LTD. She will use the loan amount to purchase a cow. From her previous loan she managed to increase yields on her farm. From the anticipated profits she managed to pay school fees for her children.

She hopes to expand her business and invest in rental houses.

loans.use: to purchase a cow.

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor is 30 years old, man from Kisumu City, in the West of Kenya, and is married to Linet and they have three children.

Victor operates a fish selling business in an open-air market in Kisumu town, and has been in this business for the last five years. He makes a monthly income of Kes 20,000. 

He is taking his first loan from KADET LTD which he will use to buy dried fish for sale. His profits will be channeled to educating and feeding his family.

His dream is to become a leading supplier of fish in Kisumu city.

loans.use: To buy more stock of dried fish.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
