Benson is 38 years old and is married to Beth, who is 26 years old. Together they have two children, aged four and two years. He owns a cafe whereby he makes a varieties of foods and sell to his customers. He has been in the business for the past three years. He gets a monthly income of about KES 15,000

This is his first loan term in KADET LTD. He was introduced to KADET LTD by a registered client. He will use the loan amount to purchase more sugar, cooking fat and flour. His dream is to operate a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, cooking fat and flour for resale.

loans.name: Penina

texts.en:
Penina is a forty-five-year-old lady from Kisumu town and she is married to Jack, a head teacher at his school.  The couple has four children aged 10, 13, 20 and 24 years.

Penina operates a fish selling business at Kisumu, a business she has done for the last four years, making a monthly income of KES. 20,000. She is taking her first loan from KADET LTD and she will use it to buy fresh fish for sale. She will use the profits to feed and clothe the family.

Her dream is to buy and sell fish wholesale.

loans.use: To buy more stock of fresh fish to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 48 years old and is from Nakuru. She is married with three children aged between 25 and 20 years old.

Elizabeth has a clothing business which she operates by walking around Nakuru town looking for clients. She has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD to enable her to buy more clothes to add to her stock.

She hopes to open up a stall and to own a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to add to her stock.

loans.name: Eddah

texts.en:
Eddah is a 44-year-old woman, who is single and the mother of two children. She runs a salon and sells imported second-hand clothing and beauty products in Kangemi . Eddah has been in the business for five years now and gets a monthly income of KES 67,000.

This will be her first loan with KADET LTD. She plans to use the funds to pay the taxes to clear cargo at the port since she imports clothes from outside country. She wants to plough the anticipated profits back into her businesses. 

In future, she wants to be able to venture into two catering services.

loans.use: To pay for taxes to clear cargo at the port.

loans.name: Elsa Marina

texts.es:
Elsa Marina, de  33   años de edad, casada desde hace 15 años, tiene dos hijas de 13 y 15  años de edad, vive en los naranjos, Santa cruz de Yojoa, su esposo se dedica a la venta de flores naturales.
Ella hace más de cinco años que emprendió su propio negocio donde compra y vende verduras, como plátanos, yuca, tomate, repollo, chiles, banano verde etc. las que vende en forma ambulante, ella se estaciona a orilla de la calle en la acera cerca del mercado a ofrecer sus productos. Inicio con la motivación de superarse a nivel familiar y contribuir al hogar.
Para mantener este negocio ha solicitado cuatro préstamos, con este actual ella va continuar comprando verduras para la venta.
Su meta es conseguir un local en el área del mercado para poner allí su negocio y aumentar las ventas.
texts.en:
Elsa Marina, age 33, has been married for 15 years and has two daughters, ages 13 and 15.  She lives in Los Naranjos, Santa Cruz de Yojoya.  Her husband sells cut flowers.

Over five years ago she took on her own business of buying and selling produce like bananas, yucca, tomatoes, cabbage, chilies, and green bananas, etc.  She sells in an itinerant manner.  To sell her products she stations herself at the edge of the street on the sidewalk near the market.  She started with the motivation of self-improvement on a family level and of contributing to the household.

In order to maintain this business she has requested four loans.  She will use the current one to continue buying produce to sell.

Her goal is to get a place in the area of the market where she can place her business and increase sales.

loans.use: to stock her business with produce to sell.

loans.name: Morice

texts.en:
Morice is a 55 year old married man.  He has 4 children ranging in age from 14 to 22 years old.  He describes himself to be an intelligent and focused man. 

He operates a repair service shop where he provides the services of bicycle repair.  He has been involved in this business for 5 years.  His business is located in a less competitive and populated area and his primary customers are bicycle owners. He has two employees. He describes his biggest business challenge to be shortages of spare parts.  He will use the KES 20,000 loan to purchase bicycle spare parts for use in repair and selling.  Morice's  business goal is to run a motor vehicle garage and create more job opportunities for people within 5 years.

loans.use: To buy bicycle spare parts for use in repair and selling.

loans.name: Angela Belinda

texts.es:
Angela Belinda de 27 años de edad, casada desde hace 5 años, tiene dos hijos pequños, vive en el Barrio Fátima de Siguatepeque.
Actualmente doña Ángela se dedica a vender ropa usada, anteriormente trabajaba en una empresa pública y sus ingresos no eran suficientes para cubrir gastos del hogar y ahora con el negocio que estableció  hace dos años ya puede aportar más. Ella compra los fardos de ropa variada para la venta, vende todo el día todos los días. Inicio con esfuerzos propios y para mantener surtido el negocio  ha solicitado préstamos a ODEF, los que le han permitido incrementar las ventas, este es  el tercer préstamo  con el cual va comprar fardos de ropa usada.
Ella busca  con este negocio tener una solvencia económica en su familia.
texts.en:
Angela Belinda, age 27, has been married for five years and has two young children.  She lives in the Fátima de Siguatepeque neighborhood.

Angela currently sells used clothes.  She used to work for a public business, but she did not earn enough to cover the household expenses.  Now, with the business she established two years ago, she is able to contribute more.

She buys bundles of varied clothes, and she sells all day every day.  She started through her own efforts.

In order to keep her business stocked she has requested loans from ODEF.  The loans have allowed her to increase her sales.  This is her third loan, which she will use to buy bundles of used clothing.  Through this business she is looking to have financial solvency for her family.

loans.use: to stock her business with used clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ruzanna

texts.en:
Ruzanna is 22 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a village in Armenia. Ruzanna and her husband have been engaged in agriculture for more than six years. 

Due to their hard work, they have managed to increase their number of cattle and expand the farm. Now Ruzanna wants to develop her business further by purchasing more cattle. This will allow Ruzanna to earn more income and invest it in building a barn.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Dorika

texts.en:
Dorika is a 35-year-old food stall owner in Shanzu, Mombasa. She is single and has been running the food stall for the past three years successfully. 

This marks Dorika's first business loan from KADET to finance her business. She plans to purchase new serving dishes, foodstuffs and chairs. 

Dorika will use the anticipated profits to open another business. She hopes to have a bigger hotel.

loans.use: to purchase new serving dishes, foodstuffs and chairs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 27-year-old married woman. She has two children, aged two and six. She describes herself as honest, hardworking and customer-friendly. She operates a retail store where she sells clothes and bedding such as t-shirts, dresses, blouses, mattresses, etc.. She has been involved in this business for nine years. 

Her business is located in a visible and strategic area. She describes her biggest business challenge as insufficient funds to improve her retail store. She will use the Kes 10,000 loan to buy more clothes to resell. Mary's business goal is to diversify her clothing business within five years.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther lives in Barnesville. She is 40 years old, married, with seven children between the ages of seven and twenty eight. Three of them live at home while the oldest ones are working and living on their own. For the past thirty years she has been selling dry fish in the market. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and learned this way of selling from her mother. She likes buying and making profit. She is requesting a loan to purchases more dry fish (cassava fish, butter nose fish, and Bonnie fish) for her business. In the future she wants to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more dry fish for her business.

loans.name: Marthalyn

texts.en: Marthalyn is 19 years old and lives in Jacob Town. She is single and has an 8-month-old baby, For the past four years, she has been selling gasoline. She makes more profit and has more customers since she is the only female who sell gasoline in her community. She is requesting a loan to purchase more gasoline for her business and her plan is to build herself a house.

loans.use: to purchase more gasoline for her business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en: Janet  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with five children, and four go to school. She takes care of an additional family member, her father. She sells blankets and bed sheets in a shop on a retail basis. She has been in this business for five years. She works seven days a week. She has requested a loan of UGX 800,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more blankets and bed sheets for resale. Her major business challenges are transportation and seasonality. Her aspirations and goals are to buy a plot of land and also to become a wholesaler. She lives in a rented house, and her family does not have access to piped water or electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, feeding the family, and rent.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and bedsheets to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet  lives in Kampala, Uganda. She is married with four children and all her children go to school. She takes care of one additional family member (mother). She operates a retail shop in a shop that she rents. She has been in this business for the last 7 years. She works seven days a week. She has requested for loan of 700,000 from MCDT SACCO to buy more sugar, rice, flour and cooking oil. Her major business challenges are increasing prices of commodities, transportation and electricity. Her aspirations and goals are to see her business growing into a wholesale business. She lives in her own house and the family does not have access to piped water but has electricity. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and rent for her business premises.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, rice, flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Olga Marina

texts.es:
Olga Marina, tiene 51 años de edad, soltera de 3 hijos de 32, 30 y 29 años de edad, vive en la colonia Asentamientos Humanos en la zona periférica de San Pedro Sula.
Doña Olga es madre soltera y aunque sus hijos se han independizado ella trabaja mucho desde hace 20 años que se dedica a vender verduras y frutas, como tomate, yuca, brócoli, chile, papas, jilotes, piña, melón, bananos etc. Desde entonces consiguió un local en el mercado de la ciudad y se convirtió en su fuente de ingresos. 
Los préstamos le han ayudado a mantener siempre producto que ofrecer a sus clientes. Este segundo préstamo lo va invertir en compra de todo tipo de verduras y frutas para la venta.
Todo este esfuerzo que hace es para obtener dinero para arreglar su vivienda y seguir teniendo su crédito abierto con la institución.
texts.en:
Olga Marina, age 51, is single and has three children, ages 32, 20, and 29.  She lives in the Asentamientos Humanos settlement in the area outside of San Pedro Sula.

Olga is a single mother, and even though her children are independent, for 20 years she has been working a lot .  She sells fruits and vegetables like tomatoes, yuccas, broccoli, chilies, potatoes, corn, pineapples, melon, and bananas, etc.  She obtained a place in the city market, and she converted it into her source of income.

The loans have helped her to always maintain products to offer her customers.  She will use this second loan to buy all types of fruits and vegetables to sell.

All of her efforts are in order to get the money to fix up her house and to continue to have credit with the institution.

loans.use: to stock her business with fruits and vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Nyanlauk

texts.en:
Nyanlauk is a 45-year-old married woman with five children, all of whom are in school. She has had a business of selling fish in Bor, South Sudan for four years.

Nyanlauk is requesting this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase fish. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay the school fees of her children.

loans.use: to purchase fish for resale.

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is 35 years old and single, a businessman in Mshomoroni, Mombasa. He is a clothes seller, a business he has been doing for the past one year with great success.

This is his first business loan from KADET to finance his business. He plans to purchase more shirts, skirts, trousers and T-shirts. 

He will use the anticipated profits to add more stock and repay his loan. He hopes to have a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more shirts, skirts, trousers and T-shirts.

loans.name: Nona

texts.en:
Nona is 35 years old. She lives in the village of Leteti in East Georgia with her family, including her 12-year-old son, Goga, and her retired parents. Goga goes to school. The family lives below the poverty line and receives relevant social assistance from the government. 

The main source of income for the family is agriculture. They have a calf and chicken. Nona sells eggs in the village. Also, the family owns agricultural land where onions, haricot, maize and tomatoes are grown. Nona sells harvested products in the village to local retailers. The total average monthly income of the family is 500 GEL. 

Nona has requested credit for purchasing a milk cow. She will produce cheese and sell it locally. It will increase the income of the family, allowing them to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Tigran

texts.en:
Tigran is 45 years old. He lives in Ddmashen village, Sevan area with his family. Tigran’s family consists of his pensioner mother, his wife and two sons. His elder son sometimes goes to Russia for seasonal work; his younger son is serving in the Armenian army, and Tigran’s wife is a housewife. Tigran is a cook, but since 2000 he has been engaged in farming. 

Tigran and his wife rear cows, sheep, pigs and chickens. Tigran sells his agricultural products  to re-sellers. Also, Tigran has a tractor with a device for fodder compressing. This tractor allows Tigran to fulfill private orders of fodder compressing in his village and environs. 

Tigran uses his agricultural business income for his family’s needs. He has received loans from Nor Horizon four times and he always repays his loan on time. Now he is asking for a 700,000 AMD loan to buy a device for land ploughing, which will allow him to receive orders for land ploughing as well.

loans.use: to buy a device for land ploughing.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 43-year-old beauty salon owner in Mombasa, a married mother of three. She has been running the beauty salon for the past three years with success. 

This is Eunice’s first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase more hair chemicals, blow dryers and hair tongs.

She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. She hopes to have an established business.

loans.use: to purchase more hair chemicals, blow dryers and hair tongs.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 50 years old, from Nakuru, and married with two children who are both in school.

Mary has a clothing business which she has been doing for some years and has applied for her first loan from KADET LTD, to enable her to buy more clothes to add to her stock for sale.

She hopes to open up a boutique in the future.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to add to her stock.

loans.name: Elaka Na Nkolo Plus Group

texts.en:
Elaka na Nkolo Plus is a group of 19 owners of small businesses chaired by Muhingwira. Its members are jointly liable for loans granted by Kiva to grow their businesses.

Muhingwira is 53 years old and married. She is the mother of three children whose ages vary from 8 to 15 years old. All of them attend school. 

Muhingwira operates a general store. She started her business in 1990. Her business has stabilized thanks to her hard work and the accumulated profits that she reinvested. 

Currently, her business brings in a profit of $20 per week. Due to the high demand in her community, she intends with the next loan to buy more goods for resale in order to meet clients' demands and generate additional profit. This will help her to achieve her plans to grow the business.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell in her store.

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is 22 years old, a poultry farmer in Mombasa. He is single and has been in the business for three years. His poultry business is doing great. 

This marks Moses’ first time borrowing from KADET LTD to finance his business. With the money he plans to purchase day-old chicks for rearing. 


He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business and to repay his loan from KADET. He hopes to have a healthy, happy family.

loans.use: to purchase day-old chicks to rear and sell later at a profit.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a 19-year-old, single, businesswoman in Bombolulu, Mombasa. She sells used clothes, a business she has been doing for the past two years successfully. 

This is her first business loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to purchase more shirts, trousers, skirts and dresses for sale. 

Mary will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock and repay her loan. She hopes to have an established business.

loans.use: to buy more shirts, trousers, skirts and dresses for sale.

loans.name: Zurab

texts.en:
Zurab is a young farmer from a small village in East Georgia. He is 26 years old and lives with his parents and elder brother. The only source of income for the family is agriculture. They have a 2.5 hectare plot of land, where apple, peach, pear and plum trees are grown. Also the family grows tomatoes and garlic on the same land. The family owns a tractor with various attachments (for moving, fertilizing, sowing, and baling). Family members provide various seasonal services to neighbor farmers and get income. Total average income of the family per month is 1000 Laris. 

Zurab requested a loan for purchasing 0.2 hectare's of additional land. Also, a small part of the credit will be used for cultivation of the land, including the cost of fuel for the tractor and salaries of the workforce, which will help them in sowing the vegetables. In summer the family will harvest more and their income from sales will increase. Zurab plans to use increased income for expansion of the family house and its renovation, in order to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural land and cover the cost of cultivation.

loans.name: Maraka

texts.en:
This is 50 year-old Maraka. He is married, and has three children: a twenty-five year old male in high-school, a twenty-year-old in form six and a seventeen-year-old in form four. 

In 2000, Maraka established his shop. He has a bachelor degree in physics and mathematics. After spending twenty years in the classroom, Maraka realized he can improve his life faster in business than in the classroom. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,500,000 as profit every month from this business. 

He is asking for a loan of SLL 4,000,000. He would like to use SLL 1,500,000 to buy crates of soft drinks, SLL 500,000 to buy assorted provisions like powdered milk, butter etc., SLL 1,500,000 to buy detergent and SLL 500,000 for transport fares. 

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000 in the month. In the future, Maraka plans to buy large stocks of provisions to sell to other traders. Also he would like to educate his children to university level. 

He is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more provisions for his shop.

loans.name: Mwanamwinyi

texts.en:
Mwanamwinyi is a 34 year old business lady in Likoni, Mombasa.  She is in the business of preparing and selling of juice to area residents, a business that she has been operating for five years. 

This is her second loan from KADET LTD to finance her  business.  With this loan she plans to buy more stock of mangoes, pineapples and oranges that she will use to extract the juice for selling.  She hopes to make a profit and repay back her loan and also use the money for her upkeep.

She hopes to become a wholesale supplier of homemade juice in the future.

loans.use: To buy more stock of mangoes, pineapples and oranges.

loans.name: Chando Setnto

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Chando Setnto. She is married and has 1 child, age 8 months. Her husband is a pastor. She has 2 additional dependents living with her.  

In 2004, Chando Setnto established her boutique business. She started her business 3 years after she graduated with a diploma in cosmetology. Working 6 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 1,500,000 SLL every month from this business. She would like a loan in the amount of 5,000,000 SLL. Chando Setnto requires this loan to give her customers a wide range of different hair products.  She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL. 

In the future, Chando Setnto plans to educate her child up to university level and to own her business premises herself. She is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more artificial hair and cosmetics for her business

loans.name: Akech

texts.en:
Akech is a 30-year-old married woman with two children, all of whom are in school. She has been selling food from her food stall in Bor, South Sudan for two years.
Akech is requesting a loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase sugar and oil. She will use the extra income from this loan to pay her children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase sugar and oil for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more stock of bananas, oranges and kale for sale.

loans.name: Sao

texts.en:
This is 42-year-old Sao. She is married and has 3 children; a 26-year-old female high school graduate, a 24-year-old female university and 14yrs form three male. Her husband is a civil servant. 

In 2002, Sao established her rubber and local food stuff business. She began her business 10 years back and she has been able to manage it due to the fact that she is committed to the business. Working 7 days a week and 8 hours a day, she earns about 672,000 SLL every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. Sao requires a loan in order to travel to Conakry to buy her goods in large quantity to retail to her customers. Considering that the salary of a civil servant cannot meet the demand of the home, her business has greatly assisted her husband in taking care of the children which has helped them to get university education.

loans.use: To buy more plastics rubber

loans.name: Marygorret

texts.en:
Marygorret is a 25-year-old, married, poultry farmer in Bamburi, Mombasa. She has been rearing chickens for the past two years. She sells the eggs and the fully grown chickens to her customers. Her business is doing well.

This is her first loan from KADET LTD to finance her business. She plans to use the loan to purchase more chicks to rear. She will use the anticipated profits to repay her loan and expand her business further. 

She hopes to excel in the business.

loans.use: to purchase more chicks to rear.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane Njeri is a 34-year-old mother of two children. She is a second-hand clothes dealer in Mombasa and has been in the business for two years. Her business has been doing well.

This marks Jane’s first business loan from KADET LTD. She plans to purchase a new stock of second-hand clothes from Kongowea market for reselling. 


She hopes to use the anticipated profits to educate her children and repay her loan. She hopes to have  a bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase a new stock of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Furaha

texts.en:
Furaha, is 33 years old, a business lady in Kisimani, Mombasa. She runs a video entertainment business in Mombasa and has been in the business for 11 years. Her business has been doing well and she has been able to entertain her clients, most of whom are Kisimani youth.

This marks Furaha's first business loan from KADET LTD and she plans to refurbish the video premises by repairing the seats and walls. 


She also plans to start a juice business that will mainly target her clientele with the anticipated profits used to expand her business further and to repay  the KADET loan. 

Furaha hopes to have a more profitable business in future.

loans.use: to refurbish the video premises by repairing the seats and walls.

loans.name: Lagu

texts.en:
Lagu is a 32 year old business man, who lives in Juba Nimule.  He is married and has 2 children between the ages of 4 and 2.  One of them goes to school. 

Lagu runs a phone store business and he has been in the business for 5 years.  He has 1 employee.  Lagu heard about Finance Sudan from the radio and promotions done in the market.  He is taking a loan of 600 SDG to purchase more items like phones, spare parts of phones and many others. Besides this business, Lagu has no other source of income. 

In 5 years time, Lagu would like to build a house and increase in the business size as well.  His major challenges include low income rate and higher transportation cost of the goods.  Lagu says that he is appreciates Finance Sudan for supporting businesses that have poor financial access.

loans.use: To purchase more items like, phones, spare parts of phones and many others.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 52 years old.  She is a single mother of two children aged 21 and 19 years old.  She is a dairy farmer and has been in the business for the past five years.  She gets a monthly income of  KES 10,000 from the business.

This is her first term loan from KADET LTD.  She will use the loan amount to purchase animal feed for her cattle.  She was introduced to KADET LTD by a staff member.  Her dream is to own more dairy cattle to increase her income.

loans.use: To purchase animal feed.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is  32 years old and married to Susan and they have been blessed with three children ages 1, 3 and 9 years old.   He has been a milk vendor for two years and earns a monthly income of KES 30,000.  He has requested for a loan of KES 30,000 to buy a refrigerator for cooling milk. 

The profit gained would help him buy a dairy cow.  His dream is to buy a plot in Eldoret and give his kids a good education.

loans.use: To buy a refrigerator for cooling milk.

loans.name: Liliana Marcela

texts.es:
Liliana es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de un hijo de 7 años el cual siempre ha sido la motivación para esforzarse todos los días en su trabajo. Liliana siempre ha soñado con montar su propia empresa y es por esto que ahora se esta esforzando por sacar su negocio adelante. Liliana trabaja en la sección de servicio al cliente de un restaurante de su municipio y cuando culmina su jornada laboral elabora postres que distribuye a algunos restaurantes de su municipio. Sus postres son reconocidos por su buen sabor además por la buena calidad del servicio que ofrece, es por esto que poco a poco sus ventas se han ido aumentando considerablemente. Liliana, como elabora sus postres manualmente, dicho de mejor manera, artesanalmente, no cumple con una gran cuota de producción, por lo que últimamente no ha podido atender los pedidos grandes que le hacen algunos clientes suyos. Con el ánimo de poder aumentar la producción de sus postres, Liliana busca comprar una licuadora industrial que le permita elaborar el proceso de manera más industrializada y pueda así agilizar su producción. Sin embargo, Liliana no cuenta con el capital suficiente para la compra de esta máquina, por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de una licuadora industrial que le permita elaborar más postres en menos tiempo.

Liliana espera que sus ingresos aumenten pues podrá atender a clientes que antes debía rechazar, además podrá cumplir su sueño de tener su propia empresa que venda grandes cantidades de sus productos. Liliana sueña con que su hijo pueda tener una mejor calidad de vida y encuentre en su negocio una estabilidad económica. Además, Liliana espera que su hijo pueda acceder a una educación de calidad y en un futuro a una educación superior.
texts.en:
Liliana is a single mother and head of the family.  She has a seven year old child, and he has always been her motivation to work harder every day.  Liliana has always dreamed of starting her own company.  That is why she is now putting forth great effort to get her business ahead.

Liliana waits on customers in a restaurant in her municipality.  When she finishes her work day she makes desserts that she distributes to some restaurants in the municipality.  Her desserts are known for their good flavor and for the good quality of service that she offers.  This is why, little by little, her sales have been increasing considerably.

As Liliana makes the desserts manually or by hand, she does not have a large production.  That is why she has not been able to take care of the large orders that some of her customers are making lately.  With the aim of being able to increase production of her desserts, Liliana is looking to buy an industrial blender.  This will allow her to make the process more industrialized, and she will be able to speed up production.

However, Lilian does not have enough capital to buy this machine.  That is why she has the hope that a loan will give her the possibility of buying an industrial blender, which will allow her to make more desserts in less time.

Liliana hopes that her income increases and that she will be able to take care of customers that she previously could not.  She also hopes that she will be able to fulfill her dream of having her own company that sells large quantities of her products.  Liliana dreams that her son will be able to have a better quality of life and that her business finds financial stability.  Also, Liliana hopes that her son will be able to have a quality education and a university education in the future.

loans.use: to buy an industrial blender that will allow her to make more desserts in less time.

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en: Mr. Ganzorig is 30 years old and works in customer service for a branch of the local telephone company. He lives with his wife and three children in Kherlen, a town on the Mongolian border. He has been doing his job for five years, but his monthly salary is too small to meet all of his family's needs. During winter time, for example, his apartment becomes very cold and uncomfortable to live in because none of the windows are insulated. He is applying for this loan to insulate his apartment so that his family can live more comfortably and he won't have to spend so much money on heat.

loans.use: to buy insulation for his apartment.

loans.name: Battulga

texts.en: Mr. Battulga, 31 runs a small auto service that makes auto decorations. He has been running his business for three years and has gained a quiet experience in this field. Actually, he installs the state number plate and its various frames to the cars of his customers. Now he needs to raise his working capital such as number plate frames and some other car decoration items. It is important to his business improvement and to expanding as he thinks. The loan he is taking will be dedicated to purchase the some of necessary auto decoration materials to increase his business working capital.

loans.use: To purchase the some of necessary auto decoration materials to increase his inventory of number plate frames and some other car decoration items

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en:
Mr. Ganzorig, 31, is a military man. He lives with his son and wife in an old wooden house, which was built in the early 1980s in Kherlen, a boundary town of Mongolia. 

Last Fall, he began the renovations to his old house, but still has not finished, due to a lack of money. He particularly needs some money to purchase the building materials to complete the building. He wants to finish it before next Fall and now just needs to complete certain parts, such as windows, doors and wall insulation. Therefore he will be using his loan to purchase the building materials necessary to renovate his old house.

loans.use: To purchase the building materials necessary to renovate his old house

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is 50 years old, married, and the father of four children. For the last ten years, he has earned a living by selling fruits and vegetables. He earns a monthly profit of KES 10,000. 

He was introduced to KADET LTD by one of our credit officers and is applying for his second loan, for KES 35,000, to buy additional fruits and vegetables to sell to his customers. 

He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay his children's school fees. His goal for the future is to continue growing his business so that he can give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: to buy additional fruit and vegetables to sell to his customers.

loans.name: Angua

texts.en:
Angua is a 28-year-old business woman who lives in Juba Nimule. She is married and has three children between the ages of 12 and 3. All of them go to school. 

Angua runs a ready-to-eat food business, and she has been in the business for four years. She has no employees. Angua heard about Finance Sudan from outreach and promotion done by the loan officers. She is taking a loan of 600 SDG to purchase more food items like wheat flour, cooking oil  and many others. In addition to her business income, Angua’s husband contributes some money to the family.

In five years' time, Angua would like to hope to be selling in a food retail shop instead of selling chapatti. Her major challenges include issues of school fees and low income only.

Angua says that she is happy for Finance Sudan’s support, especially for women. It has made her to have hope for starting up a better business.

loans.use: to purchase more food items like wheat flour, cooking oil  and many others.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa lives in West Point.  She is 29 years old, is married and her husband is a driver.  They have four children between the ages of 1 to 9  years old.   

For four years now she has been operating a pay station for billing and charging phones in her community.  She received a little amount from her husband to start her business, and learned it from her husband.  She likes her business.  Because she gets a lot of customers, she is  requesting a loan to purchase more phone chargers and a television for her business.  Her plan is to build a house with the additional profits.

loans.use: To purchase more phone chargers and a television for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients for fast food.

loans.name: Yurik

texts.en:
Yurik is a 51-year-old entrepreneur from Armavir. He runs a shop where he sells audio and video discs and appliances for mobile phones. Yurik needs to increase the inventory variety in his shop to meet his clients' demands. 

With the requested loan, Yurik plans to purchase audio and video discs (CDs and DVDs) and new appliances for mobile phones. This will allow Yurik to increase his sales and earn more income, ensuring a better life for his wife and children.

loans.use: to purchase audio and video discs (CDs and DVDs) and appliances for mobile phones.

loans.name: Edil

texts.en: Edil  lives in West Point and is 57 years old. She is a widow and  has six children between 29 and 33 years old. For twenty   years now, she has been selling plantains and charcoal  in her community. She received a little amount from her oldest son to started her business, and she learned it from her mother.  She likes her business because she makes a profit. She is  requesting a loan to purchase more plantains and charcoal for her  business. Her  plans is to build a house for  her children.

loans.use: to purchase more plantains and charcoal for her  business.

loans.name: Ladia

texts.en:
Ladia lives in West Point.  She is 40 years old.  She is married and her husband is a businessman.  They have six children between the ages of 1 to 20 years old.  

For nine years now she has been selling soft drinks in her community.  She received  money  from her husband to start her business, and she learned it from her mother.   She likes her business because she makes more profits.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more soft drinks for her business.  Her plan is to build house for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more soft drinks for her  business

loans.name: Aluda

texts.en:
Aluda is from the village of Maghlaki, West Georgia. He is thirty-eight years old and lives with his family: his wife – Rosa, two sons (10 and 8 years old) and his parents who are retired. The only source of the income for the family is a dairy farm. Rosa produces and sells cheese on the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 600 Laris, including the pensions of Aluda’s parents. 

Aluda requested credit for re-starting a family business. The family has a small bakery, which used to be used for production of confectionery products. The problem which caused the bakery to close a couple of years ago was the lack of clients in the village. If Aluda could take the products to neighboring districts and villages, he could sell them. 

Aluda requested credit to purchase a small mini-bus to transport the bakery products. He will sell them to the grocery shops in nearby villages. Also he will sell through the same channels their cheese for a higher price. 

Starting up this business again will significantly increase the income of the family. They will be able to purchase additional household goods, to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a mini-bus for distribution of bakery products.

loans.name: Mindara

texts.en:
Mindara is a 30-year-old business woman, who lives in Juba Nimule. She is married and has four children between the ages of 14 and 2. Three of them go to school. 

Mindara runs a ready-to-eat food business, and she has been in the business for three years. She has one employee. Mindara heard about Finance Sudan from outreach and promotion done by the loan officers. She is taking a loan of 500 SDG to purchase more food items like cassava flour, cooking oil, meat and many others. In addition to this business; Mindara has a motorcycle which generates some money for family use.

In five years' time, Mindara would like to have a big restaurant.

Her major challenges include issues of school fees and having no proper house at the moment.

Mindara says that she appreciates Finance Sudan’s effort at reaching out to rural areas, and they have clearly shown their bright future. She receives the loan with many thanks.

loans.use: to purchase more food items like cassava flour, cooking oil, meat and many others.

loans.name: Djahid

texts.ru:
Djahid 33 let. On jenat i imeyet 2 detey. Djahid yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda,seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey lubimoy semyoy. Внутренне перемещённое лицо (ВПЛ) - человек, который был вынужден внезапно бежать из своего дома в результате вооружённого конфликта, насилия, нарушений прав человека, стихийных бедствий или других катастроф, но, в отличие от беженца, не перешел международную границу и находящийся на территории собственной страны (источник: Управления ООН по Координации Гуманитарных Вопросов).
Djahid uje 2 qoda kak imeyet svayo kafe v Fuzuli regione. Seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupit noviye stoli i stulya dlya svoyego kafe , tem samim uvelichit kolichestvo kliyentov.
Eto uje vtoraya ssuda Djahida on ochen blagodaren lenderam i Kive za pervuyu ssudu. On vo vremya delal oplati po kreditu. Djahid izmenil svoy bizness i seychas imeyet svayo kafe.
texts.en:
Djahid is 33 years old.  He is married and has two children.  He is an internally displaced person (IDP) from the town of Fuzuli and currently lives in the Fuzuli region with his loving family.  Djahid has been owning a cafe in the Fuzuli region for two years.  He currently needs 2,000 AZN to buy new tables and chairs for his cafe, in order to accommodate more clients.  This is his second loan.  He wishes to thank his lenders and Kiva for his first loan.  He was able to repay that loan on time.  Djahid changed businesses and now owns his own cafe.

An internally displaced person (IDP) is a person, who was forced to suddenly flee his home as a result of a military conflict, violence, violation of human rights, natural disasters or other catastrophes, but what differentiates him from a refugee is the fact that did not cross an international border and is located on the territory of his own country (source: United Nations Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs).

loans.use: to buy new tables and chairs for his cafe.

loans.name: Matenneh

texts.en:
Matenneh lives in West Point.  She is 28 years old and she is married.  Her husband works for an NGO and they have two children between the ages of 6 to 10 years old.   

For the past five years now she has been selling slippers and fashion clothes.  She received a little amount from her husband to start her business and learned it from her mother.  She likes her business because she makes more profits.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more slippers and fashion clothes for her business.  Her plan is to build house for her children.

loans.use: To purchase more slippers, and fashion clothes for her business.

loans.name: Raissa

texts.en:
Raissa is from the village of Rupoti, West Georgia. She is married and lives with her family: her husband and a 12-year-old son who goes to school. The family earns a living through agriculture. They have three milk cows and produce cheese, which is sold on the local market. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris. 

Raissa requested credit for renovation of the house. It is old and was renovated a long time ago. After renovation, the family will have better living conditions and will be able to spend evenings after hardworking days in a clean and improved environment.

loans.use: to purchase materials for a house renovation.

loans.name: Ibrahim

texts.en:
This is 34 year old Ibrahim.  He is married and has 1 child age 3.  He has 1 additional dependent, who lives with him in order to assist in running the business.  

In 2005, Ibrahim established his mobile recharge card business.  He began his business because he did not get a job after University Studies and needed a source of income to provide a livelihood for his family.  Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, he earns about SLL 1,300,000 every month from this business. 

He needs a loan of SLL 5,000,000.  He requires this new loan in order to buy mobile phone rechargeable cards for different SMS service providers operating in Sierra Leone.  He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000.  In the future, Ibrahim plans to build his own house.  He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more mobile recharge cards for his business.

loans.name: Mame Faye

texts.fr:
Madame Mame Faye  est une vendeuse de poisson depuis 7 ans déjà .Elle fait de l’ambulant : c'est-à-dire qu’elle porte sa marchandise sur sa tete  et part dans les maisons ou les bureaux pour revendre. Elle est à sa première expérience de crédit car aimerait augmenter la quantité  de ses produits compte tenu de l’augmentation de sa clientèle.
Avec le crédit elle pourra acheter une caisse de poisson et augmenter la marge bénéficiaire. Mme  Mame Faye , n’ a pas de charge ce qui lui permet de s’ occuper à plein temps de son commerce  qu’elle aimerait relever au plus haut niveau dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
Mame Faye has been selling fish for 7 years already. She is a traveling salesperson: that is, she carries her merchandise on her head and goes to houses or offices to resell. This is her first experience with a loan as she would like to increase the quantity of her products because of the increase in her clientèle.

With the loan she will be able to buy a box of fish and increase her profit margin. Mame Faye has no dependents which allows her to work full-time in her business which she would like to raise up to the highest level in the future.

loans.use: to buy fish to resell.

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando tiene 40 años de edad, es casado y tiene 2 hijos de 14 y 9 años, los dos estudian, y vive con su familia en la Colonia Armando Gale de La Lopez, Choloma, cortes.
Orlando, hace año y medio el obtuvo dinero de las prestaciones laborales de donde trabajaba anteriormente. Con el cual decidió  establecer su propio negocio un taller de reparación y venta de repuestos de bicicletas. El servicio que el ofrece es pintura y  reparación general. Atendiendo a sus clientes  desde las 6 de la mañana.
El esta solicitando un préstamo de 10,000 lempiras el cual invertirá en la compra de repuestos de bicicletas, y así poder ofrecer a sus clientes el servicio de reparación y venta de los mismos. 
Su plan es crecer más en su negocio, y con los ingresos obtenidos poder construir su propia casa, logrando  un mejor nivel de vida para su familia.
texts.en:
Orlando is 40 years old, married, and has two children (ages 14 and 9) who are in school. He lives with his family in the subdivision of Armando Gale de La Lopez in Choloma, Cortes.

A year and a half ago, Orlando earned money from the job where he worked previously and decided to use it to establish his own business performing bicycle repairs and selling bicycle parts. He offers painting and general repair services. Orlando attends to his customers starting at 6am.

He is requesting a loan of 10,000 HNL to invest in the purchase of bicycle parts that he can sell and use to offer repair services to his customers. His plan is to grow his business even more. With the income he will earn, Orlando will be able to build a house of his own and achieve a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to purchase bicycle parts.

location.town: Colonia Armando Gale, La Lopez, Choloma

loans.name: Aliou

texts.fr: Aliou est un homme marié, père de 6 enfants dont les 2 sont des élèves à l'école primaire.Il exerce le métier de gardien de nuit dans une auberge située à quelques kilomètres de sa localité.Le jour, il vend des céréales à domicile.Ces activités lui permettent de se prendre en charge mais également d'entretenir sa famille, restée au village.Afin de renforcer son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 100000 francs pour acheter 5 sacs d'arachide et 5 sacs de mil. Son ambition est d'élargir son activité.
texts.en:
Aliou is a married man, father to 6 children of whom 2 are students in primary school. He practices the profession of night watchman in an inn located a few kilometers from his locale. During the day, he sells cereals from his home. His businesses allow him to take care of himself and equally to support his family, who stayed in the village. 

In order to strengthen his business, he is requesting a loan of 100,000 francs to buy 5 bags of ground nuts and 5 bags of mil [African cereal]. His goal is to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy 5 bags of ground nuts and 5 bags of mil [African cereal].

loans.name: Ndiassé

texts.fr: Ndiassé est un homme marié, père d'un enfant.il exerce le métier de chauffeur- livreur de matériel aluminium, vitrerie et accessoire depuis 2005. Il fait de nombreux voyages à l'intérieur du pays pour approvisionner sa clientèle.Depuis le décès de son père, il entretient sa mère, son frère élève et ses 3 petites sœurs.Ses revenus lui ont permet aussi et surtout de construire un bâtiment sur un terrain acheté dans sa ville. Afin de clôturer cette maison, il sollicite un prêt de 300000f auprès de l'UIMCEC. Son ambition est d'ouvrir un grand magasin de vente de produits d'aluminium.
texts.en:
Ndiassé is a married man, father to one child. He has been practicing the profession of driver-delivery man of aluminum materials, windows and accessories since 2005. He makes numerous trips into the interior of the country to supply his clientèle. Since the death of his father, he supports his mother, his student brother and his three younger sisters. His income allowed him also and especially to build a building on land purchased in his town. 

In order to enclose this house, he is requesting a loan of 300,000f from the UIMCEC. His goal is to open a large store selling aluminum products.

loans.use: to enclose his house.

loans.name: Foska

texts.es: La señora Foska se dedica a la venta de ropa hace bastante tiempo, durante las fiestas de fin de año le fue bien en el negocio por lo que necesita el crédito para abastecerse con mas mercadería por el temor a que se disparen los precios, vive con sus dos hijos por los cuales tiene que velar,  tiene dos empleos en las mañanas un empleo de medio tiempo en una casa particular y  la venta de ropa por las tardes, durante este tiempo ha demostrado responsabilidad en los pagos, cuenta con domicilio en anticrético, es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora se siente feliz por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Foska has been selling clothing for a while now. During the New Year’s holiday, her business did very well and now she needs a loan to stock up on more merchandise, for fear that prices will go up. She lives with and looks after her two sons. She has two jobs, one in the morning at a private residence and in the evenings she sells clothing. During this time, she has proven to be responsible with her payments. She has a home and an antichretic mortgage contract. She’s a very responsible, hard-working person and she is happy with the support she’s been given.

loans.use: buy clothing.

loans.name: Lizeth Margarita

texts.es:
Doña Lizeth, hoy en dia esta laborando como  empacadora de una empresa de plastico, logrando tener un ingreso fijo, a si mismo sigue comercializando sus ventas en ropa, cosmetico y prenda de plata, el cual vende en tiempos libres, con sus compañero de trabajo y en su barrio. Con el objetivo de poder dar lo necesario a sus dos hijos, ya que no cuenta con el apoyo del padre.
Con este nuevo prestamo, comprara ropa, prendas de plata, cosmeticos Avon para aumentar la oferta en sus ventas, y poder seguir teniendo otros ingresos,que ayude a dar lo necesario a su familia, como cumplir con los compromisos de pago.
texts.en:
Doña Lizeth currently works as a packer at a plastics company and earns a fixed income. She continues to sell clothing, cosmetics, and silver jewelry during her free time to her co-workers and in her neighborhood. Her goal is to provide necessities for her two children since she does not have the support of their father.

With this new loan, Lizeth will buy clothing, silver jewelry, and Avon cosmetics so that she can increase her sales inventory and continue earning additional income that will help her provide what her family needs and fulfill her loan commitments.

loans.use: to buy clothes, silver jewelry, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Gustavo De Jesus

texts.es:
Gustavo, desde hace aproximadamente 20 años se dedica a la venta de snack y confitería en una carrito en la calle. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la soldadura, pero una enfermedad de la vista hizo que tuviera que dejar este trabajo aparte. Gracias a esta actividad puede garantizar los ingresos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar. Gustavo tiene muy buenos clientes, gran parte gracias al buen servicio que ofrece, y por esto su negocio es cada vez más reconocido. Tuvo un tiempo en el que se vio en la obligación de hacer un préstamo gota a gota, y su negocio se iba cayendo cada vez más debido a que no le quedaba ninguna ganancia. Ahora, que ya pudo terminar de pagar este préstamo tan inasequible, quiere aumentar la cantidad de productos que ofrece a sus clientes. Es por esto que busca un préstamo que le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de productos de confitería y snack que le permitan surtir su negocio y volver a ofrecer una mayor variedad de productos. 

Gustavo espera poder revivir su negocio, ya que ha quedado muy pobre luego de su tiempo tan difícil, por lo que espera que su negocio aumente sus ventas y pueda así mejorar su calidad de vida y tener una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
For approximately 20 years Gustavo has been selling snacks and candy from his street cart. Before that he was a welder but an eye disease meant that he had to give up that work. Thanks to his current job he can earn enough money to support his household.

Gustavo has loyal customers largely because of the good service he provides and for that reason his business is becoming more well known. There was a time when he had to take out a loan, but his business was failing leaving him with no profits to take home. Now that he has been able to terminate that prohibitively expensive loan, he wishes to increase the number of products to offer his customers. He is seeking a loan which will allow him to buy candy and snacks to better stock his cart with a wider variety of items.

Gustavo hopes to be able to make his business successful once again as he has been very poor since that very difficult time. He hopes to see sales increase and allow him to improve his quality of life and have a stable income.

loans.use: to buy candy and snacks

loans.name: Mor

texts.fr: L'emprunteur est un homme marié qui vit avec son épouse et ses 3 enfants qui sont tous des élèves.Il tient une boutique  de produits alimentaires au marché de son quartier. En plus de cette activité, il pratique l'embouche ovine pour améliorer ses revenus et prendre ainsi en charge les dépenses d'entretien de sa famille. Aujourd'hui, il sollicite un pret de 300000f pour acheter du riz et de l'huile. Son ambition est d'élargir ses éctivités.
texts.en:
The borrower is a married man who lives with his spouse and his 3 children who are all students. He manages a store selling food products at his neighborhood market. In addition to this business, he practices sheep fattening to improve his income and thus take care of the expenses to support his family. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of 300,000f to buy rice and oil. His goal is to expand his businesses.

loans.use: to buy rice and oil.

loans.name: Gumercinda

texts.es: La señora Gumercinda es cliente antigua de la institución,  comenzó a trabajar en grupo solidario de 3 integrantes llamado "Santa María" trabajo junto a sus compañeras durante tres años y actualmente trabaja con créditos de manera individual.  Su esposo trabaja en construcción y esta constantemente de viaje. Es que de esta manera ella vive con sus hijos en la zona de Pampahasi bajo, a veinticinco minutos del centro de la ciudad.  Gumercinda se dedica  a la venta de comida, ella va todos los días a una plaza muy concurrida de la ciudad de La Paz, ella vende por las noches y se instala en pequeño puesto donde vende los platos de sajta de pollo y falso conejo que son típicos de la Bolivia.  Además tiene un auto que hace trabajar como taxi del cual recibe renta diaria y esta para esta actividad que solicita en presente préstamo de dinero, para el mantenimiento en general de su movilidad.  Uno de sus mayores anhelos es algún día comprar una casa propia para poder brindar mayor comodidad a su familia, La Sra. se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Gumercinda is an old client of the institution. She started working in group 'solidario' [solidary] which has three members and is called "Santa Maria". She has worked with her group members for the past three years, working with individual loans. Her husband works in construction and is constantly traveling. It is because of this that she lives with her children in the zone of lower Pampahasi, which is 25 minutes from the center of the city.   

Gumercinda makes a living selling food. She goes everyday to a busy plaza in the city of La Paz. She sells food at night from a small stand she has set up; she sells traditional Bolivian dishes of 'Sajta de Pollo' (a spicy stew of chicken with peanuts) y 'Falso Conejo' (the direct translation of the dish is 'fake rabbit' it is made with pounded, breaded beef served with sauce, potatoes and rice). 

She also has a car which she uses to provide taxi service to generate daily income. It is for this activity that she has requested the loan, for the general maintenance of her vehicle. One of her deepest desires is to one day buy her own home, to be able to provide to her family a higher level of comfort. Gumercinda is happy and thankful for the support that the institution provides.

loans.use: to pay for general maintenance for her vehicle.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL PROGRESO”; este banco se encuentra situado a tres horas de la misma ciudad del Cusco, en el Distrito de Quispicanchis de la Provincia de Ocongate Departamento de Cusco.
La socia Gregoria; la socia tiene 48 años de edad; ella es casada, la socia se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, ella tiene sus aves de corral, cuyes, chanchos, ovejas y los compra, cría y vende. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de animales  menores; ella comprara 100 cuyes, pollos, gallinas, ovejas.
La socia agradece la oportunidad del préstamo que le permitirá invertir en el negocio y crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
Gregoria is a member of the El Progreso Community Bank which is located three hours from the city of Cusco, in Quispicanchis District, Ocongate Province, in the department of Cusco.

She is 48 years old, married, and earns her living by raising animals. She has poultry, guinea pigs, pigs, and sheep which she buys, raises, and then sells. Gregoria is seeking a loan to buy young animals; she wishes to buy 100 guinea pigs, chickens, and sheep.

She is grateful for this opportunity to obtain a loan which will allow her to invest in her business and improve her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy 100 guinea pigs, chickens, and sheep

loans.name: Oscar Francisco

texts.es:
Oscar es una persona que ha tenido que atravesar muchas adversidades en su vida, sin embargo, sus ganas de salir adelante le han permitido superar estas adversidades. Oscar tiene 3 hijos los cuales su madre abandonó hace un tiempo sin aportar ningún recurso económico para su sostenimiento, por lo que a Oscar le toca originar los recursos necesarios para el sostenimiento de sus 3 hijos. Oscar anteriormente era marinero, pero debido a una enfermedad pulmonar se vio en la obligación de abandonar esta actividad; posteriormente no tuvo oportunidades de emplearse por lo que tomó la decisión de montar su propio negocio de venta de calzado en el centro de la ciudad. Gracias a esta actividad, Oscar genera los ingresos necesarios para su hogar y ha podido sacar sus hijos adelante, hasta brindarles la oportunidad a los mayores de acceder a una educación universitaria. Gracias a que ha tenido muy buenas ventas, Oscar tiene su inventario con muy poco surtido de calzado, por lo que busca un préstamo con el ánimo de que le brinde la posibilidad de acceder a la compra de calzado para poder surtir su negocio y ofrecer una mayor variedad de sus clientes.

Oscar espera que su negocio siga aumentando las ventas y le permita tener una mayor estabilidad económica tanto a el como a sus hijos. Además, sueña con que su negocio se convierta en un gran almacén y pueda ofrecer empleo para muchas personas que al igual que el no tuvieron oportunidades laborales y requieren de ingresos para sostener su hogar.
texts.en:
Oscar is a person who has had to overcome many problems in his life. However, through his desire to get ahead, he has overcome them. He has three children whose mother left them some time ago without providing any financial assistance to help raise them. So it was up to Oscar to find the resources necessary to bring up his three children.

At one time Oscar was a sailor, but because of a lung disease he had to give up this work. After that he couldn’t find any employment so he decided to start his own business in the centre of town selling footwear. He earns enough money to support his household and he has been able to help his children get ahead, even supporting the older ones through university.

Thanks to a high volume of sales Oscar now has a very small stock of footwear so he is seeking a loan to buy more goods to better stock his business and offer a greater variety to his customers. He hopes that his business will continue to grow and allow him and his children to have a more stable income. In the future he would love to see his business become a big store employing many people who, like him, couldn’t find work and need to earn money to support their families.

loans.use: to buy stock for his footwear business

loans.name: Fatima

texts.es: La Sra. Fátima nacida en Samaipata florida, casada con el sr. Leodan melean, con tres hijos, ambos se dedican a la agricultura a 12 km de la localidad de limoncito donde tienen su parcela que viven y trabajan en la misma, se dedican a la siembra de : maíz, yuca, camote, maní, todo lo que ellos siembran lo sacan a comercializar al mercado de el Torno, es su primer crédito que ha solicitado con la institución y el dinero del crédito lo utilizara en la compra de semillas para la siembra de maíz y en los gastos que implica la cosecha y el traslado hasta el puesto de venta,   se siente muy agradecida con la institución por la confianza que le están brindado  para  mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Sra. Fátima was born in Samaipata Florida and is married to Sr. Leodan Melean. They have three children and both of them work as farmers in an area that is 12km from the town of Limoncito. There they have a parcel of land on which they live and work. Fátima grows corn, cassava, sweet potatoes, and peanuts. Everything she grows is brought to the market in El Torno to be sold.

This is the first loan she is requesting from Emprender and the money will be used to buy seeds for growing corn and pay for the expenses related to harvesting and transporting crops to market. She is very grateful to Emprender for the trust that has been demonstrated to her so that she can improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to pay for seeds for planting corn and the related expenses for harvesting and transporting cassava.

loans.name: Lely Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lely habitante de la ciudad de León, de oficio comerciante, dueña de una pulpería la cual logro surtir gracias al  apoyo de los prestamistas de Kiva. Ella utilizo el préstamo para comprar granos básicos incluso logro vender pollo y carne pues compro el freezer que tanto necesitaba  siente que su negocio ha ido creciendo poco a poco. 
Ahora ella solicita el crédito para comprar artículos escolares, tales como cuadernos, lápiz , borradores, calcetines, camisolas, uniformes escolares. Pues se acerca la temporada escolar y sus clientes le piden mucho de estos productos  y es una oportunidad para mejorar sus ventas. Ella siempre sigue con su meta de vender nuevos productos y hacer más sostenible su negocio.
texts.en:
Lely lives in the city of León and has a retail business. She is the owner of a grocery story which she has been able to stock thanks to the support of Kiva lenders. She used the loan to buy basic grains, and she even managed to sell chicken and meat since she bought the freezer that she so much needed. She feels that her business has been growing little by little.

Now she is applying for a loan to buy school supplies such as notebooks, pencils, erasers, socks, shirts, and school uniforms since the school season is approaching and her customers are asking her a lot about these products; this is an opportunity to improve her sales. She always continues with her goal of selling new products and making her business more sustainable.

loans.use: to buy school supplies such as notebooks, pencils, erasers, socks, shirts, and school uniforms

loans.name: Marlys Nayibe

texts.es: Marlys  con su credikiva anterior compró en mayor volumen aceite, harina, huevos, y estuvo preparada para los eventos que se presentaron, en los cuales vendió muy bien sus arepas, buñuelos patacones, papas reyenas etc. En la actualidad está planeando su nuevo credikiva, con el cual comprará al por mayor y de contado, insumos con los cuales ganará descuentos por compras en volumen y de contado. Su éxito no solo radica en los descuentos que obtendria, sino en la época en la cual estária invirtiendo: temporada pre carnavalera y carnavalera, donde este tipo de ventas se incrementan y hacen de las inversiones todo un éxito. Su mensaje a los finaciadores de Kiva es el siguiente: "Gracias por la ayuda a los microempresarios colombianos, para cumplir metas y sueños propuestos."
texts.en: With her previous loan Marlys bought bigger quantities of oil, flour and eggs, and she was therefore ready for the various celebrations that have happened so far, selling very well her “arepas” (corn patties), fried banana chips, fried dough and papas rellenas (stuffed potatoes) among other things. She is currently requesting a new loan to buy supplies at wholesale prices, thanks to which she will get a discount for both wholesale and cash purchases. Her success will depend not only on the discounts she would gain, but also on the period she would make the investment in, as during the pre-carnival and carnival seasons there is always an increase in these kinds of sales, and this guarantees that the investment will be a success. This is her message to Kiva lenders: “Thank you for the support you offer to Colombian micro entrepreneurs in achieving their goals and dreams.”

loans.use: To buy supplies to prepare her dishes at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Carmen Yaneth

texts.es:
Carmen Yaneth de 36 años de edad, soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 12 y 16 años, quienes están estudiando, vive en el Barrio San Isidro de Puerto Cortes.
Carmen, por la necesidad de obtener ingresos, hace dos años ella decidió realizar una actividad de negocio en la que elabora y vende jugos naturales, adicionando la venta de churros y dulces. Este puesto de venta lo tiene enfrente de una terminal de buses donde hay afluencia de personas que viajan de un lugar a otro, lo que le permite vender más.
Ha solicitado dos prestamos con el actual, este es de L.5,000.00 también y lo va invertir en compra de frutas para elaborar jugos y compra de churros y dulces. Los préstamos le ayudan a mantener siempre productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Su meta es surtir y obtener más ganancias.
texts.en:
Carmen Yaneth is 36 years old, single, and has two children (ages 12 and 16) who are in school. She lives in the neighborhood of San Isidro de Puerto Cortes.

Carmen needed to earn an income, so two years ago she decided to start a business making and selling natural juices. She later added “churros” (strips of fried dough) and candy to her offerings. Her vending post is in front of a bus terminal where there are crowds of people getting from one place to another. This enables her to sell more.

Carmen has requested two loans. Her current loan is in the amount of 5000 HNL and will be invested in the purchase of fruits for making juices, as well as “churros” and candy. The loans have helped her maintain a stock of products to offer to her customers. Her goal is to remain stocked and generate more income.

loans.use: to buy fruits, "churros", and candy.

loans.name: Luisa

texts.es:
Doña Luisa continua trabajando en servicios domestico, para el bienestar comun de la familia, el mejoramiento de su casa es lo primordial, es por tal razon, continuara haciendo las mejoras. Cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos y esposo quien labora en carpinteria.
Atraves del financiamiento, ha logrado abanzar mas rapido con sus proyectos y con este nuevo prestamo comenzara la construccion de un muro en la parte de atrás, dando mejor seguridad a su propiedad y a su familia. Comprara materiales en piedra, arena, cemento, hierro, para comenzar la obra.
texts.en: Doña Luisa still works in domestic services for the well-being of her family.  Making improvements to her house is her primary concern.  For this reason she has continued making improvements.  She has the support of her children and her husband, who works in carpentry.  Through financing she has been able to proceed more quickly with her projects and this new loan will be used to start construction of a wall in the back to provide better security for her property and her family.  She will buy stone, sand, cement and iron to start the work.

loans.use: buy construction materials to start building a wall on the back of her property.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary, de 43 años de edad, es una mujer trabajadora y decidida, además de ser amable y alegre, es conviviente con Juler quien trabaja en construcción civil, fruto de esa unión tienen dos hijos de 18 y 9 años de edad, a quienes quiere mucho y juntos habitan en su propia casa. La actividad que realiza Mary, es la venta de comidas, vendiéndoles a los trabajadores de un aserradero ubicado cerca de su casa. la preparación lo hace en su casa y luego los distribuye en taper para cada cliente y al cabo de un fin de semana, realiza la cobranza. Durante estos 8 años ha logrado ser muy concoida y respetada por sus clientes, y por ello desea continuar con su trabajo de la ayuda de su hermana. Le gusta su negocio pues lo ve fácil de realizar además de contar con buenas ganancias por el número de pedidos que entrega a diario. Asimismo le da tiempo para estar en su casa y cuidar de sus hijos. Le va bien con su negocio y tiene planes de ampliarse con otro negocio abriendo una bodega de abarrotes en su casa. Este será el préstamo número 02 con la institución MFP, está muy contenta de  saber que tendrá un apoyo financiero, ya que así se sentirá segura de avanzar con su negocio. Por otro lado se compromete una vez más en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas, como en anteriores créditos que tuvo. Con el monto solicitado de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de abarrotes de primera necesidad para dar inicio a su nuevo negocio de la bodega buscando así generarse más ingresos.
texts.en: Mary, 43 years old, is a hardworking and determined woman, in addition to being friendly and cheerful. She is living with Juler who works in civil construction. They have two children ages 18 and 9, whom they love very much, and together they live in their own house. The business that Mary does for a living is the sale of foods, selling them to workers from a sawmill near her house. She does the preparation at home in the morning and later distributes them in tupperware for each customer and at the end of the week she performs collections. During these 8 years, she has been very well known and respected by her customers, and for that reason she wants to continue her work with the help of her sister. She likes seeing her business as easy to perform in addition to having good profits for the number of orders that she takes daily. Also it gives her time to be at home and care for her children. Things are going well with her business and she has plans to expand with another business opening a general store in her home. This will be her second loan with the MFP institution. She is very happy of knowing that she will have financial assistance, as she will feel secure in moving forward with her business. She also promises again to comply with her payments, like the loans she had before. With the amount requested of 800 nuevos soles she will invest it in the purchase of primary necessity groceries in order to start her new business of the grocery store looking for more generated income.

loans.use: to buy products to stock her general store.

loans.name: Constancia

texts.es: La señora constancia vive en la zona de Pampahasi alto ubicado a veinte minutos del centro de la ciudad, vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y tiene una hija en edad escolar.  Ella se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano que compra por fardos de los viajeros que llegan de la ciudad de Oruro cada semana.  Ella tiene un puesto de venta y una tienda en la feria de la zona 16 de julio de la ciudad de El Alto que se lleva a cabo los días jueves y domingo.  Muy al margen de la actividad que constancia tiene su esposo es propietario de un micro de 24 pasajeros de la cual recibe renta semanal, y esta movilidad se encuentra trabajando con chofer en la cuidad de Santa Cruz.  Regularmente su esposo es quien trabaja con la movilidad pero tuvo que volver a la cuidad de La Paz ya que ella esta esperando otro hijo el cual nacerá a finales de enero.  El mayor anhelo de ellos es poder ver a sus hijos profesionales.  Destinaran este crédito a la compra de nuevos fardos de ropa para incrementar su capital de trabajo. en la foto la Sra. constancia se eencuentra en compañia de su esposo.
texts.en:
Sra. Constancia lives in the District of Pampahasi Alto, which is located 20 minutes from the central part of the city. She lives in her own home along with her husband and a daughter who is of school age. Constancia sells secondhand clothing that she purchases in bundles from the traveling merchants who arrive from the city of Oruro each week. She has a vending post and a store at the July 16th Fair in the city of El Alto that takes place on Thursdays and Sundays. In addition to Constancia’s business, her husband owns a 24-passenger bus that is rented out on a weekly basis. This working vehicle comes with a driver and travels throughout the city of Santa Cruz. Her husband usually drives the vehicle, but he returned it to the city of La Paz since she is expecting the birth of another child at the end of January.

Her greatest wish is to see her children become professionals. This loan will be used to buy new bundles of clothing so that she can increase her operating capital. In the photo, Sra. Constancia is accompanied by her husband.

loans.use: to buy bundles of clothing.

loans.name: Mariana Del Jesús

texts.es:
En la ciudadela Municipal  de la ciudad de Portoviejo capital de Manabí, conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Nueva Estrella Solidaria.

Aquí conocimos a la señora Mariana, tiene 55 años  de edad y es madre soltera de tres hijos, dos de ellos ya mayores de edad y la menor de 18 años  que estudia en la universidad, todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa. Hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad.

Ella para sacar adelante a sus hijos hace nueve años puso  un pequeño taller de costura en su casa,  donde se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares que llegan hasta su local para que les confeccione sus prendas,  lo que más confecciona es ropa de dormir, también elabora sus prendas y entrega a ciertos  bazares para ser comercializados. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar, lleva más de 15 años dedicada a esta profesión.

Nos cuenta que en el crédito anterior todo marcho con mucha normalidad y que le fue muy bien, en cuánto a los pagos estuvo al día en todos los pagos y no tuvo ninguna complicación.

Está repitiendo el crédito ya que todos los créditos que ha recibido del banco le han ayudado mucho en su negocio y en su vida personal ya que sola ella tiene que solventar los gastos que generan sus hijos y su hogar, el crédito le sirvió para mejorar su negocio y con las ganancias que tuvo pudo cubrir ciertos gastos que generaron los estudios de su hija en la universidad, este nuevo crédito es para  comprar telas, hilos, botones y otros materiales para la costura. Ella es socia fundadora del Banco Comunal, es la presidenta y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido y responsable.
 
Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su taller de costura y que su hija sea una gran profesional.
texts.en:
In the municipal fortress of the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, (known for many years as "The City of the Royal Tamarind Trees"), the members of the New Star Community Bank for Development meet every two weeks. Here we meet Señora Mariana. She is 55 years old, and a single mother of three children; two of them are grown and the third is an 18 year old girl who studies at the university. All her children still live at home. Several years ago she took tailoring classes in a local academy. 

In order to help her children get ahead, she started a small sewing shop in her home nine years ago, where she works sewing all kinds of clothes. She works from specific orders placed by individuals who come to her shop to have their clothes made. She tells us that what she makes most is sleepwear. She works based on orders from individuals and also delivers the garments she makes to bazaars​​. She works every day from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m., and sometimes even later when she has orders to deliver. She has worked in this profession for more than 15 years. 

She told us that with her last loan everything went smoothly and that it turned out well. She was current on all her payments and there were no complications. She is repeating the loan because all of the loans that she has received from the bank have helped her greatly with her business and with her personal life. Since she has the responsibility to cover the costs of her home and for her children, the loan helped her to improve her business and with the profits she was able to cover certain costs associated with her daughter studying to the university. This new loan will be used to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other materials for sewing. 

She is a founding member of the communal bank and the president; she likes the group because it is very united and responsible. Her dreams are to continue moving forward with her sewing shop and that her daughter will be a great professional.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons and other sewing materials.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL PROGRESO”; este banco se encuentra situado a tres horas de la misma ciudad del Cusco, en el Distrito de Quispicanchis de la Provincia de Ocongate Departamento de Cusco.
La socia matilde; la socia tiene 31 años de edad; ella es casada, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de animales  menores la socia se dedica  a la compra de cuyes, pollos, gallinas, chanchos, ovejas y las cría las engorda y cuando están listas para la venta las vende, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de animales como ovejas, cuyes y pollos.
