So he's especially appreciative of the lending assistance he received from ACCION Texas Inc., as he found re-starting his business in a different state was a complicated endeavor. 

He employs 11 hair stylists and plans to hire more within the next year. In order to do that though, he will need a larger building in Austin's downtown. This, he said, may necessitate another loan. For the time being, Jesse is using the money to replace two styling chairs, purchase two TVs (which his clients have requested), and use the rest for marketing. The loan from ACCION Texas allows him to respond to clients' requests and recommendations. "It's all about them," he said. 

Check out his websites at: www.jaeundreas.net, www.jaeundreas.com or his Facebook page at http://www.facebook.com/#!/profile.PHP?id=100000778225617.

loans.use: To purchase styling chairs and TVs.

loans.name: Oyunbileg

texts.en:
Oyunbileg, 47, runs a grocery store in her backyard. She lives with her husband and her daughter in an old rental house, which is in the slum district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. For six years, she has been running her store successfully. 

Now, Oyunbileg and her husband have decided to start a new business, such as a cafe, in addition to their grocery store. But, they need some money to purchase the necessary equipment and cooking utensils. In addition, she wants to build working capital for her new business. The loan she is taking will be dedicated to covering the costs of purchasing things for her new cafe business.

loans.use: To cover the cost of purchasing equipment and cooking utensils for her new cafe business.

loans.name: Normilou

texts.en:
Normilou, age 31, earns her living by raising and selling hogs. She has been engaged in this business for six years. She is unmarried and lives with her child in in Taraka, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.

She has requested a loan in order to purchase additional piglets and pigs for her business.

Normilou became a member of PMPC just this year. In the future, Normilou hopes to build additional pig cages in order to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets and animal feed

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 40-year-old married man and a father of four children who live in Taiz, Yemen. He is a doctor who studied pharmacology science at Taiz University. 

He has been operating a pharmacy for six years.

He started his business by training in another pharmacy in order to get more experience, then getting a job. He strove as much as possible to get job in a company then tried to collect money so that open own pharmacy but unfortunately he couldn't. So he was forced to sell his small house in the village in order to make this business and improve his living conditions. 

He contracts with many doctors in clinics and hospitals to get the original medicines from them, so he has attracted more clients due to his being a professional in his field. He resells medicines for a more profitable price in his home city. 

Due to the bad situation in Yemen, he faced a financial challenge in his demand.

So, he took a loan of 100,000 Yemeni Rial (YER) from AMB in order to supply his business with good medicines and keep his customers coming back. 

In the future, he would like to expand his business to open another pharmacy.

loans.use: to buy good medicines and keep his customers coming back

loans.name: Sean

texts.en: From Kompong Cham Province, Sean, a loving mother of seven children, has been cultivating rice crops to make a living. She is very hard-working and often busy with her work in the field. In addition to growing rice, she grows vegetables and potatoes. However, she currently does not own a plantation for her potato crops. She rents the land from her neighbor in order to plant potatoes. Now, she is looking for some funds from HKL and Kiva to pay for the land rental fees so that she will be able to continue to use the land. She hopes to sustain her business and anticipates owning a plantation some day.

loans.use: to rent land to grow potatoes.

loans.name: Chruch

texts.en:
Chruch, 26, has been operating a retail business from her house, which is located in Baray. She sells many items such as household products, groceries, drinks, biscuits, and vegetables. From this business, she is able to earn an average of $4.80 per day to meet her family’s needs. She now lives with a lovely child and her husband, who is motorcycle repairman. 

Recently, Chruch’s husband has needed more spare parts to support his business and to satisfy his customers because his present stock of merchandise has nearly run out. So Chruch decided to ask for a loan from HKL to purchase spare motorcycle parts to sustain her husband’s business. She is very thankful for the quick responses from our kind lenders.

loans.use: to purchase spare motorcycle parts to sustain her husband’s business.

loans.name: Hong

texts.en: Hong is a local rice farmer who has been working alongside her husband on the same rice field in Kompong Cham Province. This family earns a low income from rice husbandry, therefore Hong spends most of her time working in a parallel business growing a type of bean to generate additional income. After the rice season has passed, the bean season arrives. Recently, Hong started preparing to grow her bean crop, so she would like to borrow some funds from HKL and Kiva to pay for land rental and to buy pesticides and bean seeds. In the future, Hong hopes that she’ll be able to purchase a medium plantation for her crop-growing business.

loans.use: to pay the land rental fee and buy pesticides and bean seeds.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.es: El señor Miguel tiene 65 años de edad, el es originario de una localidad rico en naturaleza con unos espectaculares paisajes y donde la gente es muy cálida y amable, donde también predomina la vestimenta y el lenguaje mazahua. Don Miguel se dedica a la compra de borregos y becerros desde hace mas de 15 años y dice que le ha ido muy bien con la venta de becerros y más en temporada de diciembre por las fiestas navideñas. Dice que en los meses de frio ella tiene que tener mucho cuidado con sus animales porque  se le enferman por las fuertes heladas que caen en la localidad. Dice que el préstamo le beneficiara a don Miguel ya que gracias a este podrá comprar otros 2 becerros y aumentara un poco más sus ingresos y con estos podrá tener una comida de fin de año bonita para poder invitar a su casa a sus hijos y nietos que son su alegría. Una de sus metas que tiene para su negocio es aumentar el número de animales para sacarlos a vender a otros lugares del estado y así le convenga  el traslado. Dice que gracias a la financiera su negocio ha crecido poco a poco ya que antes no tenía animales para vender.
texts.en: Miguel is 65 years old and a native of an area that is rich in natural beauty with spectacular countryside, where the people very warm and friendly, and where the dress and the language of the Mazahua culture are common. Miguel has been buying sheep and calves for more than 15 years, and he says that things are going very well with the calf sales and especially in December during Christmas celebrations. He says that in the cold months he has to be very careful with his animals because they get sick due to the heavy frosts that befall the area. Miguel says that the loan will help him since thanks to this he can buy another 2 calves, and he will increase his income a little more. With this he will be able to have a nice New Year’s dinner and invite his children and grandchildren, who are his joy, to his home. One of his business goals is to increase the number of animals to be able to sell them in other parts of the state and to move as he sees fit. He says that, thanks to the funding, his business has grown little by little since previously he didn’t have animals to sell.

loans.use: to raise and sell sheep and calves.

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 42-year-old, single mother of two children.

To earn a living, she operates a retail shop, which she has been running for the past three years. By doing so, she typically earns approximately 10,000 KES per month, which she uses to support her family.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced to the organization by a KADET staff member. Joyce would like to use the loan proceeds to buy a stock of sugar and rice for her shop. With the anticipated profits she expects to generate from the business as a result of the loan, she will educate her children. In the future, she dreams of opening up a wholesale retail shop.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of sugar and rice for her shop

loans.name: Lim

texts.en:
Lim is a responsible and a loving mother of five children living in Dongkor commune, an area distant from Phnom Penh City, where most Cambodian people prefer agriculture to other businesses. Lim is a widow who has tried hard to keep her family from poverty. She is a farmer who grows rice throughout the year. Recently, Lim has time off from rice growing and she is working as a maker of fermented fish paste. She buys fresh fish, from which fermented fish paste is made, in bulk from her suppliers. She has a daughter who always helps her in this business. She typically earns about $3.50 per day.

Lim is now taking out her first loan with HKL and Kiva to buy a motorcycle to improve the family’s living conditions and support the business. In the future, Lim wants to own a store in a local market to sell her fermented fish paste.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to improve the family’s living conditions and support the business.

loans.name: Maha

texts.en:
Maha is a 35-year-old married woman. She has one baby girl. 

Six years ago, Maha opened a shop for selling clothes in an active place, which gave her the opportunity to expand the shop's space during these years and add more clothes. 

Now Maha has applied for a loan in order to bring in more fashionable clothes and have a larger inventory.

loans.use: To add more fashionable clothes

loans.name: Abednego

texts.en:
Abednego is 55 and has been in farming for 15 years. He is married and has five children: two adults and three minors. He is currently running his farm with one farm hand and sells his produce of maize and vegetables in the local market. Besides farming, he runs a tailoring business.

Abednego has requested a loan of KES 36,400 from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He says the venture will spread his risk and provide necessary income and milk for family consumption. He is focusing more on his dairy business because of the constant demand for dairy products in the market.

He is aware of the challenge posed by fluctuations in market prices but remains optimistic that he will surmount them.

loans.use: to buy and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Lissette Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Lissette del Socorro es comerciante del mercado de León donde su negocio principal es la venta  de chicha siendo este un delicioso cereal extraído del maíz y listo para ser preparado en refresco. Se dedica por la tarde a la elaboración y en la mañana se traslada al mercado para su comercialización  al por mayor y al detalle empacando este cereal en las bolsas teniendo un buen aroma y color rosado muy particular.

El  crédito solicitado a Ceprodel será utilizado para comprar al por mayor maíz, leña, para la elaboración de chicha y así obtener  mayores ganancias, y eso le ha permitido colocar otro tipo de negocio a la par como es la venta de ropa interior y así ha mejorado su nivel de vida ya que es una madre soltera con dos hijas.
texts.en:
Lissette del Socorro is a merchant in the León market where her main business is selling “chicha” which is a delicious cereal extracted from corn ready to be turned into a beverage.  She spends afternoons making it and heads to the market in the morning to sell it at wholesale and retail. She also spends time putting the grain into bags,  which smell good and have a unique pink color.

The loan she’s requested from Ceprodel will be used to buy corn and firewood at wholesale to make chicha so that profits will be higher.  This has allowed her to set up another type of business at the same time which is the sale of underwear; this has improved her standard of living since she’s a single mother of two daughters.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, slips, socks, t-shirts, bras, stockings, etc.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Barbara es casada, tiene 3 hijos, actualmente es integrante en la alcancía comunal “Mujeres Emprendedoras” grupo  conformado por 5  socios que se dedican a diversas actividades de comercio.
Barbara se dedica a la confección y reparación de prendas de vestir este negocio surge a raíz de que su esposo viajo al extranjero para trabajar , es así que con el tiempo su esposo mando un capital y Barbara pone su negocio de costura poco a poco se fue comprando su máquina de coser, para Barbara nada fue fácil por que tuvo que trabajar muy duro y  a su vez cuidar a sus 3 hijos ya que su esposo se encontraba en el extranjero , con el tiempo Barbara cuenta con clientes fidelizados su negocio sigue creciendo gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a logrado mejores ingresos económicos, sus hijos fueron a la escuela, ha construido su casa, y su familia tiene una mejor calidad de vida,  con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para comprar mercadería(telas, hilos, etc.).
La Sra. Barbara  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los préstamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.

Nota
La señora Cristina es aquella que aparece en la parte superior de la foto con polo blanco, chaleco azul y una gorra.
texts.en:
Barbara is married and has three children.  Currently she is a member of the Mujeres Emprendedoras communal bank, made of up five members who work in various business activities.

Barbara works making and mending clothing.  This business came up as a result of her husband going abroad to work.  In time her husband sent her some capital and Barbara set up her sewing business.  Little by little she bought her sewing machine.  Nothing was easy for Barbara because she had to work very hard and at the same time take care of her three children since her husband was abroad.

Over time, Barbara has loyal customers.  Her business continues growing.  Thanks to her effort and dedication she has received better income.  Her children went to school, she has built her house, and her family has a better quality of life.

With the goal of continuing to grow, she has requested a new loan to buy merchandise (fabric, thread, etc.).

Barbara will realize her goals with a lot of work and effort, and the EDAPROSPO loans will help her.

Sra. Cristina is the one who appears in the upper part of the photo in a white shirt, blue sweater, and a cap.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (fabric, thread, etc.).

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
La señora Luz María es una señora humilde que se dedica a la venta de antojitos mexicanos como es: tacos dorados, enchiladas  y empanadas.
Tiene un hijo quien le ayuda comprandole todo lo que necesita para la elaboracion de su comida.
También se dedica a la venta de mercancia de abarrotes como son galletas,leche,cereal,cafe y detergente. 
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra de más ingredientes como es: chiles verdes, chiles  secos y maíz para la elaboración  de tortillas.
Le da las gracias a fundación por ayudarla y ser mejor persona.
texts.en:
Luz María is a humble woman who sells traditional Mexican fast food like tacos, enchiladas and turnovers.  She has a son that helps her buying everything she needs to make the food.  She also sells groceries, such as cookies, milk, cereal, coffee and detergent.

She requested the loan to buy more ingredients like green chilies, dry chilies and corn to make tortillas.  She thanks the Fundación for helping her be a better person.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make food.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 35-year-old, married woman residing at Tangub City, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She and her husband have six children.

To earn a living, Josephine owns and operates a general store, where she sells a variety of different products. She explains that she has been doing this for 10 years, and that she typically earns 3,000 PHP per month from this type of work.

She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,800 PHP to purchase additional products to resell. In 2010, Josephine joined GDMPC to gain much-needed access to financial services and to thereby improve her business and her family's living situation. In the future, Josephine wants to build a house and to help her children finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase additional products for resale purposes

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en:
Millicent, a 27-year-old lady from Migori, Western Kenya, is married to Owino and they have two school-going children. Millicent has been running a retail shop business for the last four years, earns a monthly income of KES.15,000, and is now requesting her first loan in order to buy retail stock like sugar, detergents and cooking fat. She will use her profits to repay the loan and pay school fees for her children.

Her dream is to have a variety of retail stock.

loans.use: to buy sugar and cooking fat.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en: Jeniffer, a 37-year-old married mother of three children, is from Nakuru where she has been operating a tailoring business for the past five years. Jeniffer is requesting a loan from KADET LTD  to buy more clothing materials to add to her stock in order to fill many more orders from people and schools.

loans.use: to buy more clothing materials to add to her stock.

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
La señora Georgina es madre soltera con una  hija su responsabilidad y viven una localidad pequeña en donde celebran la fiesta de san Andrés.

     El préstamo lo invertirá en la compra  de mercancía para surtir su negocio de abarrotes en donde lleva trabajan  seis años y le va bien ya que con ello ha mejorado mucho sus ingresos.
 
    Inicio por si sola para ir mejorando cada día mas sus ingresos y darle lo más necesario  a su familia.
Lo que más desea es que con ello puede  seguir trabajando para  así poder construir un lugar especial para su negocio.
texts.en:
Georgina is a single mom with one daughter in her care. They live in a small community where Saint Andres is celebrated.

The loan that she requested is to invest in the purchase of merchandise to stock her grocery store where she has worked for six years. Things have gone well so far and her income has improved.

She started the business all by herself to increase her income each day and provide necessities to her family.

What she most wants with this business is to continue working and and be able to build her own special spot for her business.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Ibrahima

texts.fr: Ibrahima est un homme polygame, marié à trois épouses. Il est père de 8 enfants dont les plus jeunes sont encore à l'école.Il pratique l'agriculture  exerce depuis plus de 30 ans,de paille d'arachide.Il vend en plus du ciment  devant son domicile.Ces activités lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille et de prendre en charge ses propres besoins. Afin d'augmenter son fonds de commerce, il sollicite un pret de 400000f pour acheter 200 sacs de paille d'arachide. Son ambition es de toujours élargir ses activités.
texts.en:
Ibrahima is a polygamous man, married to three spouses. He is father to 8 children of whom the youngest are still in school. He has been a farmer of groundnut straw for more than 30 years. He also sells cement in front of his home. These businesses allow him to meet the needs of his family and to take care of his own needs.

In order to expand his business, he is requesting a loan of 400,000f to buy 200 bags of groundnut straw. His goal is to always expand his businesses.

loans.use: to buy 200 bags of groundnut straw.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a 33-year-old married woman. Her husband is a businessman. She and her husband are blessed with two children: a 1-year-old, and a 10-year-old.

To earn a living, she owns and operates a boutique clothing business. She has been running this business for 10 years, and she typically earns approximately 18,150 KES per month from this line of work.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 60,000 KES to buy more clothes to stock in her boutique. The profits she generates as a result of the loan would help her educate her children, and the balance of such profits would be reinvested in her business. Her dream is to buy a lorry that she could use for her business, and she feels that KADET will help her realize her dreams.

loans.use: To purchase additional clothes for her business

loans.name: Benigna

texts.en:
Benigna is a 46-year-old, married woman living in Tangub City, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. She and her husband have one child.

To earn a living, Benigna works as a farmer; specifically, she operates a banana production business. She explains that she has been doing this for 20 years and that she typically earns 2,000 PHP per month from this work.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 2,294 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Benigna has been a member of GDMPC for 2 years. In the future, Benigna hopes to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers for her farming operations

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es:
La señora Claudia es una señora trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de  antojitos mexicanos como es: tacos dorados, empanadas, enchiladas, sopes y tostadas de tinja.
Esta felizmente casada con el señor  Rubén un señor trabajador  humilde y trabajador.
También se dedica a la venta de garrafones con agua por mayoreo y menudeo.
Tiene la cantidad de dos hijos, una  mujer y un varon quienes la quieren y la  apoyan en la venta de comida.
Ella pidió el préstamo para la compra  más ingredientes para la elaboración de comida como es: maíz para la elaboración de tortillas, chile verde, chile seco, quesos, cebolla y aceite.
Le da las gracias por ayudar a las mujeres que desean tener una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Señora Claudia is a hard-working woman who sells antojitos [typical Mexican snacks] for a living, such as: tacos, empanadas, enchiladas, sopes [fried tortilla topped with refried beans, onion and hot sauce] and tinga tostadas [shredded pork].
She is happily married to Señor Rubén, a hardworking and modest man.
She also sells demijohns with water at wholesale and retail.
She has two children, one girl and one boy who love her and help her to sell the food.
She requested to loan to buy more ingredients to make food, such as: corn to make the tortillas, green chilies, dried chilies, cheese, onion and oil.
She is grateful for the support that women, who want a better quality of life, are given.

loans.use: to buy supplies for food production.

loans.name: Hazell

texts.es: Hazell, habita en la ciudad de Granada tiene 24 años de edad, casada, madre de dos hijos de 5 y 10 años de edad respectivamente. Ella es comerciante, vende ropa en el mercado local de la ciudad. Inicio su negocio cuando su madre le sugirió que pusiera su propia tienda de ropa que la iba a apoyar con remesas ya que su madre iba a viajar a Estados Unidos así lo hizo su madre le envía una pequeña ayuda para que invierta en el negocio, la variedad de los productos atrae mucho a los clientes y mas cuando son de mucha utilidad es por eso  que la otra parte de capital que necesita para surtir su negocio la consigue atravez de financiamientos. La temporada escolar esta cerca y las ventas son muy buenas para esta época. Por esta razón solicita el crédito para comprar uniformes escolares y mochilas. La idea de ella  es ofrecer productos de mucha necesidad en su zona y mejorar las ventas ,ingresos del negocio para invertir en mercadería variada.
texts.en: Hazell lives in Granada and is a married, 24-year-old mother of 2 children, 5 and 10 respectively. She works in retail, selling clothing in the city’s local market. She started her business when her mother, who was moving to the United States, suggested she open a clothing store and offered to send her monetary support. So, she started her business and her mother sends her a little bit of money that she invests in her store. The variety of clothing she carries attracts lots of customers, even more when they have many uses. That’s why the other amount of capital she needs is to stock up her inventory and she hopes to get a loan. The school year is close and sales are very good during this time. That’s why she is soliciting a loan to buy school uniforms and backpacks. Her idea is to offer products that are in high demand in her area to improve her business’ sales and income, to invest in varied merchandise.

loans.use: buy school uniforms and backpacks.

loans.name: Berta

texts.es:
Berta es una madre soltera cabeza de familia de 1 hijo de 9 años al cual siempre le ha querido brindar todo lo que necesita. Berta anteriormente trabajaba como operaria en un taller de confección, pero al ver lo mal remunerado que era su trabajo decidió, desde hace 2 años, montar su propio taller de confección donde ofrece el servicio de confección a terceros. Berta tiene muy buena clientela, la cual le hace muy buenos pedidos, es por esto que su taller ha incrementado sus ventas considerablemente en los últimos meses. Berta ya puede generar empleo en su taller, por lo que allí trabaja con 3 personas más. Actualmente a Berta se le han ido incrementando más los pedidos por parte de sus clientes, por lo que ahora requiere emplear a una persona más en su taller. Es por esto que necesita comprar una máquina plana para poder brindarle la herramienta de trabajo a esta persona que necesita emplear, sin embargo, Berta no cuenta con el capital suficiente para la compra de esta máquina, por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de una máquina plana para brindarle la herramienta de trabajo a una persona que va a emplear en su taller.

Berta espera que su taller siga creciendo y siga empleando a más personas que requieran de unos ingresos y no tengan oportunidades laborales. Además, sueña con que su taller le pueda brindar ingresos con los que le permita ofrecerle a su hijo una mejor calidad de vida, una educación de calidad y una estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Berta is a single mother, and head of her family. She has a 9-year-old child, to whom she has always wanted to provide everything necessary. Berta previously worked as an operator in a dressmaking workshop, but when she saw how badly paid her work was, she decided two years to set up her own dressmaking workshop, where she offers dressmaking services to third parties. 

Berta has a very good clientele who place very good orders with her. This is why her workshop has increased its sales considerably in the last months. Berta can already generate employment in her workshop, so she works there with three other people.

At the present time, customer orders have been gradually increasing, so now she needs to employ one more person in her workshop. 

This is why she needs to buy a flat-stitch sewing machine, in order to be able to provide a work tool to this person that she needs to employ. However, Berta doesn't have enough working capital to buy this machine, so she hopes a loan will provide her the opportunity to purchase a flat-stitch machine to provide as a work tool to a person she is going to employ in her workshop. 

Berta hopes that her workshop keeps growing and keeps employing more people who need some income and don't have work opportunities. In addition, she dreams that her workshop can provide income, enabling her her to offer her child a better quality of life, a quality education, and financial stability.

loans.use: To buy a sewing machine, in order to provide a work tool to a person she is going to employ in her workshop.

loans.name: Guram

texts.en:
Guram, 36, lives in a small village in West Georgia with his family: wife – Eka, two daughters (14 and 11 years old) and parents. The main source of income for the family is agriculture, with Guram and Eka heading the family's business. They own a small dairy farm with two milk cows, and Eka produces cheese, selling on average 25 kg. each month. The family also grows citrus and maize on the family-owned 0.8 hectare plot of land. Guram’s father, a tractor driver, works seasonally in the village. The total average monthly income of the family is 700 Laris.

Guram, who plans to open a grocery store in the village as an additional source of family income, is requesting a start-up loan with which he will purchase grocery products for resale. Guram and Eka will work as salespersons in the store, and plan to purchase additional household goods to improve family living conditions, as well as finance the further education of their children.

loans.use: to purchase grocery products for resale.

loans.name: Amadou

texts.fr: Amadou est un homme marié et père de 2 filles et d'un garçon.Il exerce le commerce de bétail depuis plusieurs années.Il s'approvisionne dans les grands marchés hebdomadaires de l'intérieur du pays où les animaux coutent moins chers pour venir les revendre sur les marchés locaux. Son activité est assez rentable et génère des revenus qui lui permettent de subvenir aux besoins de sa famille . Il sollicite auprès de l'UIMCEC un pret de 300000f pour acheter 2 bœufs . Son ambition est d'élargir son commerce.
texts.en:
Amadou is a married man and father to two girls and one boy. He has been trading in cattle for several years. He gets his stock in the large weekly markets in the interior of the country where the animals are less expensive and resells them in the local markets. His business is fairly profitable and generates an income which allows him to meet his family's needs.

He is requesting a loan of 300,000f from the UIMCEC to buy two oxes. His goal is to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy two oxes.

loans.name: Bismark Oswaldo

texts.es: El señor Bismark es técnico electricista, tiene un taller donde ofrece sus servicios, ya es conocido por muchas personas por el buen trabajo que realiza, esta el solicitando crédito para equipar su taller con estantes para poner sus  trabajos que realiza y vitrina utilizara para exhibir lo que tiene a la  venta lo que compra en la feria de la 16 de Julio como ser alternadores y otros accesorios de autos que salen mas frecuentes en su taller  también equipara con mas herramientas de trabajo para desarrollar con mas eficiencia su trabajo, es una persona emprendedora con ganas de superación , tiene mucha clientela y con el tiempo de sea ampliar su negocio y poder contratar mano de obra a jóvenes que también aprendan del oficio.
texts.en:
Bismark is an electrician, and has a workshop where he offers his services. He is already known by many people for the good work he does. 

He is applying for the loan in order to equip his workshop with shelves on which to put the jobs he is working on, and a glass case for displaying the items he has for sale. These are the things he buys at the "16 de Julio" Market, such as alternator and other auto accessories, that appear most often in his workshop. 

He will also equip himself with more work tools in order to carry out his work more efficiently. He is an enterprising person who is eager to better himself. He has a lot of customers, and in time he wishes to expand his business and be able to hire young helpers who will also learn the trade.

loans.use: To buy equipment for his workshop.

loans.name: Nyevu

texts.en:
Nyevu is forty-one years old, married, and a mother of five children. For the last ten years, she has earned a living by selling fruit and vegetables in Malindi. She earns a monthly profit of KES 8,000. 

She was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our credit officers, and is applying for her fourth loan, for KES 30,000, to buy additional fruit and vegetables to sell to her customers. 

She will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay her children's school fees. Nyevu's goal for the future is to continue growing her business so that she will be financially stable.

loans.use: to buy additional fruit and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mawenzi Group

texts.en:
Faudhia, who is in her early 40s, is married with four children who go to school. She has been making and selling Batiki (tie-dye) clothes for ten years now. She works from 6.00 am to 4.00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will her 7th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase the stock of materials for her Batiki business and has paid back all her loans successfully. She hopes for a loan to buy more rolls of material for making more tie-dye clothes. Her dream is to one day become a designer.

She will share this loan with her loan group "Mawenzi" which has a total of 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back their loan.

loans.use: to buy more rolls of material for making tie-dye clothes.

loans.name: Humprey

texts.en:
Humphrey is thirty-four years old, married, and a father of three children. For the last four years, he has earned a living by operating a transport business using his motorcycle. He earns a monthly profit of KES 20,000. 

He was introduced to KADET Ltd. by one of our credit officers, and is applying for his first loan, for KES 30,000, to repair his motorcycle and start selling charcoal to his customers as a secondary business. He will use the profits made possible by this loan to pay for his children's school fees and continue looking after his family. 

His goal for the future is to continue growing his businesses so that he will give his family a good and stable life.

loans.use: To repair his motorcycle and to start selling charcoal as a secondary business.

loans.name: Cerilo

texts.en:
Cerilo is from Sebasi, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is fifty-one years old. Cerilo is married and has four children.

To make a living, Cerilo owns and operates a tricycle transport service. Cerilo has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately 2,500 PHP a month for these activities.

Cerilo is requesting a loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to pay for the cost of maintaining and repairing his motorcycle.

In 2009, Cerilo joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of maintaining and repairing his motorcycle.

loans.name: Adama

texts.fr: Khadim est marié et père d'un enfant qui est inscrit cette année à l'école primaire.Il exerce depuis trois ans, l'élevage de moutons et de poulets de chair.Il pratique également l'agriculture durant les trois mois de l'hivernage.Il entretient sa famille avec les revenus générés par ces deux activités et parvient aussi à subvenir à ses propres besoins.Afin de réaliser une nouvelle opération d'aviculture, il sollicite auprès de UIMCEC un pret de 150 000f pour acheter des poussins et de l'aliment volaille. Son ambition est d'élargir son activité.
texts.en:
Khadim is married and father to one child who is registered in primary school this year. He has been breeding sheep and chicken for meat for three years. He also farms during the three months of the rainy season. He supports his family with the income generated by these two businesses and also manages to meet his own needs.

In order to realise a new poultry farming operation, he is requesting a loan of 150,000f from UIMCEC to buy chicks and poultry feed. His goal is to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy chicks and poultry feed.

loans.name: Maria Isabel

texts.es:
Maria Isabel tiene 36 años de edad y vive con su familia en una comunidad llamada San Carlos, en la segunda provincia de Costa Rica, Alajuela. En una zona donde se ocupa el primer lugar nacional en la producción de café y azúcar de caña. Produce además granos básicos (arroz, frijoles, maíz), frutas, legumbres, tubérculos y hortalizas. Y en esta provincia está ubicado el Aeropuerto Internacional Juan Santamaría, el más importante del país.
Desde hace unos meses que Maria Isabel necesita una ayuda con los gastos académicos universitarios de su hija, la cual está estudiando y se está preparando para ser una gran profesora de religión y sera la encargada de llevar los principios a los estudiantes de la institucion donde este.

Es por eso que Maria Isabel está solicitando un préstamo por el monto de ¢500,000.00 (quinientos mil colones), esto para el pago de la matricula y la compra de algunos libros para que su hija pueda continuar con su carrera universitaria, asi se le facilite hacer sus trabajos y puedan llegar a ser una gran profesional.
Maria Isabel es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Comunal de El Encanto de Pital y es su primer préstamo, en una de las 150 organizaciones socias de EDESA en Costa Rica. Continuara creciendo a nivel personal y económico además de participar activamente en la organización de crédito en su comunidad.
texts.en:
María Isabel, aged 36, lives with her family in a community called San Carlos and located in Alajuela, the second province of Costa Rica. This area is the main coffee and sugar cane producer in Costa Rica, and produces also staple grains (rice, beans and corn), fruit, pulses, tubers and vegetables. In addition, the province hosts the International Juan Santamaría Airport, the most important in the country.

For several months María Isabel has needed financial support to pay tuition fees for her daughter who studies at the university to become a great professor of religion and be responsible for teaching the principles to the future students. This is why María Isabel applies for a loan of 500,000 colones to pay the registration fees and buy a few books that her daughter needs for her studies and so can pursue her academic career and become a great professional.

María Isabel is a member of the Communal Credit Company of El Encanto de Pital, one of the 150 partner organizations of the microfinance institution EDESA in Costa Rica. This is her first loan and it will help her to grow both personally and economically. She wants to be an active partner in the credit organization of her community.

loans.use: to settle her daughter's tuition fees at the university.

loans.name: Philemon

texts.en:
Philemon is twenty-six years old, a small scale business man, running a retail shop in Eldama Ravine which generates a monthly income of KES 3,000. He supports a family of two. He is planning to use the loan to expand the business by increasing the stock of items for sale such as sugar, soft drinks and sweets.

He has been in the business for one year and this is his first loan from KADET Ltd. His dream is to improve the living standards of his family and to widen the market for his goods

loans.use: To buy stock such as sugar, soft drinks and sweets to sell.

loans.name: Yuri

texts.en:
Yuri is forty years old. He lives in a small village in West Georgia with his family: his wife Khatuna, two sons (11 and 9 years old) and his parents. Yuri is a goldsmith. He has a small workshop, where he spends most of the day, working on various orders from his village and from nearby villagers. Khatuna works in a local cloth factory and gets a monthly salary. Along with the abovementioned the family is running small scale agricultural activities, which are one of the sources of the income for the family. They have a small dairy farm with one milk cow and a calf. Yuri’s mother produces cheese and sells it locally, in the village. Along with the dairy farm, the family grows maize and citrus on 0.2 hectares of family-owned land. The total average monthly income of the family is 750 Laris, including the monthly pensions of Yuri’s parents. 

Yuri requested credit to purchase food for the cow and calf, and also for fixing the cattle-shed, as the building is already old and needs some repairing. After repairing the cattle-shed, the temperature in the building will become higher and it will positively influence the milking capacity of the cow. Yuri’s family will sell more cheese and their income will increase. The family hopes that their income will be enough to finance the children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase feed for cows and fix the cattle-shed.

loans.name: Osfrideimis

texts.es:
Osfrideimis es una persona que se ha caracterizado por ser muy trabajador y dedicado a su familia. Desde hace aproximadamente poco más de 2 años, montó su negocio de variedades, y poco a poco lo ha ido combinando con el negocio de la confección, ya que su esposa confecciona y el exhibe las confecciones de su esposa. Osfrideimis es un padre de 2 hijos de 	5 y 2 años, a los cuales siempre les ha querido brindar una buena educación y siempre ha querido que crezcan con todas sus necesidades cubiertas. Gracias a que sus ventas han ido aumentando considerablemente, busca surtir con una mayor variedad de productos su almacén, es por esto que requiere la compra de productos de papelería, cacharrería y demás, sin embargo, no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder acceder a estas compras. Es por esto que Osfrideimis busca que un préstamo le brinde esta oportunidad de acceder a la compra de productos de papelería, cacharrería, entre otros y poder surtir su almacén con una mayor variedad de productos.

Osfrideimis espera que de esta manera sus ventas aumenten considerablemente, pues ofrecerá los productos que sus clientes le han ido preguntando y no tenía. Además, espera que con un aumento en sus ingresos pueda ofrecerles a su esposa y sus 2 hijos una mejor calidad de vida y una prosperidad económica.
texts.en:
Osfrideimis has distinguished himself as hard working and dedicated to his family. A little more than 2 years ago, he started his retail business and little by little he’s been combining it with a clothing business. His wife makes clothing and he displays it in his store. Osfrideimis is father to two children, 5 and 2 years old, to whom he has always wanted to offer a good education and all basic needs.
Thanks to his sales increasing considerably, he’s looking to stock up on a bigger variety of products for this store. That’s why he needs to buy paper products, crockery and other, but, he doesn’t have enough capital to access those products. That’s why Osfrideimis is looking for a loan that will allow him to purchase paper products, crockery and other, and stock up his store with a bigger variety of products. 
Osfrideimis hopes that by doing this his sales will increase considerably, as he’ll be able to offer clients products they’ve been asking for that he didn’t have previously. Also, he hopes to increase his income to offer his wife and 2 children a better quality of life and financial prosperity.

loans.use: buy paper products, crockery and other, to stock up his store with a bigger variety of products.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL PROGRESO”; este banco se encuentra situado a tres horas de la misma ciudad del Cusco, en el Distrito de Quispicanchis de la Provincia de Ocongate Departamento de Cusco.
La socia Guillermina;  la socia tiene 35 años de edad; ella es soltera, la socia se dedica a la compra y venta de animales  menores la socia se dedica  a la compra de cuyes, pollos, gallinas, chanchos, ovejas y las cría las engorda y cuando están listas para la venta las vende, la socia desea invertir el préstamo en la compra de animales como ovejas, cuyes y pollos.
La socia agradece la oportunidad del préstamo que le permitirá invertir en el negocio y crecer económicamente.
texts.en: This borrower belongs to the El Progreso (Progress) Community Bank, located three hours from the city of Cuzco, in the district of Quispicanchis, Ocongate province. Guillermina is 35 years old. She is single and works buying and selling small animals. She buys guinea pigs, chickens, hens, pigs, and sheep to fatten and raise and when they are ready for sale, she sells them. She wants to use the loan to invest in the purchase of animals like sheep, guinea pigs, and chickens. She is thankful for the opportunity this loan provides that will allow her to invest in her business and grow financially.

loans.use: buy animals like sheep, guinea pigs, and chickens

loans.name: Caren

texts.en:
Caren is fifty years old, married to Musa, and they are blessed with five children. Caren runs rental houses in the area of Sunton. She has been in this business for the last twenty-two years and gets an income of KES 22,700 per month.

She has got good credit history with KADET Ltd. and she is applying for her eighth loan of KES 90,000 from KADET Ltd. which she plans to use to renovate the rental houses. She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees.

She hopes to build more rental houses.

loans.use: To renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “EL PROGRESO”; este banco se encuentra situado a tres horas de la misma ciudad del Cusco, en el Distrito de Quispicanchis de la Provincia de Ocongate Departamento de Cusco.
La socia Teresa;  la socia tiene 29 años de edad; ella es soltera, la socia se dedica a la artesanía, la socia compra y venta artesanía, ella tiene como especialidad los tejidos y se está dedicando de lleno a comprar lana de oveja y alpaca, la tiñe con óxidos naturales y luego los hila en unos ovillos para después de esto tejer chompas, chalinas,  guantes, ponchos, frazadas, mantas, mantillas entre otros. La socia  solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de lanas y de óxidos para la elaboración de los diferentes trabajos.
La socia agradece la oportunidad del préstamo que le permitirá invertir en el negocio y crecer económicamente.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the Progreso (Progress) Community Bank, located three hours from the city of Cuzco, in the district of Quispicanchis in the Ocongate province. Teresa is 29 years old, single, and works in handicrafts. She buys and sells handicrafts. She specializes in knit items and buying sheep and alpaca wool that she dyes with natural oxides and later winds into balls of yarn to use to knit sweaters, shawls, gloves, ponchos, blankets, and more. She is asking for a loan to buy wool and oxides for making different kinds of items.

She is thankful for the opportunity this loan provides her as it will allow her to invest in her business and grow financially.

loans.use: buy wool and oxides for making projects

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a single lady aged forty. She has one child of fifteen. She is a business lady, owning a retail and a wholesale shop in Itambo location and has been in operation for a period of seven years earning a monthly income of KES 30,000.

Jane is borrowing her first loan of KES 100,000 from KADET Ltd. She wishes to use this money to purchase more stock of rice, tea leaves, washing detergents, wheat flour and maize flour at a wholesale prices to add to the stock she has for sale. The profits will be used to pay school fees for her child and to repay the loan.

Her dream is to improve the volume of her stock and improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, tea leaves and washing detergents to sell.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a twenty-seven-year-old clothes dealer in Mombasa, and a married father of two. He has been buying and selling clothes for the past eight years. His business is doing great.
 
This marks his first business loan from KADET Ltd to finance his business. With the loan, he plans to purchase more shirts, trousers and dresses to sell to his customers. He will use the anticipated profits to educate his children and repay his loan. 

He hopes to have bigger, more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more shirts, trousers and dresses to sell.

loans.name: Sammy

texts.en:
Sammy is thirty-two years old. He is married to Muthoni and they have two children. He has been running photocopy bureau for the last 12 years earning a monthly income of KES 15,000.

He is applying for his second loan from KADET Ltd. of KES 50,000. He plans to buy another photocopy machine and stationery for his business. 

With the anticipated profits he will expand his business and educate his children.His hopes and dreams of growing his business.

loans.use: To buy a photocopier machine and stationery.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is forty years old. She is a tailor who supports five members of her family. She has been in this business for two years and earns a monthly income of KES 4,000.

She has requested a loan of KES 15,000 to buy more materials for making clothes. The anticipated profit from her business will be saved and provide basic family needs. Her dream is to buy a plot in Eldoret and educate her kids.

loans.use: To purchase materials for making clothes.

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is a twenty-six-year-old charcoal dealer in Mariakani. She is a married mother of three. She buys and sells charcoal to the residents of Mariakani, a business she has done for one year. She is doing great.

This is her fourth loan from KADET Ltd. to finance her business. With the loan, she plans to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell. She will use the proceeds to educate her children and repay her loan. 

She hopes to have more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is fifty-two years old, and a widow. She has children older than eighteen who are all independent. She runs a grocery shop that has existed for the past five years and which gives her a monthly income of KES 20,300. she also sells second-hand clothes as a secondary business.

Ruth has requested a loan of KES 70,000 to buy more stock of assorted cereals for sale. The profit from her business will help her to open a hotel. Her dream is to create employment for others as well as to save enough for old age.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products to sell.

loans.name: Lidiya

texts.ru:
Лидии 29 лет,  замужем, имеет дочь и сына, дети дошкольного возраста.  Семья проживает в селе  Ак-Суу Московского района.
Лида родилась и выросла в селе Беловодское, в семье фермера. Окончив среднюю школу,   она поступила в педагогический институт в городе Бишкек, где она познакомилась со своим будущим супругом Сергеем. В 2003 году, будучи на третьем курсе, Лида вышла замуж. 
По началу супруги жили на съемной квартире в городе Бишкек. Окончив  учебное заведение,  они переезжают в село Беловодское к родственникам  супруга Лидии.
Как рассказывает Лидия, ее родители подарили им на свадьбу одну корову, таким образом, они начали содержать свое первое хозяйство. Со временем они стали приумножать хозяйство - супруг Лидии занялся полеводством, взяв  3 га орошаемой земли, на  которой они стали выращивать  зерновые культуры и люцерну. В селе Беловодское имеется небольшой маслозавод, который принимает молоко у местного населения и выпускает продукции в виде сливочного масла, сыра, творога, сметаны и т.д.  В течении уже более пяти лет, Лида сотрудничает с этим заводом и сдает им молоко. Благодаря  выручке от молока,  Лида и ее супруг  пополняют свое хозяйство - в настоящее время, они взяли  в аренду дополнительно еще 5 га земли, где выращивают сахарную свеклу, картофель, что является хорошей прибылью для семьи. Благодаря упорному труду, в 2007 году семья Лиды смогла купить небольшой дом в селе Ак-Суу с сараем, где содержат шесть голов коров, три  головы лошади, четыре головы бычков.
В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Лидия обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и  Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дополнительных голов скота. В ближайших планах Лидии – увеличить выручку от продаж молока, доходы направить на увеличение поголовья. В  будущем – Лидия планирует увеличивать хозяйство, чтобы иметь возможность дать образование в хорошем университете своим детям.
texts.en:
Lidiya is 29 years old, married, and has a daughter and a son, both of preschool age. The family lives in the village Ak-Suu in the Moskovsky region. Lidiya was born and grew up in the village Belovodskoye, in a family of farmers. After graduating from high school, she entered the Pedagogical Institute in the city of Bishkek, where she became acquainted with her future husband Sergej. In 2003, when she was starting her third year, they got married. 

In the beginning the couple lived in a rented apartment in Bishkek. After having finished the education, they moved to the village Belovodskoye, to Lidiya's relatives. Lidiya explains that her parents gave them a cow for the wedding, so they started their first business. Over time they started to expand their farm - Lidiya's husband became engaged in field crop cultivation, taking three hectares of irrigated land to start growing crops and alfalfa. 

In the village Belovodskoye, there is a small dairy factory, which takes milk from the local population and produce products such as butter, cheese, cottage cheese, cream and so on. For over more than five years, Lidiya has cooperated with this factory and delivered milk to them. Thanks to the revenue from the milk, Lidiya and her husband expanded their business - they have now rented an additional five hectares of land, where they grow sugar beets and potatoes, which gives a good profit for the family. 

Thanks to persistent work, Lidiya's family was able to buy a small house with a barn in the village Ak-Suu in 2007, where they keep six cows, three horses and four bulls. In order to further develop her business, Lidiya turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 130,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of additional livestock. In the near future, Lidiya plans to increase the revenue from selling milk, and use the income to increase the number of livestock. In the future, Lidiya plans to expand the farm, to have the opportunity to provide her children with education at a good university.

loans.use: to purchase livestock

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Thirty-five-year-old Abraham is married to Julia and is blessed with two children aged seven and five. He owns a retail shop that he started one year ago. His monthly income is estimated to be KES 7,000. 

He desires to purchase two bags of sugar, rice, a bale of unga (maize flour) and cooking fat to boost his stock, and that’s why he has requested a loan of KES 20,000. 

He will save the anticipated profit and buy goats to rear for sale. His dream is to buy a plot in Eldoret and thereafter to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: To purchase two bags of sugar, rice, a bale of unga and cooking fat to boost his stock.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is fifty-two years old, married, with six children aged 23, 22, 20, 17, 12 and 10. He is a maize-seller, a business he has done for two years. He earns a monthly income of KES 10,000. He wants to buy more bags of maize to boost his business and has requested a loan of KES 20,000. 

The anticipated profit will help him educate his children. His dream is to purchase a plot for his children as well as to educate them.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize to boost his business.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is thirty-nine years old, a single mother of four children aged 17, 15, 13 and 11. She has been in the taxi business for two years and earns a monthly income of KES 50,000. She has requested a loan of KES 30,000 to service her taxi.

The profit that she will make will help her repay her loan and meet her basic needs. Her dream is to buy another car as well as to practice farming.

loans.use: To service her taxi.

loans.name: Zulpiya

texts.ru: Зулпие 62 года, замужем. С 2000 года, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Зулпия начала свой бизнес в животноводстве со стартовой суммы в 20,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорству и настойчивости, на сегодняшний день,  ее хозяйство насчитывает шесть дойных коров,  двадцать овец, и четыре кобылы  и  приносит около 15,000 сом (KGS) в месяц от продажи молочных и мясных продуктов. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Зулпия обратилась в компанию «Бай-Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку породистых овец. В будущем, Зулпия хочет увеличить хозяйство и расширить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Zulpiya is 62 years old and married. In the search of a source of income for her family, Zulpiya started her business of animal husbandry in 2000, with a starting sum of 20,000 som (KGS). Thanks to persistence and perseverance, her farm today numbers six dairy cows, twenty sheep and four mares, bringing in around 15,000 som (KGS) per month from the sale of meat and dairy products. 

With a goal of further developing her business, Zulpiya turned to the organization "Bai Tushum & Partners" for a loan in the amount of 100,000 som (KGS) for the purchase of purebred sheep. In the future, Zulpiya wants to enlarge the farm and increase her business.

loans.use: to purchase sheep

loans.name: Erdenebaatar

texts.en:
Erdenebaatar is a 32-year-old married guy and lives with his family in a local district of Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia.  Both his son and daughter attend kindergarten, while Erdenebaatar has supported his family by operating a cashmere and wool manufacturing home business for 6 years with his wife, besides their full-time jobs at different companies. 

They produce pure cashmere out of raw cashmere by themselves, so the products are completely handmade and qualified. They make various products such as baby boots, slippers, hats, blouses and so on.

The business income is considerably high during the national holiday Tsagaan Sar, which is upcoming. Therefore, Erdenebaatar is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks) loan to purchase a variety of raw materials in order to make more products before Tsagaan Sar, the biggest Mongolian traditional national holiday.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of raw materials to produce more finished goods

loans.name: Helena

texts.en: Helena is a married woman. She has four children and all are enrolled in school. Helena operates a vegetable stall and sells her goods as retail. She's worked in this business for five years. Her primary customers are passers-by and neighbours. She describes her greatest business challenge to be scarcity of vegetables supplied in the market. Her highest monthly expense is food for the family. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water. Helena will use the 30,000 KES loan to purchase crates of tomatoes and potatoes. Helena aspires to expand her business in the future. She joined Yehu in order to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase crates of tomatoes and potatoes.

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es:
Luis Antonio es una persona casada y padre de 4 hijos a quienes siempre les debe garantizar su sustento diario. Luis Antonio se ha dedicado gran parte de su vida a la actividad de la agricultura y el ganado. En su tierra tiene 3 ganados de levante además de un cultivo de diferentes verduras. Gracias a esto, Luis Antonio puede generar los ingresos suficientes para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar. Luis Antonio vende sus cultivos a sus clientes, los cuales son fijos y siempre le hacen muy buenos. Con el ánimo de poder satisfacer los pedidos de algunos de sus clientes, Luis Antonio busca aumentar su cultivo para poder entregar mayor cantidad a de productos a sus clientes, es por esto que busca la compra de semillas y abonos para sus cultivos. Sin embargo, Luis Antonio no cuenta con el capital suficiente para estas compras por lo que tiene la esperanza en que un préstamo le brindará la oportunidad de acceder a la compra de semillas y abonos para incrementar su cultivo y poder cumplir con los pedidos de sus clientes.

Luis Antonio espera que sus ingresos sigan aumentando para poderles brindar a sus 4 hijos y su esposa una mejor calidad de vida. Además, sueña con que sus hijos tengan acceso a una educación de calidad y a un futuro económico estable.
texts.en:
Luis Antonio is married and the father of four children that he has to support every day. Luis Antonio has devoted a great part of his life to farming and cattle-raising. 
 
On his land he has three breeding stock, in addition to a crop of various vegetables. Thanks to this, Luis Antonio is able to generate enough income to meet his household expenses.

Luis Antonio sells his crops to his customers, who are steady, and always do very well from their dealings with him.  With the aim of satisfying the orders from some of his customers, Luis Antonio is seeking to increase his crop to be able to deliver a greater amount of product to his customers. This is why he is seeking to buy seed and fertilizer for his crops. 

However, Luis Antonio does not have sufficient working capital for these purchases, so he hopes the loan will provide him the opportunity to buy seed and fertilizer to increase his crop and be able to meet his customer orders. 

Luis Antonio hopes his income continues to increase, so that he can offer his four children and his wife a better quaity of life. In addition, he dreams about his children having access to a quality education and a stable financal future.

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer, in order to increase his crop and be able to meet the orders from his customers.

loans.name: Zahid

texts.ru: Zahid 39 let. On uje 8 let kak imeyet magazin dlya prodaji pishevix produktov. Zahid jenat i imeyet trex chudesnix detey. On ochen lubit svoyu semyu i ochen privazan knim. Zahid yavlyayetsya IDP personom (Внутренне перемещённое лицо (ВПЛ) - человек, который был вынужден внезапно бежать из своего дома в результате вооружённого конфликта, насилия, нарушений прав человека, стихийных бедствий или других катастроф, но, в отличие от беженца, не перешел международную границу и находящийся на территории собственной страны (источник: Управления ООН по Координации Гуманитарных Вопросов)). on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda, seychas jivet v Fuzuli regione vmeste so svoyey drujelubnoy semyoy. Zahid xochet chtobi v budushem odin iz yego detey prodoljil yego bizness. No seychas on nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi uvelichit pomesheniye magazina dlya razmesheniya bolshe nujnix tovarov.
texts.en:
Zahid is 39 years old. He has had his own grocery store for eight years now. Zahid is married and has three wonderful children. He loves his family very much and is very attached to them. Zahid is an IDP (internally displaced person) - someone who was forced to suddenly flee from his home because of an armed conflict, violence, human rights violations, natural disasters or other catastrophes, but unlike refugees has not crossed an international border and is inside the territory of his own country (source: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs).

He has been relocated from the town of Fuzuli and now lives in the Fuzuli region together with his friendly family. Zahid wants for one of his children to continue his business in the future. At this time he needs 2,000 AZN to increase the space of his store to hold more of the needed products.

loans.use: to increase store space.

loans.name: Dios Me Fortalece Group

texts.es: El Banco Comunal Dios Me Fortalece esta conformados por 13 emprendedores que ya han venido trabajando con Fundación León 2000, lo cual han demostrado ser personas muy responsable y dispuesta a crecer cada día en cada uno de los negocios. Cada uno de los emprendedores tiene sus propios negocios en cual uno a otros se apoyan y se motivan bridándose ideas de cómo mejorar. Mercedes Petrona es parte de este grupo de emprendedoras que desean salir  adelante, actualmente está solicitando financiamiento para invertir en el negocio en la compra de granos básicos, aceite, pan, huevos, jabón entre otros productos que le ofrece a sus clientes en la pulpería.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Dios Me Fortalece” is made up of 13 entrepreneurs that have worked with Fundacion Leon 2000 and have demonstrated themselves to be very responsible people and ready to grow their businesses every day. Each of the entrepreneurs has his/her own business in which they support each other and motivate one another by offering ideas to improve their businesses.
Mercedes Petrona is part of that group of entrepreneurs who wish to get ahead. Currently, she is asking for a loan to invest in her business by buying basic grains, oil, bread, eggs and soap, among other products, that she offers her customers in her store.

loans.use: buy basic grains, oil, bread, eggs and soap, among other products that she offers her customers in her store.

loans.name: Rawan

texts.en:
Rawan, a 24-year-old single lady, has six brothers and sisters. 

One of Rawan's brothers is also a college student; because of that most of the family's effort is going towards her brother's education, so Rawan decided to apply for a loan in order to continue her studies and pay for her semester's fees. 

After her graduation, Rawan hopes to get a job in the field so she can support herself and her family.

loans.use: To pay for her semester's fees

loans.name: Wafaa

texts.en:
Wafaa, 29 years old, is a housewife with three kids. 

For four years, Wafaa has been buying and selling clothes and blankets at home, where she concentrated on reaching every neighbor and let them know about her business to start a word of mouth chain as a way of marketing. Now Wafaa wants to open a small shop beside her house so it would be more appropriate for customers to come and buy rather than coming to her house. For that reason, she has applied for a youth loan.

loans.use: to open a small shop beside her house

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan is a 19-year-old married lady. Her husband works at one of the Jordanian universities. 

Hanan started a small home-based retail business almost a year ago selling blankets and clothes. Most of her customers are  relatives and friends. 

Hanan wants to expand her customer range to include more people from the neighborhood, but it will be difficult for her to have them in the time being in her house. 

Now Hanan has applied for a youth loan to buy more goods so she can increase her income till one day she can open her own store for selling clothes.

loans.use: to buy more clothes and blankets for sale

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Because Lina is a conservative person, she asked her brother-in-law to appear in the photo instead. 

Lina, 22 years old, is a housewife. Her husband works with the military.

Two years ago, Lina started a retail business selling blankets to relatives and neighbors. She wants to expand her business and add more products that also suit other seasons, like clothes. Therefore, she has applied for a youth loan to bring in more blankets and other products. Lina hopes that in the future, she can open a special shop for selling clothes and blankets.

loans.use: to buy more blankets and other products

loans.name: Anwar

texts.en:
Anwar, 21 years old, is a single lady living with her parents, brother and sister. 

Anwar is a university student majoring in mathematics. She is in her last year now, and is short of funds for her semester fees. So she has applied for a loan to pay them.

loans.use: To pay for her semester's fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her semester’s school fees

loans.name: Zuena

texts.en:
Zuena is taking out another Kiva loan of 40,000 KES. With the loan, she intends to start another business of selling charcoal by purchasing sacks of charcoal for resale. She dreams of expanding her business to meet her customers' demands in the market.

Thanks to Yehu and Kiva lenders for providing her with loans to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Maria Erundina

texts.es:
Doña Maria Erundina tiene 49 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 5 hijos de 23, 22, 18, 16,14 años de edad, de los cuales 2 de los menores estudian, y ella vive con sus hijos en Yoro.
Doña Maria, se gana la vida realizando una actividad de negocio de elaboración y venta de productos alimenticios como, especias, clavos de olor, culantrillo, achiote, productos de soya y papas fritas en bolsa, que con la ayuda de sus hijos ella surte las pulperías y negocios del centro de la ciudad de Yoro, desde hace 1año realiza esta actividad, elaborando 2 veces por semana.
Ha sido una mujer muy trabajadora, la cual ha podido sacar sus hijos adelante,  y ha logrado mantener su negocio debido a que sus clientes quedan satisfechos con el producto que les vende.
 En la actualidad esta  solicitando un segundo préstamo que es de 8,000 lempiras para poder invertir en compra de insumos para la elaboración de especias y condimentos y elaboración de las papas fritas.
Su meta es tener más demanda de producto y que sus ingresos aumenten para que sus 2 hijos menores  sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Doña Maria Erundina is 49 years old and a single mother. She has five children who are ages 23, 22, 18, 16, and 14. The two youngest children are in school. Doña Maria Erundina lives with her children in Yoro.

Doña Mara earns her living by operating a business where she makes and sells food products such as spices, cloves, cilantro, annatto, soy products, and bags of potato chips. With the help of her children, she is able to supply grocery stores and businesses in central Yoro. She has been in business for one year and makes her products twice a week.

Maria is a hardworking woman and has been able to help her children move forward. She has been able to maintain her business since her customers remain satisfied with the products she sells. Maria is currently requesting her second loan in the amount of 8000 HNL to invest in the purchase of supplies for making spices, condiments, and potato chips. Her goal is to create more demand for her products and increase her income so that her two youngest children can continue studying.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for making spices, condiments, and potato chips.

loans.name: Aseel

texts.en:
Aseel is a 23-year-old single lady, living with a family of seven members. 

Aseel is a student at Mutah University studying business administration. She is looking forward to graduating from the university and working in the banking field. 

But for now Aseel has applied for a loan to pay for her semester's school fees.

loans.use: to pay for her semester’s school fees

loans.name: Vines

texts.en:
Vines is a married woman. She has 4 children and all are enrolled in school. Vines operates a vegetable stall business and sells her goods at wholesale. She's worked in this business for 6 years. Her primary customers are her neighbours.

Vines's other source of income includes the selling of doughnuts. She describes her greatest business challenge to be the high cost of transportation and her highest monthly expense is food for the family. She rents a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

Vines will use the 10,000 KES loan to purchase sacks of potatoes and tomatoes. Vines aspires to purchase goods in bulk in the future. She joined Yehu to access capital.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes and tomatoes

loans.name: Los Exitosos Group

texts.es:
La socia perteneces al banco comunal LOS EXITOSOS; este banco está situado en el distrito de  Wanchaq en la provincia  de Cusco departamento de Cusco.

L a socia natividad tiene 52 años es casada y tiene 1 hijo; la socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de elaboración de chompas, chalinas, guantes, chullos entre otros, la socia lleva años en  este negocio el cual mediante este la socia saca adelante a su familia, pesé a la discapacidad que la socia presenta ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable.La socia en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de materiales como lana,botonoes,palitos de tejer de todo tamaño y grosor.

Los otros socios se dedican a la compra y venta de artesania, brindar el servicio de taxi, venta  de materiales eléctricos, venta de refrigerios, alquiler de habitaciones y tejidos.

La socia agradece este medio por el cual le facilita el crédito y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos.
texts.en:
The member featured in this description belongs to the communal bank "Los Exitosos," which is located in the Wanchaq district of the province and department of Cusco. 

The featured member is 52 years old, married, and has one child.  She alternates her daily activities with her business making sweaters, scarves, gloves, chullos (Peruvian style knit hats with earflaps), and other items.  She has had this business for a number of years, and this has been her means of providing for her family.  This member is a very hardworking and responsible person, in spite of her disability.  At this time, she is requesting a loan to buy materials such as buttons, and knitting needles of all sizes and thicknesses. 

The other members of this group work buying and selling handicrafts, providing taxi services, selling electrical supplies, selling snacks, renting rooms, and knitting.  

The member featured here is grateful for being able to access credit through these means, and she pledges to comply with the payment terms of the loan.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as wool, buttons, and knitting needles in a variety of sizes and thicknesses

loans.name: Nariman

texts.en:
Nariman is a conservative person, she asked her husband Haidar to take the photo instead of her. 

A year ago, Nariman, a 25-year-old married woman, helped her husband to start his own business to support the family; they opened a shop for repairing cars and changing tires. 

Now Nariman has applied for a youth loan to buy more motor oil and filters for the store to enhance their service.

loans.use: to buy more motor oil and filters

loans.name: Mona

texts.en:
Mona, 19 years old and a single lady, is a student at Jarash University majoring in English language. She hopes that after graduation she will work in the field to support herself and help her family.

 Mona has applied for a loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Saleh

texts.en:
Saleh, 20 years old and a single man, is one of six brothers and sisters living with their parents.

Saleh is the youngest among the male members, and although he is the youngest, he depends on himself to finish his school and pay for his daily expenses. He works at a restaurant following specific shifts and manages this with his university schedule. 

He is an accounting information system student, who faces a shortage in money to pay for his semester and for that reason he has applied for a loan.

loans.use: to pay for his semester fees.

loans.name: Hanan

texts.en:
Hanan, 21 years old and a married lady, has two kids. Her husband works in the construction business.

Hanan started her own business a year ago selling clothes to help her husband in supporting the family; specially since their kids are still young.
 
Now Hanan has applied for a youth loan to buy more quality clothes so she can enhance the products that she sells and therefore make more income.

loans.use: to buy more quality clothes.

loans.name: Suha

texts.en:
Because Suha is a conservative lady, she requested that her grandfather Hasan would replace her in the photo. 

Suha, 24 years old and a single lady, is a part of an eleven-member family, all living in the same house. Her father works in a private bank.

Suha is very attached to her grandfather Hasan who has been working in the goat- and sheep-sales for almost 20 years now. Now that Suha has grown up, she decided to help her grandfather and buy more goats and improve the barn, so she has applied for this youth loan to do so.

loans.use: to buy more goats and improve the barn.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad, 23 years old and a single guy. has two sisters older than him.

Mohammad is a student at Philadelphia University studying Financial and Managerial Sciences and hopes after graduation to find a job and start working for his future.

He has applied for a loan today to pay for his upcoming semester.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester.

loans.name: Niveen

texts.en:
Niveen,  a 22-year-old single lady is a sister to five brothers and sisters. 

Three years ago, her family helped her to open a small food market so as to have another source of income for the family, and they let her be the one in charge of it.

Now Niveen has applied for a youth loan to buy more food products to cover the neighborhood demand.

loans.use: to buy more food products.

loans.name: Said

texts.ru: Said uje 3 qoda kak imeyet etu gruzovuyu mashinu(Gazel) v kotorom on perenosit stroitelniye materiali a tak je domashniye mebeli i t.d. Said nujdayetsya v 2000 AZN chtobi kupi zapchasti dlya togo chtobi pochinit svoyu gruzovuyu mashini, tak kak seychas mahsina yego isporchena on ne mojet perevozit tovari, tem samim on ne mojet poluchit svoy mesachniy doxod, s chastyu kotorogo on pomogayet svoyey semye. Said 29 let. On ne jenat i ne imeyet detey. Said yavlyayetsya IDP personom on pereselenec iz Fuzuli goroda , seychas projivayet v Fuzuli regione. Внутренне перемещённое лицо (ВПЛ) - человек, который был вынужден внезапно бежать из своего дома в результате вооружённого конфликта, насилия, нарушений прав человека, стихийных бедствий или других катастроф, но, в отличие от беженца, не перешел международную границу и находящийся на территории собственной страны (источник: Управления ООН по Координации Гуманитарных Вопросов)
texts.en:
Said has owned this delivery van (Gazel), with which he transports building materials, furniture and so on, for three years already. Said needs 2000 AZN in order to purchase spare parts to repair his delivery van, as it is currently broken. Thus he cannot transport goods, so he can not receive his monthly income, which he often uses to help his family. 

Said is 29 years old. He is not married and does not have children. Said is an internally displaced person and he is an immigrant to the city of Fuzuli. He currently lives in the Fuzuli region. 

An internally displaced person (IDP) is someone who has been forced to flee his or her home due to armed conflict, violence, human rights violations, or natural or manmade disasters, but who, unlike a refugee, has not crossed an international border (source: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs).

loans.use: to buy spare parts

loans.name: Raquel Gabriela

texts.es: La señorita Raquel es socia integrante del banco de emprendimiento "punto calve"  se dedica a la venta de víveres en tienda de abarrotes y el crédito esta destinado a la compra de mercadería entre ellos un turril  propio de aceite para la venta en su tienda. Es soltera vive con sus papas en la casa de sus padrinos ya hace mas de  seis años el negocio tiene casi un año de existencia, empezó  repartiendo víveres ambulando por diferentes lugares pero con el tiempo lograron reunir efectivo ella y su familia y lograron continuar un negocio así fue como obtuvieron una tienda de abarrotes donde tienen  mucha clientela y son muy conocidas por la zona, se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
